Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Government Integrity
Activity Description: The Government Integrity activity will support the efforts of the Government of El Salvador (GOES) and civil society organizations (CSOs) to implement transparency, ethics and anti-corruption reforms and promote citizen participation. Activities will include: sub-grants and technical assistance to CSOs to develop innovative monitoring and citizen participation initiatives; training and technical assistance to the GOES' Institute of Access to Public Information; training and technical assistance to 14 municipalities to strengthen their access to public information units and ethics commissions; technical assistance for the implementation and oversight of GOES' commitments under the Open Government Partnership (OGP); and support for advocacy efforts for civil service reform and the implementation of merit based systems. These activities will align the CEN Strategy governance pillar by helping the GOES maintain transparent and professional governance structures.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Educar y Convivir: Familias y Escuelas libres de violencia
Activity Description: The mission of the project is to contribute to the social cohesion of Salvadoran communities through the transformation of schools into Integral Centers for Coexistence. The project will be implemented in 50 educational corridors within the municipalities prioritized in the El Salvador Seguro Plan (PESS). Each corridor will consist of at least two schools and three surrounding communities, with interventions that will last at least two years in each site.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Louis Berger Group and Black & Veatch Joint Venture
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Strengthening Local Governance for Security and Development in El Salvador
Activity Description: The USAID-funded Strengthening Local Governance for Security and Development in El Salvador project aims to build consensus around increased decentralization, enhance intergovernmental coordination, and strengthen the ability of municipalities to plan for, administer, pay for and deliver effective, responsive services in a participatory and accountable manner.  The project will operate at the national, intermediary and municipal levels. At the national level, the project will focus on improving national support and frameworks for decentralization. At the intermediary level, the project will strengthen intergovernmental coordination and foster inter-municipal partnerships. At the municipal level, the project will build the fundamental capacity of municipalities to effectively govern.

Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Building Safe Communities
Activity Description: Supporting youth in violent communities in El Salvador.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Democracy, Conflict and Humanitarian Assistance
US Sector Name: Rule of Law and Human Rights
Funding Account Name: Department of State, Democracy Fund
Activity Name: Promoting Citizen Participation in Public Policy in  El Salvador
Activity Description: Through this activity, USAID will contribute to the CEN by improving democratic governance and reinforcing the capacities of leaders and civil society organizations to participate in and influence the electoral processes. The activity is undertaking a set of interventions to improve civil society's influence on public policies in two areas: a) to increase civil society's ability to exercise their political rights in the electoral processes 2018-2019 cycle; and b) to affect public policy agendas at the municipal and national levels. USAID will do so by convening workshops with civil society organizations to develop policy recommendations for presidential candidates, and creating dialogue spaces for citizens and civil society to engage with candidates on these issues to shape policy platforms and inform the electorate.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Domestic Resource Mobilization Program
Activity Description: Through the Domestic Resource Mobilization (DRM) activity, USAID supports the GOES in enhancing public financial management practices, increasing domestic revenue mobilization and generating additional revenue for the public sector. USAID will use FY 2020 funds to support GOES financial management efforts as the country deals with loans and inflating expenses due to the COVID-19 outbreak. This activity will enhance transparency of COVID-19-related budgeting, anti-corruption and accountability efforts. It will also enable the maintenance of government funding and services to the most vulnerable segments of Salvadoran society that are likely to migrate. The activity provides technical assistance to the GOES Ministry of Finance (MOF) in tax policy, public administration, public expenditure and revenue management systems, and it works to increase dialogue between the government, the private sector, and civil society. It will facilitate technical assistance, training, direct IT support, and limited equipment support, to help the MOF implement a new financial management system. This will aid the GOES in developing a more efficient procurement process and reducing procurement costs.DRM will support both the Ministries of Health and Education in the implementation of a multi-year, results-oriented programmatic budget. Providing technical assistance, training and support from international advisors will allow management to make informed decisions on allocating scarce resources. DRM will also provide the MOF with recommendations tailored to mitigate negative economic and social impacts due

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: New Partnership Initiative (NPI) Incubator
Activity Description: The NPI Incubator will develop resources and training for local and underutilized groups, including faith-based, community, and civil-society organizations, so they can successfully compete for USAID contracts, agreements, and grants. The NPI Incubator will provide a self-assessment tool for new and underutilized organizations to better understand context-specific barriers that prevent them from working with USAID. The Incubator, which will be implemented by The Kaizen Company, will serve as a global service hub, providing resources for organizations to overcome barriers and implement effective programs.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: IMAGINA project
Activity Description: The IMAGINA Project: A new five-year crime prevention activity expected to be implemented by Fundacin Salvadorea para el Desarrollo Econmico y Social de El Salvador (FUSADES) and Fundacin Crislida (Glasswing) to provide a local citizens observatory of quality of life that generates reliable and comparable information about different quality of life dimensions, including citizen participation. The new activity will also support the renovation of Parque Cuscatln, a major park located in San Salvador, by establishing a trust fund with a local bank to manage private sector contributions for renovation and ongoing maintenance.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: El Salvador Competitive
Activity Description: This Activity builds upon lessons learned from prior development investments and complements current USAID/El Salvador activities to enable Salvadoran businesses to become more competitive in global markets  .The Activity helps the Government of El Salvador (GOES) increase productivity and competitiveness in key economic sectors. It strengthens small and medium enterprise (SME) development, public-private partnerships, municipal competitiveness, and the business enabling environment by encouraging private sector investment, innovation, and job creation, thus fostering economic growth. The Activity contributes to the Business Development line of action under the Prosperity pillar of the U.S. Engagement Strategy with Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Civil Society and Democracy in the Eastern Region Project
Activity Description: Through this activity, USAID will create a Center for Research and Training in Democratic Governance and Transparency at the Eastern University (UNIVO) with the aim of  promoting dialogue, discussion, and advocacy on key issues such as governance, corruption, and transparency. The implementer will partner with a U.S. university (to be selected during the first year of the activity) to both support the creation of this Center and train researchers and faculty members of UNIVO. The activity's objective is to strengthen the democratic culture in the eastern region which is particularly vulnerable to irregular migration and El Salvador in general. Moreover, it will promote civic education by training civil society organizations in analysis, discussion, and advocacy. Due to UNIVO's location, the focus will be primarily in the east of El Salvador, which has the added benefit of serving a traditionally underserved cohort of civil society.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Child Protection Systems Strengthening activity
Activity Description: The Child Protection Systems Strengthening activity will support the Salvadoran Institute for Children and Adolescents, the National Council on Children and Adolescents, and other key child protection actors to improve community-based support to vulnerable children and families. Weakened family structures, poverty, and a lack of adequate social services all contribute to the current citizen security crisis in El Salvador. A functioning case management system, standardized referral mechanisms, and community-level services are necessary to equip families and children with the tools they need to stay safe and productive in their own homes. Key populations will include returning migrant children and families, victims of crime (including trafficking), and children living in high-crime and high-out migration municipalities.

Activity Name: Hope Index Perception Survey
Activity Description: The survey requests the services of a local organization to carry out research tasks through household surveys and data analysis to help USAID/El Salvador understand public perceptions of the current and future conditions in targeted areas. Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Fortalecimiento de la Organizacin, Gestin Comunitaria y Dinamizacin de la Economa Familiar de 15 Comunidades Rurales de Santiago Nonualco
Activity Description: Rural residents in Santiago Nonualco, El Salvador, have limited economic opportunities to support their families and make investments that can improve their livelihoods, leading many to migrate. This is especially true for young people and women. The IAF supports community-led solutions that promote sustainable agriculture practices, create economic opportunities, and build the capacity of local residents to address their needs and priorities, particularly with the local government. IAF grantee Fundacin Santa Teresa (FUNDATERE) will promote the social and economic inclusion of women and youth to reduce migration push factors. The grant will strengthen their community-based development associations, provide vocational training activities and recreational opportunities for young people, and strengthen rural livelihoods that improve food security and generate income for families. It will deepen existing partnerships with the municipality and U.S.-based hometown associations and develop new ones to leverage funding for local development projects that residents identify as community priorities.This grant is part of the IAF's Women INvesting in Growth and Security (WINGS) initiative to empower women as business and community leaders as well as part of the IAF?s effort to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Fomento y desarrollo de la agroecologa en comunidades de la zona Norte de Morazn a travs de laEscuela Agroecolgica Inclusiva.
Activity Description: El Salvador has taken important steps to increase its populations basic educational levels, yet access to education that leads to a viable livelihood is still unattainable for many young people, particularly those living in rural areas. Lacking pathways to productive livelihoods, young people sometimes feel forced to turn to irregular migration. The IAF supports community-led solutions to enhance livelihoods, peace, and security. Our grantee partner the Fundacin Perqun para el Fomento de Oportunidades Educativas (PEOF) promotes community empowerment through education, providing educational services and curricula to community organizations in the department of Morazn with an emphasis on education, sustainable agriculture, and market access. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Conflict Prevention and Stabilization
International Purpose Name: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, International Assistance Program, Transition Initiatives
Activity Name: Conflict Early Warning, Mitigation and Peace Building
Activity Description: Reduce the threat or impact of violent conflict and promote peaceful resolution of differences, ensure conflict sensitivity so as not to exacerbate sources of violence and/or establish an inclusive framework for peace and reconciliation which addresses all key drivers and mitigators of conflict. This includes activities aimed specifically at atrocities prevention, as well as activities intended to transform relationships to decrease the likelihood of future violent conflict. Develop and support early warning and response mechanisms such as early warning models and response protocols; conflict analysis; monitoring mechanisms and peace structures at different levels; peace building communication systems; confidence-building measures; crisis-response planning and management skills at the local and national levels; and means for rapid and effective response in the event of crisis. Support quick-impact, outcome-based activities required to demonstrate the positive impact of a peace process, operation or other event, such as mobilizing small grants for communities and local/national governments; ensuring delivery of services (e.g. "ministry in a box"); bringing local and national government authorities closer to their constituencies (e.g., town hall meetings, consultations, production and dissemination of information); generating employment for potential spoilers; and managing expectations.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Health Policy Plus (HP+) project
Activity Description: The purpose of the Health Policy Plus (HP+) project is to improve the enabling environment for equitable and sustainable health services, supplies and delivery systems through policy development and implementation, with an emphasis on family planning and reproductive health (FP/RH), maternal and child health (MCH), and HIV and AIDS. It is expected that work across health policy, advocacy, financing, and governance, in a highly coordinated and collaborative approach and with attention to gender equality and equity issues, will be required to achieve the project purpose. This project will leverage previous USG investments in the areas of policy, advocacy, financing, and governance, preserve the progress made to date, and ensure progression toward stated objectives.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: El Salvador Competitive
Activity Description: This Activity builds upon lessons learned from prior development investments and complements current USAID/El Salvador activities to enable Salvadoran businesses to become more competitive in global markets  .The Activity helps the Government of El Salvador (GOES) increase productivity and competitiveness in key economic sectors. It strengthens small and medium enterprise (SME) development, public-private partnerships, municipal competitiveness, and the business enabling environment by encouraging private sector investment, innovation, and job creation, thus fostering economic growth. The Activity contributes to the Business Development line of action under the Prosperity pillar of the U.S. Engagement Strategy with Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Democracy, Conflict and Humanitarian Assistance
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, International Disaster Assistance
Activity Name: Capacity Building, Preparedness, and Planning
Activity Description: Improve the ability of the USG, host countries and other partners to prepare for and mitigate the effects of disasters, including both natural disasters and complex emergencies, taking into account the differences in men and womens freedom of movement and access to information. Activities under this component include any efforts to enhance the capacities of the USG (in Washington and in the field), humanitarian assistance providers, national host-country authorities, and local communities to engage in disaster reduction and response activities. Activities consist of standardized and coordinated assessments, monitoring, information sharing, data and situational analysis, joint planning; enhancement of coping mechanisms, including the capacity to address adaptation to constantly changing situations on the ground including climate variability and climate change.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Superate
Activity Description: This public-private alliance supports the prosperity pillar of the CEN Strategy by improving educational opportunities for underprivileged high school students with high academic scores. It addresses the lack of opportunities for youth and fosters broad-based engagement in crime prevention efforts. USAID will leverage private sector resources to open new and maintain existing Supérate training centers that emphasize development of information technology, English language, and life skills. Funds will be also used for providing services to current students and recent graduates, including career advice, assistance with employment searches, and facilitating continued involvement with Supérate as role models and mentors to disadvantaged youth in their communities. Activities will enable youth between the ages of 13 and 18 to develop critical skillsets needed to make a successful transition to higher education and/or promising professional opportunities after high school.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
US Sector Name: Rule of Law and Human Rights
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Justice Sector Strengthening Project
Activity Description: A five-year contract by USAID to implement the Justice Sector Strengthening Project in El Salvador. This is a follow-on contract to the task order that the Company executed in El Salvador from 2008 to 2012, and builds upon important accomplishments in the areas of community policing, assistance for the victims of domestic and sexual violence, and court administration. the Company will expand community policing activities to help reduce crime and violence. The Company also will work to improve case tracking and case management systems in the courts, develop inter-institutional protocols to improve the quality of criminal investigations, and establish victims assistance centers to provide medical, psychological and legal services for the victims of domestic and sexual violence. Finally, the Company will work with civil society organizations to enhance transparency and accountability in the criminal justice system.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Crime and Violence Prevention Project (CVPP)
Activity Description: The U.S. Agency for International Development-funded El Salvador Violence and Crime Prevention Project is addressing this troubling situation by improving the ability of communities, municipalities and national institutions to address violent crime. Building on Creatives success with violence prevention programs elsewhere in Central America, this five-year project introduces community focused initiatives in 55 Salvadoran municipalities. Creative is working with the government to finalize the National System for the Prevention of Violence Law and the National Strategy for Social Violence Prevention in Support of Municipalities, a vital document that sets country-wide policy and empowers municipalities to take the lead on prevention projects. At the municipal level, a complete diagnostic guide incorporates 13 risk factors developed by Creative. The program is also creating municipal observatories, which will collect and corroborate crime and violence data, and developing municipal crime and Violence Prevention Committees that will create action plans in their communities.By the projects end, Creative anticipates a higher level of safety for Salvadorans living in the 55 target municipalities, as well as stronger community, municipal and national structures that are able to respond to and prevent violent crime.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Reconstruction of the Jose Maria Peralta Lagos School in Quetzaltepeque
Activity Description: The objective of this Cooperative Agreement is to procure and execute the design, construction supervision and actual construction of the "I.N. Jose Maria Peralta Lagos" (JMPL) School in La Libertad, El Salvador under the USAID Tropical Storm Ida Reconstruction Project. This Cooperative Agreement includes an integral approach that involves architectural and engineering services, strengthened community resilience by means of competency development in disaster risk reduction, climate change adaptation, migration education, and related community engagement activities.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: El Salvador Competitive
Activity Description: This Activity builds upon lessons learned from prior development investments and complements current USAID/El Salvador activities to enable Salvadoran businesses to become more competitive in global markets  .The Activity helps the Government of El Salvador (GOES) increase productivity and competitiveness in key economic sectors. It strengthens small and medium enterprise (SME) development, public-private partnerships, municipal competitiveness, and the business enabling environment by encouraging private sector investment, innovation, and job creation, thus fostering economic growth. The Activity contributes to the Business Development line of action under the Prosperity pillar of the U.S. Engagement Strategy with Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Louis Berger Group and Black & Veatch Joint Venture
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Strengthening Local Governance for Security and Development in El Salvador
Activity Description: The USAID-funded Strengthening Local Governance for Security and Development in El Salvador project aims to build consensus around increased decentralization, enhance intergovernmental coordination, and strengthen the ability of municipalities to plan for, administer, pay for and deliver effective, responsive services in a participatory and accountable manner.  The project will operate at the national, intermediary and municipal levels. At the national level, the project will focus on improving national support and frameworks for decentralization. At the intermediary level, the project will strengthen intergovernmental coordination and foster inter-municipal partnerships. At the municipal level, the project will build the fundamental capacity of municipalities to effectively govern.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Humanitarian Assistance
International Purpose Name: Relief co-ordination; protection and support services
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, International Disaster Assistance
Activity Name: Food Assistance
Activity Description: Seeks to improve food security and nutrition between 2017 and 2021. It is designed to assist the Government and partners in achieving the following outcomes: Strategic outcome 1: The most vulnerable households have access to effective, productive and nutrition-sensitive social protection by 2021. Strategic outcome 2: Food-insecure smallholder farmers and their organizations sustainably increase their productivity and income by 2021..Strategic outcome 3: Targeted populations and communities in the most food-insecure areas have increased resilience to climate change by 2021. Strategic outcome 4: Targeted people affected by rapid- and slow-onset disasters have access to food all year. Strategic outcome 5: National and subnational institutions have strengthened capacity to manage food security and nutrition policies and programmes by 2021.

Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: IMAGINA project
Activity Description: The IMAGINA Project: A new five-year crime prevention activity expected to be implemented by Fundacin Salvadorea para el Desarrollo Econmico y Social de El Salvador (FUSADES) and Fundacin Crislida (Glasswing) to provide a local citizens observatory of quality of life that generates reliable and comparable information about different quality of life dimensions, including citizen participation. The new activity will also support the renovation of Parque Cuscatln, a major park located in San Salvador, by establishing a trust fund with a local bank to manage private sector contributions for renovation and ongoing maintenance.

Each corridor will consist of at least two schools and three surrounding communities, with interventions that will last at least two years in each site.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Private Sector Productivity
Activity Description: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

Activity Name: Strengthening Care and Treatment Cascade
Activity Description: The objective of this activity is to support countries to ensure that all eligible people living with HIV are on treatment and achieve viral suppression through high quality and discrimination free care and treatment services.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Domestic Resource Mobilization Program
Activity Description: Through the Domestic Resource Mobilization (DRM) activity, USAID supports the GOES in enhancing public financial management practices, increasing domestic revenue mobilization and generating additional revenue for the public sector. USAID will use FY 2020 funds to support GOES financial management efforts as the country deals with loans and inflating expenses due to the COVID-19 outbreak. This activity will enhance transparency of COVID-19-related budgeting, anti-corruption and accountability efforts. It will also enable the maintenance of government funding and services to the most vulnerable segments of Salvadoran society that are likely to migrate. The activity provides technical assistance to the GOES Ministry of Finance (MOF) in tax policy, public administration, public expenditure and revenue management systems, and it works to increase dialogue between the government, the private sector, and civil society. It will facilitate technical assistance, training, direct IT support, and limited equipment support, to help the MOF implement a new financial management system. This will aid the GOES in developing a more efficient procurement process and reducing procurement costs.DRM will support both the Ministries of Health and Education in the implementation of a multi-year, results-oriented programmatic budget. Providing technical assistance, training and support from international advisors will allow management to make informed decisions on allocating scarce resources. DRM will also provide the MOF with recommendations tailored to mitigate negative economic and social impacts due

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Government Integrity
Activity Description: The Government Integrity activity will support the efforts of the Government of El Salvador (GOES) and civil society organizations (CSOs) to implement transparency, ethics and anti-corruption reforms and promote citizen participation. Activities will include: sub-grants and technical assistance to CSOs to develop innovative monitoring and citizen participation initiatives; training and technical assistance to the GOES' Institute of Access to Public Information; training and technical assistance to 14 municipalities to strengthen their access to public information units and ethics commissions; technical assistance for the implementation and oversight of GOES' commitments under the Open Government Partnership (OGP); and support for advocacy efforts for civil service reform and the implementation of merit based systems. These activities will align the CEN Strategy governance pillar by helping the GOES maintain transparent and professional governance structures.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Promoting Citizen Participation in Public Policy in  El Salvador
Activity Description: Through this activity, USAID will contribute to the CEN by improving democratic governance and reinforcing the capacities of leaders and civil society organizations to participate in and influence the electoral processes. The activity is undertaking a set of interventions to improve civil society's influence on public policies in two areas: a) to increase civil society's ability to exercise their political rights in the electoral processes 2018-2019 cycle; and b) to affect public policy agendas at the municipal and national levels. USAID will do so by convening workshops with civil society organizations to develop policy recommendations for presidential candidates, and creating dialogue spaces for citizens and civil society to engage with candidates on these issues to shape policy platforms and inform the electorate.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Child Protection Systems Strengthening activity
Activity Description: The Child Protection Systems Strengthening activity will support the Salvadoran Institute for Children and Adolescents, the National Council on Children and Adolescents, and other key child protection actors to improve community-based support to vulnerable children and families. Weakened family structures, poverty, and a lack of adequate social services all contribute to the current citizen security crisis in El Salvador. A functioning case management system, standardized referral mechanisms, and community-level services are necessary to equip families and children with the tools they need to stay safe and productive in their own homes. Key populations will include returning migrant children and families, victims of crime (including trafficking), and children living in high-crime and high-out migration municipalities.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Global Health
US Sector Name: Pandemic Influenza and Other Emerging Threats (PIOET)
Funding Account Name: Department of State, Global Health Programs
Activity Name: TMEC: Meeting Targets and Maintaining Epidemic Control (EpiC)
Activity Description: Meeting Targets and Maintaining Epidemic Control (TMEC) will help meet or exceed PEPFAR targets for reaching adults, key, and priority populations by finding those who have not yet been identified as positive, linking those who are positive to treatment, and by keeping those on treatment virally suppressed. This mechanism will work with a range of stakeholders to ensure that host government health systems and host countries in general are able to maintain program gains with appropriately decreasing dependence on PEPFAR/USAID. EpiC can support USAID's response to address COVID-19, by preventing, preparing for, responding to, and bolstering health systems to address COVID-19 and re-emergence. Within the scope, EpiC can support Pillar 2 activities, including emergency health response, strengthening global health security in affected countries, and health systems support.

Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Infrastructure Project
Activity Description: The Coastal Highway Expansion Activity seeks to relieve congestion at the most-trafficked segment of El Salvador?s coastal highway (?CA-2?). The CA-2 is one of the two most important logistical corridors in the country and connects the country?s major logistical nodes, including its two sea ports (La Union and Acajutla) and SAL. The Activity will finance three segments of CA-2: the 7.22 kilometer segment from Comalapa to La Herradura, the 16.98 kilometer segment from La Herradura to Zacatecoluca, and the 2.97 kilometer segment from La Libertad intersection to the Comapala Airport Road intersection.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Interagency Agreement between USAID/GH and U.S. Census Bureau
Activity Description: The Interagency Agreement (IAA) with the US Census Bureau (USCB) (PRH) seeks to increase the quality, quantity, and utility of country-level data to support the 2020 Round of Censuses and the data requirements of SDGs. This IAA strengthens the capability of statistical offices in developing countries to collect, analyze, disseminate, and use data to increase understanding of population structure and demographic trends and their implications for development planning and policy-making. Emphasis is placed on capacity building; technical assistance provided through this IAA can be in support of the census, surveys, or general institutional capacity building..

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Global Health
US Sector Name: Pandemic Influenza and Other Emerging Threats (PIOET)
Funding Account Name: Department of State, Global Health Programs
Activity Name: Health Policy Plus (HP+) project
Activity Description: The purpose of the Health Policy Plus (HP+) project is to improve the enabling environment for equitable and sustainable health services, supplies and delivery systems through policy development and implementation, with an emphasis on family planning and reproductive health (FP/RH), maternal and child health (MCH), and HIV and AIDS. It is expected that work across health policy, advocacy, financing, and governance, in a highly coordinated and collaborative approach and with attention to gender equality and equity issues, will be required to achieve the project purpose. This project will leverage previous USG investments in the areas of policy, advocacy, financing, and governance, preserve the progress made to date, and ensure progression toward stated objectives.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Latin American and Caribbean Network of Fair Trade Small Producers and Workers
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Coordinadora Latinoamericana y del Caribe de Pequeos Productores y Trabajadores de Comercio Justo
Activity Description: Small producers have experienced increased production and transportation costs due to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. They have also had limited access to financial or technical assistance to recover and invest in resilience to future crises. Fundacin Coordinadora Latinoamericana y del Caribe de Pequeos Productores y Trabajadores de Comercio Justo (CLAC), the Latin American representative of Fairtrade International's certified producers, will establish a joint COVID-19 recovery fund with the IAF that will support grassroots producer organizations from 20 countries in Latin America and the Caribbean that are Fairtrade certified or aligned with fair trade principles. The fund will finance creative local solutions that help producer groups and their communities recover from the impact of COVID-19 on their livelihoods and increase their economic resilience. This grant is part of the IAF's broader COVID-19 response strategy.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: FORTALECIMIENTO DE LAS CAPACIDADES ORGANIZATIVAS DE LOS JVENES, CON INICIATIVAS DE EMPRENDIMIENTOS ECONMICOS Y ENFOQUE DE GNERO EN 6 MUNICIPIOS DE LA ZONA NORTE DE MORAZN
Activity Description: Young people between the ages of 18-26 have the highest rates of unemployment in El Salvador. Youth have relatively low levels of civil engagement and are often stigmatized as being criminals. At the IAF we support community-led solutions to enhance peace and security. Our grantee partner the Fundacin Segundo Montes (FSM) assists young people to improve their communities in the municipalities of Meanguera Jocoaitique and San Fernando in the department of Morazn by training them in leadership strengthening youth-led organizations and supporting youth-led microenterprises. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Global Health
US Sector Name: Pandemic Influenza and Other Emerging Threats (PIOET)
Funding Account Name: Department of State, Global Health Programs
Activity Name: TMEC: Meeting Targets and Maintaining Epidemic Control (EpiC)
Activity Description: Meeting Targets and Maintaining Epidemic Control (TMEC) will help meet or exceed PEPFAR targets for reaching adults, key, and priority populations by finding those who have not yet been identified as positive, linking those who are positive to treatment, and by keeping those on treatment virally suppressed. This mechanism will work with a range of stakeholders to ensure that host government health systems and host countries in general are able to maintain program gains with appropriately decreasing dependence on PEPFAR/USAID. EpiC can support USAID's response to address COVID-19, by preventing, preparing for, responding to, and bolstering health systems to address COVID-19 and re-emergence. Within the scope, EpiC can support Pillar 2 activities, including emergency health response, strengthening global health security in affected countries, and health systems support.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Instituto Salvadoreo de Educacin Cooperativa y Agricultura Orgnica
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Rescate del sistema milpa para la seguridad alimentaria de familias agricultoras de los municipios de Atiquizaya, Turn y San Lorenzo, departamento de Ahuachapn, El Salvador.
Activity Description: Unsustainable production practices have put the health and food security of smallholder farmers and their families at risk in Ahuachapan, El Salvador. The IAF supports community-led solutions to increase incomes and promote sustainable agriculture and food security. Our grantee partner the Asociacin Instituto Salvadoreo de Educacin Cooperativa y Agricultura Orgnica (ISEAC) works in six rural communities in the department of Ahuachapn to strengthen agricultural practices, such as increasing diversification and organic production, to boost food security and increase collaboration between producers to enhance their livelihoods. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacion para el Desarrollo Socioeconomico y Restauracion Ambiental
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Economic autonomy and food security via agroecology to promote youth and women of the indigenous community of Nahuizalco, Sonsonate, El Salvador
Activity Description: Living conditions and income-generating opportunities are poor for Nhuatl Pipil residentsespecially for women and young people. Fundacin para el Desarrollo Socioeconmico y Restauracin Ambiental (FUNDESYRAM) provides organizational, business, and technical assistance to farmers on sustainable farming practices, vegetable gardens, and small animal production. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to expand economic opportunity in El Salvador. FUNDESYRAM's activities promote smallholder agriculture and food production to enhance food security and ensure meaningful opportunities for communities to thrive. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America. This amendment provides FUNDESYRAM an additional 12 months and $241,210 to strengthen the organic production and marketing practices of Nhuatl Pipil indigenous communities. FUNDESYRAM will also strengthen a national sustainable agriculture network in its agricultural and marketing practices, as well as expanding its organizational, communicational, and educational capacity. As part of the amendment, FUNDESYRAM is mobilizing an additional $645,346 in counterpart funding to the grant agreement.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Cooperativa de Comercializacin y Produccin Agrcola Compaero Erick de R.L.
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Strengthening Production, Productivity, Processing and Marketing of Basic Grains in the department of Usulutn.
Activity Description: Smallholder farmers in El Salvador face a number of challenges to grow and process their crops, assure better nutrition for their families, and access markets. Asociacin Cooperativa de Comercializacin y Produccin Agrcola Compaero Erick (ACOPROERICK) trains and provides technical assistance in organic production of basic grains, fruits, and vegetables. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to expand economic opportunity in El Salvador. ACOPROERICK's activities support smallholder agriculture and food production to enhance food security, improve farmer's income, and ensure meaningful opportunities for communities to thrive. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacion Museo de la Palabra y la Imagen
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Ciudadana participativa y responsable frente a los desafos del Covid-19
Activity Description: In the departments of San Salvador and La Libertad, El Salvador, which were already suffering from chronic violence, the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic were particularly devastating. The effects were particularly severe for students, as the pandemic limited their access to education and other services. The IAF supports community-led approaches to enhance peace and security. Our grantee Fundacin Museo de la Palabra y la Imagen (MUPI) is carrying out a participatory community project that enables community members to assess the impact of the pandemic on their lives, with the goal of helping them rebuild frayed social connections and build resilience to disasters. MUPI will create a museum exhibit on the effects of COVID-19, providing materials and training to teachers in public schools to reflect on the COVID-19 pandemic with their students and better prepare for future shocks. The museum is also establishing sanitary protocols and purchasing supplies so that the museum can safely and effectively attend the general public. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America and IAF's broader COVID-19 response strategy.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Centro de Estudios de la Diversidad Sexual y Genrica
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Inclusin, Derechos y Desarrollo: Generando oportunidades inclusivas tras la emergencia sanitaria por la COVID-19 en el Oriente de El Salvador.
Activity Description: The LGBTQ+ community and other vulnerable groups in El Salvador face high levels of economic and social exclusion, particularly those outside the capital metropolitan area. This exclusion negatively affects their access to public institutions and services, impacting their ability to earn a living and exercise their human rights. The IAF supports community-led solutions to create economic and social opportunities in historically marginalized communities. IAF Grantee Asociacin Centro de Estudios de la Diversidad Sexual y Genrica  AMATE El Salvador (AMATE) is partnering with grassroots groups to strengthen local civil society organizations that help LGBTQ+ people, women, people with disabilities, and youth in eastern El Salvador increase their economic opportunities, access to public and private services, and protections for their political, social, and civil rights. This grant is part of the IAFs Women INvesting in Growth and Security (WINGS) initiative to empower women as business and community leaders and the IAFs efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Centro Cultural y de las Artes Monseor scar Arnulfo Romero
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Young people strengthening their psychosocial and artistic skills, towards a culture of peace.
Activity Description: Children and young people in El Salvador often choose to join gangs or migrate elsewhere in response to their countrys high levels of violence, limited education and leadership opportunities, and lack of safe spaces for youth to socialize and learn peacefully. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to promote peace and security and provide alternatives to gang membership and irregular migration. Our grantee partner, Centro Cultural de las Artes Monseor Arnulfo Romero (CLAMOR), is offering art, music, and dance classes to children and young people in Nueva Concepcin to bolster their life skills and create a safe, peaceful space for them to gather, express themselves, and learn. CLAMOR will also provide them with training in leadership, conflict management, and human rights to build their resilience and reduce their likelihood of migration. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Cooperativa de Produccin Agropecuaria Upatoro
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Reactivacin de la cadena Apcola y Emprendimientos Juveniles, en cinco municipios del departamento de Usulutn, El Salvador
Activity Description: Producers in Usulutanespecially young people and womenare some of the poorest in El Salvador, with limited economic opportunities to support their families. They also have few resources with which to improve their resilience to increasing periods of drought and intense storms. The IAF supports community-led solutions that promote sustainable agriculture practices, create economic opportunities, and strengthen resilience to extreme weather events. IAF grantee Asociacin Cooperativa de Produccin Agropecuaria de Usulutn (ACOPAU) is a youth and women-led cooperative that is expanding the sustainable production and sale of honey and value-added products such as candles and shampoos to increase members incomes. This grant is part of the IAFs Women INvesting in Growth and Security (WINGS) initiative to empower women as business and community leaders and efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America.

Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Cincahuite para el Desarrollo Integral de las Comunidades del Sector Puerto Parada-Baha de Jiquilisco
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Improving the livelihoods of fishers and their families through community-led natural resource management and income generation in Puerto Parada, Usulutn
Activity Description: The dwindling supply of local fish in the Jiquilisco Bay creates challenges for Puerto Parada fishing families who depend on this natural resource for their way of life. Asociacin Cincahuite para el Desarrollo Integral de las Comunidades del Sector Puerto Parada-Baha de Jiquilisco (CINCAHUITE) helps implement a natural resource management plan that prioritizes fish repopulation fishing cooperatives and a certificate training program on resilience to environmental degradation. At the IAF we support community-led solutions to expand economic opportunity in El Salvador. CINCAHUITE's activities encourage small business growth local entrepreneurship and market development to ensure meaningful opportunities for communities to thrive. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean

Activity Name: T-Digital Technical Assistance-Digital Frontiers
Activity Description: This activity will increase the use of and access to digital financial services, mobile and internet, and increase the use of data for strategic planning and adaptive programming within USAID Missions and Bureaus. This mechanism will work with Missions and Bureaus to conduct diagnostic services, program design and implementation, research projects, and to develop tools and approaches that will help reach this objective. Technical assistance will range from specific pieces of research to advance a certain digital component to multi-year, in-country activities to integrate digital tools into Mission portfolios. Support may be extended to advance at a policy level, such as affordable internet connectivity, to something more sector, such as employing mobile-enabled extension information delivery.

Activity Name: New Partnership Initiative (NPI) Incubator
Activity Description: The NPI Incubator will develop resources and training for local and underutilized groups, including faith-based, community, and civil-society organizations, so they can successfully compete for USAID contracts, agreements, and grants. The NPI Incubator will provide a self-assessment tool for new and underutilized organizations to better understand context-specific barriers that prevent them from working with USAID. The Incubator, which will be implemented by The Kaizen Company, will serve as a global service hub, providing resources for organizations to overcome barriers and implement effective programs.

Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin de Capacitacion e Investigacion para la Salud Mental
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Atencin de primeros auxilios psicolgicos y campaa de comunicacin psicosocial ante el COVID-19
Activity Description: People with mental health issues in El Salvador have experienced isolation and difficulty accessing treatment and support due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The IAF supports efforts to enhance social inclusion for people from historically marginalized groups and promote peace and security. Our grantee partner Asociacin de Capacitacin e Investigacin para la Salud Mental (ACISAM) is a local organization working with individuals and community groups on mental health issues. ACISAM offers psychiatric services, trains families in effective support techniques, and uses art as therapy to facilitate peoples recovery and integration into society. ACISAM will also carry out a national awareness campaign on the psychosocial effects of COVID-19, the rights of people with a mental health disability, and how to identify mental health issues. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America.

Activity Description: Employability is an issue for young people in San Julian and Cuisnahuat. Asociacin Nuevo Amanecer de El Salvador (ANADES) provides technical assistance in sustainable agriculture and production to develop leadership and management skills among young men and women and to increase income for them and their families. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to expand economic opportunity in El Salvador. ANADES activities promote smallholder agriculture and food production to enhance food security and ensure meaningful opportunities for communities to thrive. Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: USAID Data Services
Activity Description: USAID Data Services is dedicated to improving the usage of USAID data and information so that the Agency continues to ensure its development outcomes are supported by evidence. USAID Data Services serves as the central source for U.S. foreign assistance data, international socioeconomic data, and data-driven analysis. Through USAID Data Services, the development community has direct access to more than 100 sources of international development data, over 65 years of foreign assistance spending data, the complete record of data collected from USAID missions and bureaus implementing microenterprise and microfinance activities, customized data visualizations, and more.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacion Red de Sobrevivientes y Personas con Discapacidad El Salvador
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Fortalecimiento de los derechos humanos y reintegracin socioeconmica de personas con discapacidad afectadas por la pandemia COVID 19?
Activity Description: COVID-19 has disproportionately impacted people living with disabilities in El Salvador, making it difficult or impossible for them to access physical and mental health services and income-generating opportunities. Our grantee Fundacin Red de Sobrevivientes y Personas con Discapacidad (Red de Sobrevivientes) is educating people with disabilities about their human rights, helping them access investment capital to strengthen their microenterprises, offering psychosocial support, and creating a national campaign to raise the publics awareness of the rights of people with disabilities throughout El Salvador. By working with Red de Sobrevivientes to address these barriers, people with disabilities are creating a viable future for themselves in their home country. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America and IAF's broader COVID-19 response strategy.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: New Partnership Initiative (NPI) Incubator
Activity Description: The NPI Incubator will develop resources and training for local and underutilized groups, including faith-based, community, and civil-society organizations, so they can successfully compete for USAID contracts, agreements, and grants. The NPI Incubator will provide a self-assessment tool for new and underutilized organizations to better understand context-specific barriers that prevent them from working with USAID. The Incubator, which will be implemented by The Kaizen Company, will serve as a global service hub, providing resources for organizations to overcome barriers and implement effective programs.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Sub-category ID: Universities and Research Institutes - United States
Implementing Partner Name: NORC at the University of Chicago
International Purpose Name: Ending violence against women and girls
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: DRG LER II (Large) - Gender Based Violence (GBV) Learning Agenda
Activity Description: The Democracy Human Rights and Governance Learning, Evaluation and Research (DRG-LER II) award continues to advance learning, evaluation, and research within the DRG sector as well as provide critical data on the impact of USAID's DRG activities in the field. Findings from this activity support USAID Mission project evaluation goals and the implementation of the DRG Learning Agenda - an effort to build empirical evidence that tests the theories of change guiding USAID's DRG projects. The Learning Agenda informs future programming choices by DCHA/DRG and the worldwide cadre. DRG-LER II also contributes to USAID's unique role as the leading bilateral donor for DRG activities worldwide. .

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Intersectorial para el Desarrollo Econmico y Progreso Social
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Promoting job opportunities in the arts and the peace culture as a means of preventing youth violence in El Salvador.
Activity Description: Young people from the violent neighborhoods of Mejicanos, Ciudad Delgado, Cuscatancingo, Tecoluca, Zacatecoluca and Jiqulisco struggle to acquire job and life skills that would improve their livelihoods. Asociacin Intersectorial para el Desarrollo Econmico y Progreso Social (CIDEP) builds supportive local alliances and provides technical assistance to children and adolescents to develop skills in leadership, violence prevention, employability and culture of peace. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to enhance peace and security in El Salvador. CIDEPs activities strengthen communities through education and training and build peer-to-peer learning and action networks.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Superate
Activity Description: This public-private alliance supports the prosperity pillar of the CEN Strategy by improving educational opportunities for underprivileged high school students with high academic scores. It addresses the lack of opportunities for youth and fosters broad-based engagement in crime prevention efforts. USAID will leverage private sector resources to open new and maintain existing Supérate training centers that emphasize development of information technology, English language, and life skills. Funds will be also used for providing services to current students and recent graduates, including career advice, assistance with employment searches, and facilitating continued involvement with Supérate as role models and mentors to disadvantaged youth in their communities. Activities will enable youth between the ages of 13 and 18 to develop critical skillsets needed to make a successful transition to higher education and/or promising professional opportunities after high school.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: International Business and Technical Consultants Inc.
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Trilateral Cooperation
Activity Description: The Trilateral Cooperation activity will primarily assist USAID Missions and governments of the Northern Triangle countries (El Salvador, Guatemala, and Honduras) to build trilateral cooperation among the United States, Central American countries, and selected donor countries, primarily from Latin America, as relevant. USAID will support the transfer of technical expertise, technology and knowledge, training and other resources to implement short-term, exploratory or pilot programs that address specific needs of Central American countries to support the U.S. Strategy for Engagement in Central America. Some interventions USAID is planning to carry out under this mechanism are in the areas of trade facilitation, supporting regional systems integration and coordination in border procedures; and clean energy that will advise municipal level leadership in the region on adopting successful models of off-grid energy financing to increase lighting in high crime areas.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Crime and Violence Prevention Project (CVPP)
Activity Description: The U.S. Agency for International Development-funded El Salvador Violence and Crime Prevention Project is addressing this troubling situation by improving the ability of communities, municipalities and national institutions to address violent crime. Building on Creatives success with violence prevention programs elsewhere in Central America, this five-year project introduces community focused initiatives in 55 Salvadoran municipalities. Creative is working with the government to finalize the National System for the Prevention of Violence Law and the National Strategy for Social Violence Prevention in Support of Municipalities, a vital document that sets country-wide policy and empowers municipalities to take the lead on prevention projects. At the municipal level, a complete diagnostic guide incorporates 13 risk factors developed by Creative. The program is also creating municipal observatories, which will collect and corroborate crime and violence data, and developing municipal crime and Violence Prevention Committees that will create action plans in their communities.By the projects end, Creative anticipates a higher level of safety for Salvadorans living in the 55 target municipalities, as well as stronger community, municipal and national structures that are able to respond to and prevent violent crime.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
US Sector Name: Rule of Law and Human Rights
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Justice Sector Strengthening Project
Activity Description: A five-year contract by USAID to implement the Justice Sector Strengthening Project in El Salvador. This is a follow-on contract to the task order that the Company executed in El Salvador from 2008 to 2012, and builds upon important accomplishments in the areas of community policing, assistance for the victims of domestic and sexual violence, and court administration. the Company will expand community policing activities to help reduce crime and violence. The Company also will work to improve case tracking and case management systems in the courts, develop inter-institutional protocols to improve the quality of criminal investigations, and establish victims assistance centers to provide medical, psychological and legal services for the victims of domestic and sexual violence. Finally, the Company will work with civil society organizations to enhance transparency and accountability in the criminal justice system.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Education for Children and Youth Activity
Activity Description: The activity is aligned to the prosperity and security pillars of the CEN Strategy by improving the quality of and access to educational opportunities for lower secondary school children and out-of-school youth in targeted high crime municipalities. Activities include: training principals, teachers, and students on improved learning methodologies; technical assistance, educational materials and equipment for safe spaces for learning; technical assistance for enhanced community participation to help reintegrate school drop-outs back into a formal school setting or to earn an equivalent diploma; vocational/life skills training to out-of-school youth; and institutional strengthening to a consortium of local education NGOs. Activities will support expansion of the GOES' full-time inclusive school model and will increase the capacity of local NGOs to manage education programs and directly contribute to USAID's goal of increasing access to education in crisis and conflict environments.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Business Development Services
Activity Description: The Regulatory Improvement Activity will prioritize and promote investment climate reforms resulting in more efficient and profitable business operations for firms doing business in El Salvador. Specifically, MCC Funding will support: the development of an institutional framework and system, including an institution to focus on regulatory improvement, and the prioritization and implementation of a select set of key reforms; and a public-private dialogue to provide a transparent and user-driven input to the design and implementation of improved regulation, as well as public and private ownership and accountability for the reforms.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Infrastructure Project
Activity Description: The Border Crossing Infrastructure Activity seeks to relieve the freight and passenger traffic congestion at the border crossing into Honduras at El Amatillo by: (A) rehabilitating and improving up to a 5.74 kilometer road from Agua Salada to El Amatillo; and (B) improving and modernizing the border crossing facilities on the Salvadoran side of the La Amistad Bridge and the site on the Pan American Highway. Specifically, MCC Funding and the Government Contribution will support: implementation of construction activities for the improvement, and rehabilitation of the road from Agua Salada to El Amatillo; land acquisition (including RAP implementation, as applicable) for the road and one control center (with two control stations); implementation of environmental and social mitigation measures as identified in the ESIAs, Strategic RAP, and specific RAPs, or as otherwise may be appropriate; the construction of the control center, including buildings, internal access and connecting roads, parking areas, stormwater drainage, potable water supply system, wastewater treatment plant, lighting, and other infrastructure components that may be necessary for the effective functioning of these control stations; and Project management, supervision, technical services required for implementation, and auditing, as appropriate.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Domestic Resource Mobilization Program
Activity Description: Through the Domestic Resource Mobilization (DRM) activity, USAID supports the GOES in enhancing public financial management practices, increasing domestic revenue mobilization and generating additional revenue for the public sector. USAID will use FY 2020 funds to support GOES financial management efforts as the country deals with loans and inflating expenses due to the COVID-19 outbreak. This activity will enhance transparency of COVID-19-related budgeting, anti-corruption and accountability efforts. It will also enable the maintenance of government funding and services to the most vulnerable segments of Salvadoran society that are likely to migrate. The activity provides technical assistance to the GOES Ministry of Finance (MOF) in tax policy, public administration, public expenditure and revenue management systems, and it works to increase dialogue between the government, the private sector, and civil society. It will facilitate technical assistance, training, direct IT support, and limited equipment support, to help the MOF implement a new financial management system. This will aid the GOES in developing a more efficient procurement process and reducing procurement costs.DRM will support both the Ministries of Health and Education in the implementation of a multi-year, results-oriented programmatic budget. Providing technical assistance, training and support from international advisors will allow management to make informed decisions on allocating scarce resources. DRM will also provide the MOF with recommendations tailored to mitigate negative economic and social impacts due

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Global Health
US Sector Name: Pandemic Influenza and Other Emerging Threats (PIOET)
Funding Account Name: Department of State, Global Health Programs
Activity Name: TMEC: Meeting Targets and Maintaining Epidemic Control (EpiC)
Activity Description: Meeting Targets and Maintaining Epidemic Control (TMEC) will help meet or exceed PEPFAR targets for reaching adults, key, and priority populations by finding those who have not yet been identified as positive, linking those who are positive to treatment, and by keeping those on treatment virally suppressed. This mechanism will work with a range of stakeholders to ensure that host government health systems and host countries in general are able to maintain program gains with appropriately decreasing dependence on PEPFAR/USAID. EpiC can support USAID's response to address COVID-19, by preventing, preparing for, responding to, and bolstering health systems to address COVID-19 and re-emergence. Within the scope, EpiC can support Pillar 2 activities, including emergency health response, strengthening global health security in affected countries, and health systems support.

Funding Account Name: Department of State, Global Health Programs
Activity Name: Health Policy Plus (HP+) project
Activity Description: The purpose of the Health Policy Plus (HP+) project is to improve the enabling environment for equitable and sustainable health services, supplies and delivery systems through policy development and implementation, with an emphasis on family planning and reproductive health (FP/RH), maternal and child health (MCH), and HIV and AIDS. It is expected that work across health policy, advocacy, financing, and governance, in a highly coordinated and collaborative approach and with attention to gender equality and equity issues, will be required to achieve the project purpose. This project will leverage previous USG investments in the areas of policy, advocacy, financing, and governance, preserve the progress made to date, and ensure progression toward stated objectives.

Activity Description: The mission of the project is to contribute to the social cohesion of Salvadoran communities through the transformation of schools into Integral Centers for Coexistence. The project will be implemented in 50 educational corridors within the municipalities prioritized in the El Salvador Seguro Plan (PESS). Each corridor will consist of at least two schools and three surrounding communities, with interventions that will last at least two years in each site.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Child Protection Systems Strengthening activity
Activity Description: The Child Protection Systems Strengthening activity will support the Salvadoran Institute for Children and Adolescents, the National Council on Children and Adolescents, and other key child protection actors to improve community-based support to vulnerable children and families. Weakened family structures, poverty, and a lack of adequate social services all contribute to the current citizen security crisis in El Salvador. A functioning case management system, standardized referral mechanisms, and community-level services are necessary to equip families and children with the tools they need to stay safe and productive in their own homes. Key populations will include returning migrant children and families, victims of crime (including trafficking), and children living in high-crime and high-out migration municipalities.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Local para la Prevencin de Desastres y el Desarrollo en el Bajo Lempa
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Developing organic agricultural practices and entrepreneurship to promote economic opportunities for women and youth as key components of a sustainable local development strategy in the Reserva de Biosfera Xiriualtique-Jiquilisco
Activity Description: After El Salvadors civil war, the government resettled many communities in a region that was subsequently established as the Xiriualtique-Jiquilisco Biosphere Reserve, known for its biodiversity, but vulnerable to environmental shocks and isolated from basic services. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to improve food security and expand economic opportunity in El Salvador. Our grantee partner, la Asociacin Local Mangle para la Mitigacin de Desastres y el Desarrollo en el Bajo Lempa-Baha de Jiquilisco (Mangle), is working with resettled farmers from 14 communities to train them in organic agricultural methods to adapt to the challenges of farming sustainably in the reserve and foster entrepreneurship opportunities for women and youth. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Reconstruction of the Jose Maria Peralta Lagos School in Quetzaltepeque
Activity Description: The objective of this Cooperative Agreement is to procure and execute the design, construction supervision and actual construction of the "I.N. Jose Maria Peralta Lagos" (JMPL) School in La Libertad, El Salvador under the USAID Tropical Storm Ida Reconstruction Project. This Cooperative Agreement includes an integral approach that involves architectural and engineering services, strengthened community resilience by means of competency development in disaster risk reduction, climate change adaptation, migration education, and related community engagement activities.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Strengthening the environmental, organizational and productive management resilience for the construction of sustainable rural enterprises
Activity Description: Indigenous smallholder farmers in rural Cuisnahuat and Nahuizalco, El Salvador, struggle to feed their families and sell their agricultural products in a region without basic services, troubled by violence, and battered by extreme weather patterns. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to improve food security, expand economic opportunity and promote sustainable agriculture. Our grantee partner, Asociacin El Blsamo (El Blsamo), works with producer cooperatives to provide management and microenterprise training, support farmers efforts to market and sell their crops, and teach schoolchildren and youth organic gardening techniques that they can apply to their family farms. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America.
