Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Domestic Resource Mobilization Program
Activity Description: Through the Domestic Resource Mobilization (DRM) activity, USAID supports the GOES in enhancing public financial management practices, increasing domestic revenue mobilization and generating additional revenue for the public sector. USAID will use FY 2020 funds to support GOES financial management efforts as the country deals with loans and inflating expenses due to the COVID-19 outbreak. This activity will enhance transparency of COVID-19-related budgeting, anti-corruption and accountability efforts. It will also enable the maintenance of government funding and services to the most vulnerable segments of Salvadoran society that are likely to migrate. The activity provides technical assistance to the GOES Ministry of Finance (MOF) in tax policy, public administration, public expenditure and revenue management systems, and it works to increase dialogue between the government, the private sector, and civil society. It will facilitate technical assistance, training, direct IT support, and limited equipment support, to help the MOF implement a new financial management system. This will aid the GOES in developing a more efficient procurement process and reducing procurement costs.DRM will support both the Ministries of Health and Education in the implementation of a multi-year, results-oriented programmatic budget. Providing technical assistance, training and support from international advisors will allow management to make informed decisions on allocating scarce resources. DRM will also provide the MOF with recommendations tailored to mitigate negative economic and social impacts due

Activity Name: MCC Monitoring and Evaluation
Activity Description: Due diligence funding is used to obtain sufficient information to evaluate, assess and appraise projects during compact development, effectively oversee and monitor compact implementation, conduct quality assurance, and then evaluate the results of a compact project once complete.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Community development pilot with a human rights-based approach for the promotion of support of populations at risk of irregular migration and internally displaced families
Activity Description: El Salvador has among the highest levels of internal displacement in Latin America driven by criminal gangs threats, extortions, and assassinations. This internal displacement is often a precursor to U.S.-bound irregular migration if internal migrants are unable to find safety elsewhere within the country. At the IAF, we support community-led approaches to enhance peace and security. In five municipalities in El Salvador and one in Honduras, our grantee partner Cristosal works with local organizations and municipal authorities to strengthen systems of protection and development for internally displaced persons and ensure that they can exercise their rights as citizens in their own countries. Cristosal is building the capacity of local stakeholders, involving internally displaced persons in the development activities of participating municipalities, carrying out exchanges between organizations, and documenting best practices. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Strengthening Human Rights Systems in El Salvador
Activity Description: USAID/El Salvador will provide interventions that protect against or respond to human rights abuses and strengthen local human rights institutions, including the Attorney General's Office. [CARSI]

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacion Centro para la Promocin de los Derechos Humanos "Madeleine Lagadec"
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Strengthening the resilient capacities of women, young people, community leaders for economic empowerment that will contribute to the development and improvement of their living conditions and the construction of citizenship
Activity Description: Women and youth across El Salvador continue facing unforgiving consequences of the countrys 12-year civil war. As survivors of war crimes still wait to see the light of justice and gang violence goes unchecked, many women and young people leave their communities in search of a better life for themselves and their families. At the IAF, we are committed to community-led solutions that improve peace and security, expand economic opportunity, and provide alternatives to irregular migration in El Salvador. Our grantee partner, Centro para la Promocin de los Derechos Humanos Madeleine Lagadec (CPDH), is working with women and youth in the departments of San Vincente and Usulutn to strengthen communities capacity to foster a culture of peace, promote local economic development, and advocate for public policies that prevent violence and improve gender equity. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Conservation of collective memory and prevention of violence through the arts in a culture of peace.
Activity Description: Women and young people in El Salvador face high levels of violence and lack safe spaces to interact peacefully, overcome trauma from violence, and explore vocational and professional opportunities. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to promote peace and security. Our grantee partner, Asociacin de Desarrollo Local Centro Arte para la Paz (CAP), promotes healthy dialogue and intergenerational learning among survivors of armed conflict and violence through its community museum and art school in Sochitoto. CAP is piloting new strategies to engage the broader community, such as establishing a media library to safeguard and disseminate historical memory, as well as organizing a mobile museum to extend the organizations reach into rural communities. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Cooperativa de Ahorro y Credito y Comercializacin Mujeres Dispuestas a Triunfar
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Promotion of the Economic Autonomy of Women through Cooperativism
Activity Description: Women in El Salvador face high levels of violence and gender discrimination, which limits their security and economic autonomy, causing many to migrate in search of a better life. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to create economic opportunities that provide alternatives to irregular migration. Our grantee partner, Asociacin Cooperativa de Ahorro y Crdito y Comercializacin Mujeres Dispuestas a Triunfar de Responsabilidad Limitada (ACOMUDT), provides training in womens rights, safety, and economic freedoms to its network of rural women in 23 communities of Usulutn. Members of the network then replicate the training within their communities, bolstering womens economic resilience, as well as engage local governments in creating economic opportunities for women within their home communities. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America. The grant also contributes to the IAFs Women INvesting in Growth and Security (WINGS) initiative to empower women as business and community leaders.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: La Red Union de Mujeres de R.L.
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Organizational strengthening with emphasis on economic empowerment, to the most vulnerable population in El Salvador.
Activity Description: Women in El Salvador face limited economic opportunities and high levels of violence, which pushes many to leave their communities in search of a better life. The IAF supports community-led solutions to create economic opportunities that provide alternatives to irregular migration. Our grantee partner, Asociacin Cooperativa de Produccin Artesanal, Aprovisionamiento, Comercializacin, Ahorro y Crdito La Red Unin de Mujeres de R.L. (RUM), provides training in leadership and entrepreneurship, business planning, and marketing and sales to women-led small businesses in eleven municipalities of El Salvador with the goal of increasing resilience and access to sustainable livelihoods. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America. The grant also contributes to the IAFs Women INvesting in Growth and Security (WINGS) initiative to empower women as business and community leaders.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Federacin de Asociaciones Cooperativas Pesqueras Artesanales de El Salvador
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: The Advocacy and Strengthening of FACOPADES de RL for the Development of the Artisanal Fishermen of El Salvador.
Activity Description: El Salvadors artisanal fisher communities face limited economic opportunities, frequent natural disasters, and persistent levels of violence that push many to leave their communities in search of a better life. The IAF supports community-led solutions to create economic opportunity and improve natural resource management. Our grantee partner, Federacin de Asociaciones Cooperativas Pesqueras Artesanales de El Salvador (FACOPADES), which represents 36 fresh and saltwater fisher cooperatives, strengthens the administrative, financial, and organizational capacity of its members, so fishing communities are more resilient to disasters and have expanded economic opportunities that provide alternatives to irregular migration. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America and the IAF's broader COVID-19 response strategy.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Agropecuaria de Mujeres Produciendo en la Tierra R.L.
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Strengthening organizational and productive practices of small scale business women in the departments of Sonsonante and Ahuachapn
Activity Description: Women in Izalco and San Francisco Menendez face barriers to participation in civil society and to income-generating opportunities. Asociacin Agropecuaria de Mujeres Produciendo en la Tierra R.L. (AMSATI) works with women to increase their leadership, networking and business development skills and to launch social enterprises in animal husbandry and agriculture. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to expand economic opportunity in El Salvador. AMSATIs activities encourage small business growth, local entrepreneurship and market development to ensure meaningful opportunities for communities to thrive. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin para el Desarrollo Sostentible de El Salvador
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Strengthening technical capacities in the municipality of Nuevo Edn de San Juan Department of San Miguel to address the food crisis
Activity Description: Drought and soil degradation are critical issues that affect food security and small-holder farmers in Nuevo Edn. Asociacin para el Desarrollo Sostenible de El Salvador (Popol Na) coordinates with an environmental committee and local cooperative to develop farmers skills in sustainable, diversified, organic agricultural production that helps improve food supply and promote economic alternatives to migration. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to expand economic opportunity in El Salvador. Popol Nas activities promote smallholder agriculture and food production to enhance food security and ensure meaningful opportunities for communities to thrive. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin de Productores, Agroecolgicos y Produccin Orgnica de la Sierra Tecapa
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Agroecological Training and Strengthening and Organic Production of the Sierra Tecapa
Activity Description: Families in Usulutn, El Salvador, struggle to produce food in a region prone to drought and flooding, where much land and water remain contaminated after historical environmental disasters. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to improve food security, expand economic opportunity, and promote civic engagement. Our grantee partner, Asociacin de Productores, Agroecolgicos y Produccin Orgnica de la Sierra Tecapa (APAOSIETE), is strengthening sustainable agricultural practices in the Usulutn-Sierra Tecapa region by establishing an organic agriculture training school, expanding its production of organic fertilizer, raising community awareness about the benefits of organic farming, and building its institutional capacity to plan and carry out future activities. This grant is part of the IAF's efforts to address the root causes of irregular migration in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Drug Enforcement Administration
US Sector Name: Stabilization Operations and Security Sector Reform
Funding Account Name: Drug Enforcement Administration, Salaries and Expenses
Activity Name: Special Investigative Unit (SIU) 106 Basic Course, El Salvador
Activity Description: Special Investigative Unit (SIU) 106 Basic Course, El Salvador; This is a five week course serves as the foundation in fundamental law enforcement practices for newly assigned officers. It is based on the DEA Basic Agent training program and covers a wide range of topics in drug law enforcement.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service
Funding Account Name: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund
Activity Name: Increasing hawksbill nesting beach productivity and reducing bycatch from lobster gillnets in El Salvador
Activity Description: (1) conduct community based patrols and relocation of nests to hatcheries; (2) conduct outreach activities such as a Hawksbill Festival, Hawksbill Cup competition and Day of the Hawksbill events in schools to raise awareness about threats to hawksbills; (3) conduct year round fisheries bycatch monitoring of lobster fisheries with on board observers; (4) conduct LED light trials on lobster nets to determine deterrence effectiveness; and (5) develop local capacity to strengthen a hawksbill ecotourism program for the benefit of local residents.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacion para el Desarrollo Socioeconomico y Restauracion Ambiental
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: A Partnership to Pilot an Indicator Framework for Sustainable Agriculture in Latin America
Activity Description: Farmers are often absent from discussions about how policies and programs impact sustainable agricultural production. At the IAF, we are investing in a regional effort, in conjunction with the University of British Columbia that will give voice to farmers and directly support them in collecting, analyzing, and presenting data that they can incorporate into their operations to manage their farms more efficiently. Fundacin para el Desarrollo Socioeconmico y Restauracin Ambiental (FUNDESYRAM) established the first participatory certification system in El Salvador. It also connects producers directly to consumers to improve farmers quality of life and consumers food security. Finally, FUNDESYRAM creates spaces for dialogue among producer organizations, indigenous communities, government agencies, and the private sector about policies and programs to promote sustainable agriculture. The results of this regional project will inform agricultural support organizations (government extension experts, farmer groups) and policy-makers with context-specific data about how to encourage the transition to sustainable agricultural practices to improve food security, enhance farmer livelihoods, and minimize environmental degradation. This is part of the IAFs strategic initiative for sustainable agriculture.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Reconstruction of the Jose Maria Peralta Lagos School in Quetzaltepeque
Activity Description: The objective of this Cooperative Agreement is to procure and execute the design, construction supervision and actual construction of the "I.N. Jose Maria Peralta Lagos" (JMPL) School in La Libertad, El Salvador under the USAID Tropical Storm Ida Reconstruction Project. This Cooperative Agreement includes an integral approach that involves architectural and engineering services, strengthened community resilience by means of competency development in disaster risk reduction, climate change adaptation, migration education, and related community engagement activities.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Education for Children and Youth Activity
Activity Description: The activity is aligned to the prosperity and security pillars of the CEN Strategy by improving the quality of and access to educational opportunities for lower secondary school children and out-of-school youth in targeted high crime municipalities. Activities include: training principals, teachers, and students on improved learning methodologies; technical assistance, educational materials and equipment for safe spaces for learning; technical assistance for enhanced community participation to help reintegrate school drop-outs back into a formal school setting or to earn an equivalent diploma; vocational/life skills training to out-of-school youth; and institutional strengthening to a consortium of local education NGOs. Activities will support expansion of the GOES' full-time inclusive school model and will increase the capacity of local NGOs to manage education programs and directly contribute to USAID's goal of increasing access to education in crisis and conflict environments.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service
Funding Account Name: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund
Activity Name: Vital Support for Hawksbills in the Eastern Pacific Ocean: Year VI of Conservation at Top-Tier Nesting Beaches
Activity Description: 1) community based patrols to deter illegal poaching of nesting females and eggs and counting of nests to monitor population trends at Los Cobanos and Punta Amapala, El Salvador and Machalilla and El Pelado in Ecuador, and 2) relocation of nests threatened by poaching or tidal inundation to safe beach hatcheries.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Child Protection Systems Strengthening activity
Activity Description: The Child Protection Systems Strengthening activity will support the Salvadoran Institute for Children and Adolescents, the National Council on Children and Adolescents, and other key child protection actors to improve community-based support to vulnerable children and families. Weakened family structures, poverty, and a lack of adequate social services all contribute to the current citizen security crisis in El Salvador. A functioning case management system, standardized referral mechanisms, and community-level services are necessary to equip families and children with the tools they need to stay safe and productive in their own homes. Key populations will include returning migrant children and families, victims of crime (including trafficking), and children living in high-crime and high-out migration municipalities.

Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Strengthening Rural Entrepreneurships and a Community Marketing Network in the Communities of San Francisco Javier, San Agustn, Jiquilisco and Ozatln.
Activity Description: Asociacin Coordinadora de Comunidades Unidas de Usulutn (COMUS) will establish a community marketing network and promote rural entrepreneurship in nine communities from the municipalities of San Francisco Javier San Agustn Jiquilisco and Ozatln. The project will improve access to locally made products expand rural microbusinesses strengthen organizational skills of community associations and increase family incomes. The grant will benefit 442 people directly and 2000 people indirectly. ..

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin de Capacitacion e Investigacion para la Salud Mental
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Central American network of people with mental disabilities to improve mental health and reduce stigma.
Activity Description: Under this Cooperative Agreement IAF partner Asociacin de Capacitacin e Investigacin para la Salud Mental (ACISAM) will work in four countries to further develop a network of nine grassroots associations focusing on services for people with psychiatric disabilities and for their caregivers. The partner and the associations will collaborate on organizing educational events; facilitating communications; improving their administration leadership and partnerships; and managing a subgrant fund financing economic initiatives training and outreach. In this cooperative agreement ACISAM will work with the IAF on regional events subgrant review and dissemination of lessons. Some 800 Salvadorans Nicaraguans Panamanians and Costa Ricans will benefit directly and another 7000 indirectly.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Fiscal Policy and Expenditure Management Project (FPEMP)
Activity Description: The FPEMP project is helping the Government of El Salvador (GOES) increase tax revenue, without raising rates, and achieve greater transparency and accountability, and more efficiently use public resources. We are modernizing the General Directorate for Internal Revenue to improve taxpayer services, reduce tax fraud and tax evasion, and enhance legitimacy. The project builds on the foundations for reform laid by a preceding project called Tax Policy and Administration Reform that DAI led from 2005 to 2010.

Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Reconstruction of Infrastructure Damage due to Tropical Storm Ida
Activity Description: Through the Tropical Storm Ida Reconstruction Project, USAID will support the reconstruction and rehabilitation of the bridges, schools and healthcare facilities identified and prioritized by the Government of El Salvador (GOES) that are located in the five most-affected departments of San Salvador, La Paz, Cuscatln, San Vicente, and La Libertad.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Adopt a School Program
Activity Description: FEPADE's (Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo) "Adopt a School" project was developed with the goal of supporting the private sector in El Salvador to adopt schools and improve the quality of public education. With funding from both the private sector and the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), FEPADE works with the Ministry of Education to identify public schools in need. Private businesses then "adopt" schools open to receiving support. - See more at: http://www.educationinnovations.org/program/adopte-una-escuela#sthash.pFHNv93V.dpuf

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Sub-category ID: Universities and Research Institutes - United States
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Higher Education
Activity Description: The Higher Education project strengthens the ability of higher education institutions to develop a workforce that is responsive to private sector needs to contribute to economic growth. The project will work with higher education institutions and the private sector to improve and update curricula and link tertiary education with labor market needs. Activities will build the institutional capacity of higher education institutions and official entities to expand the use of applied research and provide new and updated academic programs, and to develop partnerships between academia and the private sector. Faculty and staff will receive professional development through specialized technical assistance, training, and degree programs. Activities will also support career centers, internship programs, and academic programs in priority economic sectors.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Crime and Violence Prevention Project (CVPP)
Activity Description: The U.S. Agency for International Development-funded El Salvador Violence and Crime Prevention Project is addressing this troubling situation by improving the ability of communities, municipalities and national institutions to address violent crime. Building on Creatives success with violence prevention programs elsewhere in Central America, this five-year project introduces community focused initiatives in 55 Salvadoran municipalities. Creative is working with the government to finalize the National System for the Prevention of Violence Law and the National Strategy for Social Violence Prevention in Support of Municipalities, a vital document that sets country-wide policy and empowers municipalities to take the lead on prevention projects. At the municipal level, a complete diagnostic guide incorporates 13 risk factors developed by Creative. The program is also creating municipal observatories, which will collect and corroborate crime and violence data, and developing municipal crime and Violence Prevention Committees that will create action plans in their communities.By the projects end, Creative anticipates a higher level of safety for Salvadorans living in the 55 target municipalities, as well as stronger community, municipal and national structures that are able to respond to and prevent violent crime.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: SolucionES
Activity Description: The five-year program will focus on the development and strengthening of anti-crime plans at the municipal level; increased social investment from the private sector to prevent violence by targeting at-risk youth; and research to help in the formation of effective public policies to prevent crime. SolucionES is led by la Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (FEPADE) and in addition to Glasswing includes la Fundacin Nacional para el Desarrollo (FUNDE), la Fundacin Salvadorea para la Salud y el Desarrollo Humano (FUSAL), y la Fundacin Salvadorea para el Desarrollo Econmico y Social (FUSADES). The five organizations are experts in the areas of education, health, community and economic development, research and youth leadership.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Monitoring and Evaluation
Activity Description: The Accountable Entity's monitoring and evaluation costs, which include monitoring, reporting and dissemination, GIS, data collection and data quality reviews.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
US Sector Name: Rule of Law and Human Rights
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Justice Sector Strengthening Project
Activity Description: A five-year contract by USAID to implement the Justice Sector Strengthening Project in El Salvador. This is a follow-on contract to the task order that the Company executed in El Salvador from 2008 to 2012, and builds upon important accomplishments in the areas of community policing, assistance for the victims of domestic and sexual violence, and court administration. the Company will expand community policing activities to help reduce crime and violence. The Company also will work to improve case tracking and case management systems in the courts, develop inter-institutional protocols to improve the quality of criminal investigations, and establish victims assistance centers to provide medical, psychological and legal services for the victims of domestic and sexual violence. Finally, the Company will work with civil society organizations to enhance transparency and accountability in the criminal justice system.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Business Development Services
Activity Description: The Regulatory Improvement Activity will prioritize and promote investment climate reforms resulting in more efficient and profitable business operations for firms doing business in El Salvador. Specifically, MCC Funding will support: the development of an institutional framework and system, including an institution to focus on regulatory improvement, and the prioritization and implementation of a select set of key reforms; and a public-private dialogue to provide a transparent and user-driven input to the design and implementation of improved regulation, as well as public and private ownership and accountability for the reforms.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Human Capital Project
Activity Description: The TVET System Reform Activity seeks to harmonize the skills supplied by private and public education and training providers with the skills demanded by the labor market. The detailed design and implementation of the TVET System Reform Activity will be informed by the results of the ongoing studies funded as part of the development of this Compact.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Infrastructure Project
Activity Description: The Coastal Highway Expansion Activity seeks to relieve congestion at the most-trafficked segment of El Salvador?s coastal highway (?CA-2?). The CA-2 is one of the two most important logistical corridors in the country and connects the country?s major logistical nodes, including its two sea ports (La Union and Acajutla) and SAL. The Activity will finance three segments of CA-2: the 7.22 kilometer segment from Comalapa to La Herradura, the 16.98 kilometer segment from La Herradura to Zacatecoluca, and the 2.97 kilometer segment from La Libertad intersection to the Comapala Airport Road intersection.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Human Capital Project
Activity Description: Under this Activity, MCC Funding and the Government Contribution will support complementary interventions to provide Salvadoran students the benefits of competency-based education, increased classroom time, teachers trained in requisite subject-matters and pedagogical skills, and an institutional and physical environment that is conducive to learning.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Government Integrity
Activity Description: The Government Integrity activity will support the efforts of the Government of El Salvador (GOES) and civil society organizations (CSOs) to implement transparency, ethics and anti-corruption reforms and promote citizen participation. Activities will include: sub-grants and technical assistance to CSOs to develop innovative monitoring and citizen participation initiatives; training and technical assistance to the GOES' Institute of Access to Public Information; training and technical assistance to 14 municipalities to strengthen their access to public information units and ethics commissions; technical assistance for the implementation and oversight of GOES' commitments under the Open Government Partnership (OGP); and support for advocacy efforts for civil service reform and the implementation of merit based systems. These activities will align the CEN Strategy governance pillar by helping the GOES maintain transparent and professional governance structures.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Louis Berger Group and Black & Veatch Joint Venture
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Strengthening Local Governance for Security and Development in El Salvador
Activity Description: The USAID-funded Strengthening Local Governance for Security and Development in El Salvador project aims to build consensus around increased decentralization, enhance intergovernmental coordination, and strengthen the ability of municipalities to plan for, administer, pay for and deliver effective, responsive services in a participatory and accountable manner.  The project will operate at the national, intermediary and municipal levels. At the national level, the project will focus on improving national support and frameworks for decentralization. At the intermediary level, the project will strengthen intergovernmental coordination and foster inter-municipal partnerships. At the municipal level, the project will build the fundamental capacity of municipalities to effectively govern.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacion para la Educacion Integral Salvadorena
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Education for Children and Youth Activity
Activity Description: The activity is aligned to the prosperity and security pillars of the CEN Strategy by improving the quality of and access to educational opportunities for lower secondary school children and out-of-school youth in targeted high crime municipalities. Activities include: training principals, teachers, and students on improved learning methodologies; technical assistance, educational materials and equipment for safe spaces for learning; technical assistance for enhanced community participation to help reintegrate school drop-outs back into a formal school setting or to earn an equivalent diploma; vocational/life skills training to out-of-school youth; and institutional strengthening to a consortium of local education NGOs. Activities will support expansion of the GOES' full-time inclusive school model and will increase the capacity of local NGOs to manage education programs and directly contribute to USAID's goal of increasing access to education in crisis and conflict environments.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: El Salvador Competitive
Activity Description: This Activity builds upon lessons learned from prior development investments and complements current USAID/El Salvador activities to enable Salvadoran businesses to become more competitive in global markets  .The Activity helps the Government of El Salvador (GOES) increase productivity and competitiveness in key economic sectors. It strengthens small and medium enterprise (SME) development, public-private partnerships, municipal competitiveness, and the business enabling environment by encouraging private sector investment, innovation, and job creation, thus fostering economic growth. The Activity contributes to the Business Development line of action under the Prosperity pillar of the U.S. Engagement Strategy with Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Business Development Services
Activity Description: The Partnership Development Activity is designed to enable the Government to partner with the private sector in innovative ways to provide key public goods and services needed to support private investment in the internationally traded goods and services sector.

Activity Description: An Accountable Entity's administrative costs, which include staff salaries; Accountable Entity facilities; IT software, hardware and support; fiscal and procurement agent costs; audit costs; and general overhead costs.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Bridges for Employment
Activity Description: USAID Bridges for Employment will partner with the Ministry of Education, Ministry of Labor, vocational training centers/institutes, civil society organizations, and the private sector to improve employment opportunities for at-risk youth living in high-crime municipalities prioritized by the Government of El Salvador. The activity will reduce youth engagement in illicit activities and illegal migration. To achieve this, USAID works with young Salvadorans and employs an inclusive-systems approach that links government, service providers, training providers, and the private sector to help youth acquire the skills they need for success. The activity will develop and deliver on-the-job training programs; support youth entrepreneur initiatives; and support inclusion of young women, LGBTI youth, youth with disabilities, and at-risk youth in the workforce. This activity contributes to the Education and Workforce Development line of action under the Prosperity pillar of the U.S. Strategy for Central America. The project also contributes directly to USAID's Education Strategy Goal 2 "improved ability of tertiary and workforce development programs to produce a workforce with relevant skills to support country development " and Goal 3 "increased equitable access to education in crisis and conflict environments." It also contributes to Strategic Objective 1.2 of the Joint Regional Strategy, which addresses the security, governance, and economic drivers of illegal immigration and illicit trafficking in Central America. [CARSI]

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Consortium for Elections and Political Process Strengthening
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Free, Fair and Transparent Presidential Elections in El Salvador Activity
Activity Description: This one-year project aims to increase the transparency of the Salvadoran electoral processes and strengthen the TSE's capacity to prevent and mitigate electoral violence and to ensure the results transmission system works properly during the 2019 elections.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Promoting Citizen Participation in Public Policy in  El Salvador
Activity Description: Through this activity, USAID will contribute to the CEN by improving democratic governance and reinforcing the capacities of leaders and civil society organizations to participate in and influence the electoral processes. The activity is undertaking a set of interventions to improve civil society's influence on public policies in two areas: a) to increase civil society's ability to exercise their political rights in the electoral processes 2018-2019 cycle; and b) to affect public policy agendas at the municipal and national levels. USAID will do so by convening workshops with civil society organizations to develop policy recommendations for presidential candidates, and creating dialogue spaces for citizens and civil society to engage with candidates on these issues to shape policy platforms and inform the electorate.

Activity Name: MCC PRODUCTIVE DEVELOPMENT PROJECT
Activity Description: To provide technical assistance to poor farmers to shift to high-value agricultural production and forestry strategies and to provide preinvestment studies and technical assistance for the development and implementation of.business plans for Project beneficiaries located in the Northern Zone or greatly benefiting the Northern Zone population. Specifically, MCC Funding will support the following activities for poor farmers, organizations and micro, small, and medium enterprises that benefit poor inhabitants of the Northern Zone: (i) Investment Planning. Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Educar y Convivir: Familias y Escuelas libres de violencia
Activity Description: The mission of the project is to contribute to the social cohesion of Salvadoran communities through the transformation of schools into Integral Centers for Coexistence. The project will be implemented in 50 educational corridors within the municipalities prioritized in the El Salvador Seguro Plan (PESS). Each corridor will consist of at least two schools and three surrounding communities, with interventions that will last at least two years in each site.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: IMAGINA project
Activity Description: The IMAGINA Project: A new five-year crime prevention activity expected to be implemented by Fundacin Salvadorea para el Desarrollo Econmico y Social de El Salvador (FUSADES) and Fundacin Crislida (Glasswing) to provide a local citizens observatory of quality of life that generates reliable and comparable information about different quality of life dimensions, including citizen participation. The new activity will also support the renovation of Parque Cuscatln, a major park located in San Salvador, by establishing a trust fund with a local bank to manage private sector contributions for renovation and ongoing maintenance.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: USAID Bureau - Other
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Domestic Resource Mobilization Program
Activity Description: Through the Domestic Resource Mobilization (DRM) activity, USAID supports the GOES in enhancing public financial management practices, increasing domestic revenue mobilization and generating additional revenue for the public sector. USAID will use FY 2020 funds to support GOES financial management efforts as the country deals with loans and inflating expenses due to the COVID-19 outbreak. This activity will enhance transparency of COVID-19-related budgeting, anti-corruption and accountability efforts. It will also enable the maintenance of government funding and services to the most vulnerable segments of Salvadoran society that are likely to migrate. The activity provides technical assistance to the GOES Ministry of Finance (MOF) in tax policy, public administration, public expenditure and revenue management systems, and it works to increase dialogue between the government, the private sector, and civil society. It will facilitate technical assistance, training, direct IT support, and limited equipment support, to help the MOF implement a new financial management system. This will aid the GOES in developing a more efficient procurement process and reducing procurement costs.DRM will support both the Ministries of Health and Education in the implementation of a multi-year, results-oriented programmatic budget. Providing technical assistance, training and support from international advisors will allow management to make informed decisions on allocating scarce resources. DRM will also provide the MOF with recommendations tailored to mitigate negative economic and social impacts due

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Human Development Project
Activity Description: The Education and Training Activity seeks to increase education and skill levels of the Northern Zone's poor by expanding the quality of, and access to, vocational and technical education and training. It is comprised of three sub-activities: technical assistance; formal technical education; and non-formal skills development. The Technical Assistance Sub-Activity will bolster capacity of institutions and organizations involved in policy, planning, and administration of education and training in the Northern Zone. MCC Funding will be used to procure the services of a long-term technical assistance provider that will support Implementing Entities. The Formal Technical Education Sub-Activity aims to strengthen technical/vocational education institutions in the Northern Zone, so that more youth can gain marketable skills and thereby increase their opportunities for employment and income generation. The Non-Formal Skills Development Sub-Activity will complement the Formal Technical Education Sub-Activity by supporting non-credit, short term and pre-employment training offerings.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Educational and Cultural Affairs
Funding Account Name: Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs
Activity Name: Conservation of the Mid-19th-Century Casa Barrientos in Izalco
Activity Description: Built in 1864 in an eclectic style and using traditional materials and techniques, the Casa Barrientos set the standard for the urban residences of Izalcos prominent families for the next several decades. This project involves the conservation of the buildings interior and exterior and its adaptation for reuse as a community center and museum.

Activity Name: El Salvador Competitive
Activity Description: This Activity builds upon lessons learned from prior development investments and complements current USAID/El Salvador activities to enable Salvadoran businesses to become more competitive in global markets  .The Activity helps the Government of El Salvador (GOES) increase productivity and competitiveness in key economic sectors. It strengthens small and medium enterprise (SME) development, public-private partnerships, municipal competitiveness, and the business enabling environment by encouraging private sector investment, innovation, and job creation, thus fostering economic growth. The Activity contributes to the Business Development line of action under the Prosperity pillar of the U.S. Engagement Strategy with Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
International Purpose Name: Multisector aid for basic social services
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Human Development Project
Activity Description: The Community Development Activity aims to dramatically increase access of the Northern Zone's poor to basic public services and infrastructure. The Community Infrastructure Sub-Activity will improve the connection among isolated communities and villages in the Northern Zone while ensuring sustainable management of natural resources. Specifically, MCC Funding will support the following: (1) Feasibility, design, and environmental assessment to include sitespecific EIAs, EMPs, and RAPs, as needed, of community infrastructure development; (2) Rehabilitation and construction of community infrastructure such as small roads and drainage works, retaining walls, pedestrian crossings and small bridges; and (3) Technical assistance to communities and municipalities on infrastructure O&M.

Activity Name: Special Investigative Unit (SIU) 103 Basic Course, El Salvador
Activity Description: Special Investigative Unit (SIU) 103 Basic Course, El Salvador; This is a five week course serves as the foundation in fundamental law enforcement practices for newly assigned officers. It is based on the DEA Basic Agent training program and covers a wide range of topics in drug law enforcement.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Intercomunal de Comunidades Unidas para el Desarrollo Econmico y Social del Bajo Lempa
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Sustainable income generating and risk mitigation opportunities in communities vulnerable to climate change in Bajo Lempa, Jiquilisco.
Activity Description: Asociacin Intercomunal de Comunidades Unidas para el Desarrollo Econmico y Social del Bajo Lempa (ACUDESBAL) will collaborate with three grassroots organizations to develop their resilience to climate change improve agricultural production for food security while enhancing income-generating opportunities for smallholder farmers women and young adults. The grant includes training technical assistance and materials for residents on risk mitigation sustainable agriculture and vocations; livestock vegetables grains and shrimp; and peer-to-peer exchanges. ACUDESBAL anticipates that the grant will improve livelihoods and incorporate women and young adults into community life - especially those forced to seek work far from home due to lack of opportunities. Some 290 residents of 29 communities will benefit from activities directly and another 800 indirectly.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Superate
Activity Description: This public-private alliance supports the prosperity pillar of the CEN Strategy by improving educational opportunities for underprivileged high school students with high academic scores. It addresses the lack of opportunities for youth and fosters broad-based engagement in crime prevention efforts. USAID will leverage private sector resources to open new and maintain existing Supérate training centers that emphasize development of information technology, English language, and life skills. Funds will be also used for providing services to current students and recent graduates, including career advice, assistance with employment searches, and facilitating continued involvement with Supérate as role models and mentors to disadvantaged youth in their communities. Activities will enable youth between the ages of 13 and 18 to develop critical skillsets needed to make a successful transition to higher education and/or promising professional opportunities after high school.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: U.S. Government - U.S. Agency for International Development
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Program Design and Learning
Activity Description: Develop and conduct needs assessments, baseline studies, targeted evaluations, special studies or other information-gathering efforts specifically for the design, monitoring and evaluation of USG-funded programs. This sub-element may also include developing and disseminating best practices and lessons learned, testing demonstration and/or pilot models, or the preparation of strategic plans and other short-term programming tasks. Note: All such activities that are carried out by partners as an integral part of their monitoring and evaluation efforts for programs funded under other sub-elements should be included within those sub-elements.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
International Purpose Name: Multisector aid for basic social services
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Human Development Project
Activity Description: The Community Development Activity aims to dramatically increase access of the Northern Zone's poor to basic public services and infrastructure. The Rural Electrification Sub-Activity will extend electricity to at least 97 percent of the estimated 47,000 households in the Northern Zone that currently are not connected to local power distribution networks. Service will be provided to these households through, as appropriate for the household, investments in the extension of distribution networks, in individual household connections to the network, and in the supply of off-grid solar photovoltaic systems. MCC Funding will cover up to 85 percent of the projected investment in the electrification efforts, with contributions from the Government and the executing entities comprising the balance of at least 15 percent. MCC Funding will support the following: (1) Feasibility, design, and environmental assessment to include sitespecific EIAs, EMPs, and RAPs, as needed, for new distribution lines; (2) Construction of approximately 1,500 km of new distribution lines and the corresponding connection of approximately 21,000 households to the expanded network; (3) Connection of approximately 25,000 households to existing networks via the construction of necessary low voltage extensions; (4) Investment in upgrading distribution networks as necessary to support the anticipated additional load on the system; (5) Installation of approximately 950 solar power systems and provision of technical assistance for the creation of community associations for the management of solar power system operations and maintenance; and (6) Contracting of a financial advisor by and at the expense of FOMILENIO to advise FOMILENIO on financial aspects and implications of the procurement process associated with the Rural Electrification Sub-Activity, as needed.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Government Integrity
Activity Description: The Government Integrity activity will support the efforts of the Government of El Salvador (GOES) and civil society organizations (CSOs) to implement transparency, ethics and anti-corruption reforms and promote citizen participation. Activities will include: sub-grants and technical assistance to CSOs to develop innovative monitoring and citizen participation initiatives; training and technical assistance to the GOES' Institute of Access to Public Information; training and technical assistance to 14 municipalities to strengthen their access to public information units and ethics commissions; technical assistance for the implementation and oversight of GOES' commitments under the Open Government Partnership (OGP); and support for advocacy efforts for civil service reform and the implementation of merit based systems. These activities will align the CEN Strategy governance pillar by helping the GOES maintain transparent and professional governance structures.

Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Technical and advisory services
Activity Description: Work for USAID/LAC/CAR in managing, administering, and supporting CBSI programs. Travel, space, IT, and other associated program management support costs will also be included. Staff resources to work on citizen security programs contribute towards strengthening Caribbean and U.S. national security and advancing the safety of our citizens.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Office of Technical Assistance
Funding Account Name: International Affairs Technical Assistance
Activity Name: Technical Assistance for Budget and Financial Accountability - El Salvador
Activity Description: The advisor will provide assistance and advice to the General Directorate of the Treasury of the Ministry of Hacienda on implementing organizational and operational reforms to the Treasury. These reforms will focus on implementation of the Treasury Single Account concept and implementing and institutionalizing important Treasury reforms, which includes changes to regulations, procedures manuals, organizational charts, job descriptions, banking arrangements and information systems. The advisor will provide project management assistance to insure that the various components of the TSA and organizational and functional changes stay on track and are accomplished within the expected timeframes. The advisor will assist with project objectives which include: modernize liquidity management to optimize the governments cash flow and financial programming; develop updates and amendments to budget and financial management laws, regulations, technical manuals that support needed processes changes; develop and implement a new organizational structure to reflect the new roles and responsibilities of the DGT; and providing training and support to staff.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: PASA with the US Forest Service
Activity Description: This Participating Agency Service Agreement (PASA) with the U.S. Forest Service provides USAID with expert technical staff to develop and manage regional global climate change programs and to assist USG staff in the LAC region in designing and implementing country-specific climate change activities. Benefitting countries include Brazil, Eastern Caribbean regional countries, Colombia, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, El Salvador, Guatemala, Haiti, Honduras, Jamaica, Mexico and Peru. This agreement also contributes to USG Global Climate Change goals by providing expert technical assistance to support U.S. funded climate change activities in individual Latin American and Caribbean countries. Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Sub-category ID: Universities and Research Institutes - United States
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Municipal Competitiveness Project (MCP)
Activity Description: With the goal of creating an environment for municipalities to attract investment, improve economic development, and generate jobs across the country, RTI is providing technical assistance to improve municipal policies and practices so that they better serve private sector needs; institutionalizing the Municipal Competitiveness Index (MCI)designed and piloted in 2009 by RTI with support from USAIDto measure municipal performance over time and maintain the momentum for reform; and stimulating public-private engagement, entrepreneurship development, and improved access to finance for small and medium enterprises.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Office of Technical Assistance
Funding Account Name: International Affairs Technical Assistance
Activity Name: Technical Assistance for Budget and Financial Accountability - El Salvador
Activity Description: The advisor will provide assistance and advice to the General Directorate of the Treasury of the Ministry of Hacienda on implementing organizational and operational reforms to the Treasury. These reforms will focus on implementation of the Treasury Single Account concept and implementing and institutionalizing important Treasury reforms, which includes changes to regulations, procedures manuals, organizational charts, job descriptions, banking arrangements and information systems. The advisor will provide project management assistance to insure that the various components of the TSA and organizational and functional changes stay on track and are accomplished within the expected timeframes. The advisor will assist with project objectives which include: modernize liquidity management to optimize the governments cash flow and financial programming; develop updates and amendments to budget and financial management laws, regulations, technical manuals that support needed processes changes; develop and implement a new organizational structure to reflect the new roles and responsibilities of the DGT; and providing training and support to staff.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Diaspora resources for community development
Activity Description: In collaboration with Comite La Estrechura de Maryland (Comite La Estrechura) a U.S-based hometown association of Salvadorans Asociacian de Desarrollo Comunal Los Almendros (ADESCOLA) will help young adults in La Estrechura San Miguel develop their leadership potential and jobs skills that include boat and automobile maintenance and electrical work. ADESCOLA expects 600 Salvadorans to benefit from better income; another 1000 residents should benefit from the young people's engagement in community development.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Environmental Assessments
Activity Description: Due diligence funding is used to obtain sufficient information to evaluate, assess and appraise projects during compact development, effectively oversee and monitor compact implementation, conduct quality assurance, and then evaluate the results of a compact project once complete.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
International Purpose Name: Multisector aid for basic social services
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Human Development Project
Activity Description: The Community Development Activity aims to dramatically increase access of the Northern Zone's poor to basic public services and infrastructure.MCC Funding will enhance access to water systems for approximately 90,000 and to improved sanitation services for approximately 50,000 of the poorest inhabitants in the Northern Zone. Specifically, MCC Funding will support the following: (1) Feasibility studies, project designs, and environmental assessments for water supply and sanitation infrastructure; (2) Construction of potable water systems and sanitation systems (e.g., household latrines) in approximately twenty-five (25) municipalities of the Northern Zone; (3) Technical assistance for community capacity building, to ensure system maintenance and sustainability (4) Community education related to appropriate health and sanitation practices.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Infrastructure Project
Activity Description: The Border Crossing Infrastructure Activity seeks to relieve the freight and passenger traffic congestion at the border crossing into Honduras at El Amatillo by: (A) rehabilitating and improving up to a 5.74 kilometer road from Agua Salada to El Amatillo; and (B) improving and modernizing the border crossing facilities on the Salvadoran side of the La Amistad Bridge and the site on the Pan American Highway. Specifically, MCC Funding and the Government Contribution will support: implementation of construction activities for the improvement, and rehabilitation of the road from Agua Salada to El Amatillo; land acquisition (including RAP implementation, as applicable) for the road and one control center (with two control stations); implementation of environmental and social mitigation measures as identified in the ESIAs, Strategic RAP, and specific RAPs, or as otherwise may be appropriate; the construction of the control center, including buildings, internal access and connecting roads, parking areas, stormwater drainage, potable water supply system, wastewater treatment plant, lighting, and other infrastructure components that may be necessary for the effective functioning of these control stations; and Project management, supervision, technical services required for implementation, and auditing, as appropriate.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC PRODUCTIVE DEVELOPMENT PROJECT
Activity Description: This project aims to assist with the development of profitable and sustainable productive business ventures, with a primary focus on assisting poor farmers shift to the cultivation of high-value crops, forestry, and animal products.? Specifically, MCC funding aims to: Support capital investment to selected applicants for commercial activities; Provide credit guarantees and technical assistance to financial institutions; and Provide crop insurance to small producers in the Northern Zone.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Business Development Services
Activity Description: The Regulatory Improvement Activity will prioritize and promote investment climate reforms resulting in more efficient and profitable business operations for firms doing business in El Salvador. Specifically, MCC Funding will support: the development of an institutional framework and system, including an institution to focus on regulatory improvement, and the prioritization and implementation of a select set of key reforms; and a public-private dialogue to provide a transparent and user-driven input to the design and implementation of improved regulation, as well as public and private ownership and accountability for the reforms.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Connectivity Project
Activity Description: To design and construct openings of approximately 50 km of secondary1 roads; to improve approximately 160 km to secondary road standards; and to rehabilitate approximately 80 km to secondary road standards. Specifically, MCC Funding will support the following: (i) Design; environmental assessment, as needed (to include, if necessary, supplemental EIAs, EMPs, and RAPs); and construction activities for the opening, improvement, or rehabilitation of approximately 290 km of the NTH; (ii) Implementation of environmental and social mitigation measures as identified in the EIA, or as otherwise may be appropriate, to include compensation for physical and economic displacement of individuals, residences and businesses affected by such rehabilitation and construction, consistent with the World Bank's Operational Policy on Involuntary Resettlement (OP 4.12), and implementation of HIV/AIDS awareness plans satisfactory to MCC; (iii) Design and construction of drainage structures, as may be required; (iv) Design and construction of all necessary new bridges and rehabilitation of existing bridge structures, as may be required; (v) Posting of signage and incorporating other safety improvements; (vi) Project management, supervision and auditing of such improvements and upgrades; and (vii) Training in environmental management.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Monitoring and Evaluation
Activity Description: The Accountable Entity's monitoring and evaluation costs, which include monitoring, reporting and dissemination, GIS, data collection and data quality reviews.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Infrastructure Project
Activity Description: The Coastal Highway Expansion Activity seeks to relieve congestion at the most-trafficked segment of El Salvador?s coastal highway (?CA-2?). The CA-2 is one of the two most important logistical corridors in the country and connects the country?s major logistical nodes, including its two sea ports (La Union and Acajutla) and SAL. The Activity will finance three segments of CA-2: the 7.22 kilometer segment from Comalapa to La Herradura, the 16.98 kilometer segment from La Herradura to Zacatecoluca, and the 2.97 kilometer segment from La Libertad intersection to the Comapala Airport Road intersection.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Human Capital Project
Activity Description: The TVET System Reform Activity seeks to harmonize the skills supplied by private and public education and training providers with the skills demanded by the labor market. The detailed design and implementation of the TVET System Reform Activity will be informed by the results of the ongoing studies funded as part of the development of this Compact.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Infrastructure Project
Activity Description: The Border Crossing Infrastructure Activity seeks to relieve the freight and passenger traffic congestion at the border crossing into Honduras at El Amatillo by: (A) rehabilitating and improving up to a 5.74 kilometer road from Agua Salada to El Amatillo; and (B) improving and modernizing the border crossing facilities on the Salvadoran side of the La Amistad Bridge and the site on the Pan American Highway. Specifically, MCC Funding and the Government Contribution will support: implementation of construction activities for the improvement, and rehabilitation of the road from Agua Salada to El Amatillo; land acquisition (including RAP implementation, as applicable) for the road and one control center (with two control stations); implementation of environmental and social mitigation measures as identified in the ESIAs, Strategic RAP, and specific RAPs, or as otherwise may be appropriate; the construction of the control center, including buildings, internal access and connecting roads, parking areas, stormwater drainage, potable water supply system, wastewater treatment plant, lighting, and other infrastructure components that may be necessary for the effective functioning of these control stations; and Project management, supervision, technical services required for implementation, and auditing, as appropriate.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
US Sector Name: Rule of Law and Human Rights
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Justice Sector Strengthening Project
Activity Description: A five-year contract by USAID to implement the Justice Sector Strengthening Project in El Salvador. This is a follow-on contract to the task order that the Company executed in El Salvador from 2008 to 2012, and builds upon important accomplishments in the areas of community policing, assistance for the victims of domestic and sexual violence, and court administration. the Company will expand community policing activities to help reduce crime and violence. The Company also will work to improve case tracking and case management systems in the courts, develop inter-institutional protocols to improve the quality of criminal investigations, and establish victims assistance centers to provide medical, psychological and legal services for the victims of domestic and sexual violence. Finally, the Company will work with civil society organizations to enhance transparency and accountability in the criminal justice system.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: IMAGINA project
Activity Description: The IMAGINA Project: A new five-year crime prevention activity expected to be implemented by Fundacin Salvadorea para el Desarrollo Econmico y Social de El Salvador (FUSADES) and Fundacin Crislida (Glasswing) to provide a local citizens observatory of quality of life that generates reliable and comparable information about different quality of life dimensions, including citizen participation. The new activity will also support the renovation of Parque Cuscatln, a major park located in San Salvador, by establishing a trust fund with a local bank to manage private sector contributions for renovation and ongoing maintenance.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Crime and Violence Prevention Project (CVPP)
Activity Description: The U.S. Agency for International Development-funded El Salvador Violence and Crime Prevention Project is addressing this troubling situation by improving the ability of communities, municipalities and national institutions to address violent crime. Building on Creatives success with violence prevention programs elsewhere in Central America, this five-year project introduces community focused initiatives in 55 Salvadoran municipalities. Creative is working with the government to finalize the National System for the Prevention of Violence Law and the National Strategy for Social Violence Prevention in Support of Municipalities, a vital document that sets country-wide policy and empowers municipalities to take the lead on prevention projects. At the municipal level, a complete diagnostic guide incorporates 13 risk factors developed by Creative. The program is also creating municipal observatories, which will collect and corroborate crime and violence data, and developing municipal crime and Violence Prevention Committees that will create action plans in their communities.By the projects end, Creative anticipates a higher level of safety for Salvadorans living in the 55 target municipalities, as well as stronger community, municipal and national structures that are able to respond to and prevent violent crime.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Educar y Convivir: Familias y Escuelas libres de violencia
Activity Description: The mission of the project is to contribute to the social cohesion of Salvadoran communities through the transformation of schools into Integral Centers for Coexistence. The project will be implemented in 50 educational corridors within the municipalities prioritized in the El Salvador Seguro Plan (PESS). Each corridor will consist of at least two schools and three surrounding communities, with interventions that will last at least two years in each site.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Bridges for Employment
Activity Description: USAID Bridges for Employment will partner with the Ministry of Education, Ministry of Labor, vocational training centers/institutes, civil society organizations, and the private sector to improve employment opportunities for at-risk youth living in high-crime municipalities prioritized by the Government of El Salvador. The activity will reduce youth engagement in illicit activities and illegal migration. To achieve this, USAID works with young Salvadorans and employs an inclusive-systems approach that links government, service providers, training providers, and the private sector to help youth acquire the skills they need for success. The activity will develop and deliver on-the-job training programs; support youth entrepreneur initiatives; and support inclusion of young women, LGBTI youth, youth with disabilities, and at-risk youth in the workforce. This activity contributes to the Education and Workforce Development line of action under the Prosperity pillar of the U.S. Strategy for Central America. The project also contributes directly to USAID's Education Strategy Goal 2 "improved ability of tertiary and workforce development programs to produce a workforce with relevant skills to support country development " and Goal 3 "increased equitable access to education in crisis and conflict environments." It also contributes to Strategic Objective 1.2 of the Joint Regional Strategy, which addresses the security, governance, and economic drivers of illegal immigration and illicit trafficking in Central America. [CARSI]

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Sub-category ID: Universities and Research Institutes - United States
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Higher Education
Activity Description: The Higher Education project strengthens the ability of higher education institutions to develop a workforce that is responsive to private sector needs to contribute to economic growth. The project will work with higher education institutions and the private sector to improve and update curricula and link tertiary education with labor market needs. Activities will build the institutional capacity of higher education institutions and official entities to expand the use of applied research and provide new and updated academic programs, and to develop partnerships between academia and the private sector. Faculty and staff will receive professional development through specialized technical assistance, training, and degree programs. Activities will also support career centers, internship programs, and academic programs in priority economic sectors.
