Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Promoting Citizen Participation in Public Policy in  El Salvador
Activity Description: Through this activity, USAID will contribute to the CEN by improving democratic governance and reinforcing the capacities of leaders and civil society organizations to participate in and influence the electoral processes. The activity is undertaking a set of interventions to improve civil society's influence on public policies in two areas: a) to increase civil society's ability to exercise their political rights in the electoral processes 2018-2019 cycle; and b) to affect public policy agendas at the municipal and national levels. USAID will do so by convening workshops with civil society organizations to develop policy recommendations for presidential candidates, and creating dialogue spaces for citizens and civil society to engage with candidates on these issues to shape policy platforms and inform the electorate.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Western Hemisphere Affairs
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: U.S. Department of State: Bureau of Western Hemisphere Affairs (WHA) - Multi-sector - Unspecified: E Commerce Capacity Building Projec
Activity Description: U.S. Department of State: Bureau of Western Hemisphere Affairs (WHA) - Multi-sector - Unspecified. Economic Support Fund. To Build The Capacities Of Msmes And Support Their Use Of E-commerce Platforms To Increase Sales And Reach New Markets.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
International Purpose Name: Public sector policy and administrative management
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Domestic Resource Mobilization Program
Activity Description: Through the Domestic Resource Mobilization (DRM) activity, USAID supports the GOES in enhancing public financial management practices, increasing domestic revenue mobilization and generating additional revenue for the public sector. USAID will use FY 2020 funds to support GOES financial management efforts as the country deals with loans and inflating expenses due to the COVID-19 outbreak. This activity will enhance transparency of COVID-19-related budgeting, anti-corruption and accountability efforts. It will also enable the maintenance of government funding and services to the most vulnerable segments of Salvadoran society that are likely to migrate. The activity provides technical assistance to the GOES Ministry of Finance (MOF) in tax policy, public administration, public expenditure and revenue management systems, and it works to increase dialogue between the government, the private sector, and civil society. It will facilitate technical assistance, training, direct IT support, and limited equipment support, to help the MOF implement a new financial management system. This will aid the GOES in developing a more efficient procurement process and reducing procurement costs.DRM will support both the Ministries of Health and Education in the implementation of a multi-year, results-oriented programmatic budget. Providing technical assistance, training and support from international advisors will allow management to make informed decisions on allocating scarce resources. DRM will also provide the MOF with recommendations tailored to mitigate negative economic and social impacts due

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: USAID Bureau - Other
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Anti-Corruption Reforms
Activity Description: Promote governance institutions, processes, and policies that are transparent and accountable across all development sectors. Support non-governmental as well as governmental institutions (including enforcement and investigation entities, independent audit agencies, anti-corruption commissions, procurement agencies, legislatures, line ministries, independent agencies, political parties, judicial actors, as well as civil society organizations, academia, press and the private sector). Support civic education and advocacy for reform of laws and practices or directly improving accountability and transparency of governance processes covering various development sectors.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Civil Society and Democracy in the Eastern Region Project
Activity Description: Through this activity, USAID will create a Center for Research and Training in Democratic Governance and Transparency at the Eastern University (UNIVO) with the aim of  promoting dialogue, discussion, and advocacy on key issues such as governance, corruption, and transparency. The implementer will partner with a U.S. university (to be selected during the first year of the activity) to both support the creation of this Center and train researchers and faculty members of UNIVO. The activity's objective is to strengthen the democratic culture in the eastern region which is particularly vulnerable to irregular migration and El Salvador in general. Moreover, it will promote civic education by training civil society organizations in analysis, discussion, and advocacy. Due to UNIVO's location, the focus will be primarily in the east of El Salvador, which has the added benefit of serving a traditionally underserved cohort of civil society.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Reconstruction of the Jose Maria Peralta Lagos School in Quetzaltepeque
Activity Description: The objective of this Cooperative Agreement is to procure and execute the design, construction supervision and actual construction of the "I.N. Jose Maria Peralta Lagos" (JMPL) School in La Libertad, El Salvador under the USAID Tropical Storm Ida Reconstruction Project. This Cooperative Agreement includes an integral approach that involves architectural and engineering services, strengthened community resilience by means of competency development in disaster risk reduction, climate change adaptation, migration education, and related community engagement activities.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Child Protection Systems Strengthening activity
Activity Description: The Child Protection Systems Strengthening activity will support the Salvadoran Institute for Children and Adolescents, the National Council on Children and Adolescents, and other key child protection actors to improve community-based support to vulnerable children and families. Weakened family structures, poverty, and a lack of adequate social services all contribute to the current citizen security crisis in El Salvador. A functioning case management system, standardized referral mechanisms, and community-level services are necessary to equip families and children with the tools they need to stay safe and productive in their own homes. Key populations will include returning migrant children and families, victims of crime (including trafficking), and children living in high-crime and high-out migration municipalities.

Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Agroecological production, nutritional consumption and local commerce.
Activity Description: Smallholder farmers in El Salvador face a number of challenges to grow and process their crops, secure better nutrition for their families, and access markets to earn income. Centro Salvadoreo de Tecnologa Apropiada (CESTA) trains farmers to implement effective agroecological practices and launch rural enterprises to improve livelihoods. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to expand economic opportunity in El Salvador. CESTAs activities support smallholder agriculture and food production to enhance food security and ensure meaningful opportunities for communities to thrive. This grant is part of our broader initiative to support economic prosperity, democracy and governance consistent with the U.S. Strategy for Engagement in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin de Estudios para la Aplicacin del Derecho
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Empowering residents in San Luis La Herradura y San Pedro Masahuat to fight for legal security of land tenure
Activity Description: Many residents of coastal zones in El Salvador lack formal land titles, which impedes their ability to access adequate housing and livelihoods, increases their chances of being displaced and excludes them from local decision-making processes. Fundacin de Estudios para la Aplicacin del Derecho (FESPAD) trains residents of six communities in the department of La Paz in how to secure legal titles for their lands, engage in dialogue with local officials and raise awareness of their situation among lawmakers, public authorities and civil society organizations. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to strengthen governance. FESPADs activities promote and protect economic rights and fundamental freedoms of individuals and communities. This grant is part of our broader initiative to support economic prosperity, democracy and governance consistent with U.S. Strategy for Engagement in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Cooperativa de Comercializacin y Produccin Agrcola Compaero Erick de R.L.
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Strengthening Production, Productivity, Processing and Marketing of Basic Grains in the department of Usulutn.
Activity Description: Smallholder farmers in El Salvador face a number of challenges to grow and process their crops, assure better nutrition for their families, and access markets. Asociacin Cooperativa de Comercializacin y Produccin Agrcola Compaero Erick (ACOPROERICK) trains and provides technical assistance in organic production of basic grains, fruits and vegetables. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to expand economic opportunity in El Salvador. ACOPROERICKs activities support smallholder agriculture and food production to enhance food security, improve farmers income and ensure meaningful opportunities for communities to thrive. This grant is part of our broader initiative to support economic prosperity, democracy and governance consistent with the U.S. Strategy for Engagement in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Democracy, Conflict and Humanitarian Assistance
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, International Disaster Assistance
Activity Name: Disaster Readiness
Activity Description: The provision of effective protection, assistance, and durable solutions for refugees, internally displaced persons (IDPs), and other victims of conflict and disasters.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Superate
Activity Description: This public-private alliance supports the prosperity pillar of the CEN Strategy by improving educational opportunities for underprivileged high school students with high academic scores. It addresses the lack of opportunities for youth and fosters broad-based engagement in crime prevention efforts. USAID will leverage private sector resources to open new and maintain existing Supérate training centers that emphasize development of information technology, English language, and life skills. Funds will be also used for providing services to current students and recent graduates, including career advice, assistance with employment searches, and facilitating continued involvement with Supérate as role models and mentors to disadvantaged youth in their communities. Activities will enable youth between the ages of 13 and 18 to develop critical skillsets needed to make a successful transition to higher education and/or promising professional opportunities after high school.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Culture and art for social change in communities of northeastern and southern Chalatenango.
Activity Description: Communities in El Salvador face high out-migration rates, with children left behind to be cared for by busy relatives. Tiempos Nuevos Teatro (TNT) ensures that youth have a positive place to go and grow at school and after school with activities aimed to increase the career, civic and cultural competencies of youth through workshops in communications, art and analytical skills. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to creating inclusive societies in Latin America and the Caribbean. TNTs activities support critical thinking, effective and respectful communication and opportunities to participate in decision-making. This grant is part of a broader IAF initiative focused on supporting economic prosperity, democracy, and governance consistent with the U.S. Strategy for Engagement in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Comit de Familiares de Migrantes Fallecidos y Desaparecidos de El Salvador
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Strengthening and creation of organizational skills. entrepreneurship and human rights advocacy for relatives of deceased or disappeared migrants
Activity Description: Families of missing or deceased migrants face economic pressure and emotional stress that impact their lives. Asociacin Comit de Familiares de Migrantes Fallecidos y Desaparecidos de El Salvador (COFAMIDE) draws attention to the risks of undocumented migration and improves the livelihoods of families of deceased and missing migrants through support for their business initiatives. At the IAF, we support communityled solutions to expand economic opportunity in El Salvador. COFAMIDEs activities promote alternatives to migration by creating economic opportunities and promoting human rights. This grant is part of our broader initiative to support economic prosperity, democracy and governance consistent with the U.S. Strategy for Engagement in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Office of Technical Assistance
Funding Account Name: International Affairs Technical Assistance
Activity Name: Technical Assistance for Budget and Financial Accountability - El Salvador
Activity Description: The advisor will provide assistance and advice to the General Directorate of the Treasury of the Ministry of Hacienda on implementing organizational and operational reforms to the Treasury. These reforms will focus on implementation of the Treasury Single Account concept and implementing and institutionalizing important Treasury reforms, which includes changes to regulations, procedures manuals, organizational charts, job descriptions, banking arrangements and information systems. The advisor will provide project management assistance to insure that the various components of the TSA and organizational and functional changes stay on track and are accomplished within the expected timeframes. The advisor will assist with project objectives which include: modernize liquidity management to optimize the governments cash flow and financial programming; develop updates and amendments to budget and financial management laws, regulations, technical manuals that support needed processes changes; develop and implement a new organizational structure to reflect the new roles and responsibilities of the DGT; and providing training and support to staff.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Mdicos por el Derecho a la Salud
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Agriculture and nutrition for basic needs
Activity Description: Smallholder farmers in El Salvador face drought and other challenges to securing better nutrition and food security for their families, and thereby help reduce the possibility of migration. Mdicos por Derecho a la Salud (MDS) trains families with low-weight children to improve the productivity and diversity of their crops and enhance their diets. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to expand economic opportunity in Latin America and the Caribbean. MDSs activities support smallholder agriculture and food production to enhance food security and ensure meaningful opportunities for communities to thrive. This grant is part of a broader IAF initiative focused on supporting economic prosperity, democracy, and governance consistent with the U.S. Strategy for Engagement in Central America.

Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Transformation and social cohesion through Brazilian percussion as a tool for social impact.
Activity Description: Salvadoran migrants have limited access to economic opportunities, encounter discrimination, and receive limited support as they attempt to reintegrate into society. Alianza de Salvadoreos Retornados (ALSARE) facilitates the economic and social reintegration of returned migrants and raises awareness about issues they face. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to expand economic opportunity and strengthen governance in El Salvador. ALSAREs activities encourage small business growth and strengthen excluded communities so they can improve their living conditions and participate equally in a nations political, economic and social life. This grant is part of our broader initiative to support economic prosperity, democracy and governance consistent with the U.S. Strategy for Engagement in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service
Funding Account Name: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund
Activity Name: Expanding hawksbill nesting beach protection and bycatch reduction at critical nesting and foraging sites in the eastern Pacific Ocean.
Activity Description: The recipient will work with local communities to build teams to patrol 40 km of hawkbsill nesting beaches from April 15 - October 15 to protect nests through relocation to hatcheries using best management practices, conduct education outreach activities with local communities including an annual Hawksbill Festival "Day of the Hawksbill" activities in local schools, work with local communities to develop eco tourism activities, collect data on lobster fisheries and hawksbill bycatch, and work with local fisherman to develop strategies to reduce hawksbill bycatch .

Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Youth Organization and Community Strengthening to revive spaces for social harmony and prevent violence in the urban zone of Armenia Municipality
Activity Description: JOPROAR will train 100 young people in four urban neighborhoods in Armenia to develop their leadership and civic engagement skills. JOPROAR will train the 130 youth in leadership community engagement violence prevention and improving job skills. JOPROAR will work with new community committees to decide on public spaces to rehabilitate. A youth-led organization JOPROAR will improve its communications and management skills. The grant will benefit 250 people directly and another 3700 indirectly.

Funding Account Name: International Affairs Technical Assistance
Activity Name: Technical Assistance for Banking & Financial Services - El Salvador
Activity Description: Intermittent advisor is providing technical assistance to the Instituto de Garantia de depositos of El Salvador in updating their legal framework to adapt their deposit insurance scheme and resolution process to the Internationally accepted best practices such as the IADI Core Principles for Effective Deposit Insurance Systems and the Key Attributes of Effective Resolution Frameworks.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Comunal Comit de Desarrollo Turstico de Meanguera
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Community tourism in Meanguera, Morazn
Activity Description: Working with Asociacin Cooperativa Mezcal Historia y Color Asociacin Comunal Comit de Desarrollo Turstico de Meanguera (CDT-Meanguera) will help farmers in Morazn and microentrepreneurs generate income from tourism and other sources. The program includes training in production of crafts the diversification of agriculture and food-processing and related technical assistance; support accessing markets; and the promotion of local attractions products and services. The work should benefit 100 residents of Meanguera directly and 500 indirectly.

Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Salvadorea de Personas Ciegas y Discapacidades Mltiples para la Superacin Integral
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Training and employment generation for blind Salvadorans
Activity Description: Persons with disabilities (PWD) in El Salvador confront physical and mental health challenges to social and economic inclusion. Asociacin Salvadorea de Personas Ciegas y Discapacidades Mltiples para la Superacin Integral (ASPCDIMSI) provides training and assistance to PWD in leadership, disability rights and jobs skills. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to expand economic opportunity in El Salvador. ASPCDIMSIs activities support local entrepreneurship to ensure meaningful opportunities for communities to thrive. This grant is part of our broader initiative to support economic prosperity, democracy and governance consistent with the U.S. Strategy for Engagement in Central America.

Activity Description: Asociacin Cooperativa de Produccin Pesquera Reyes del Sol de R.L. Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service
Funding Account Name: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund
Activity Name: Vital support for hawksbills in the eastern Pacific Ocean: Year V of conservation at top-tier.nesting beaches
Activity Description: The purpose of this project is to implement a conservation program that will contribute to the recovery of the East Pacific hawksbill population, the smallest and most endangered hawksbill nesting population in the world with fewer than 700 nesting females. The intent of this project is to conduct community based nesting beach conservation projects on four of the most important nesting beaches in El Salvador and Ecuador. Activities include; 1) community based patrols to deter illegal poaching of nesting females and eggs and counting of nests to monitor population trends at Los Cobanos and Punta Amapala, El Salvador and Machalilla and El Pelado in Ecuador, and 2) relocation of nests threatened by poaching or tidal inundation to safe beach hatcheries.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Domestic Resource Mobilization Program
Activity Description: Through the Domestic Resource Mobilization (DRM) activity, USAID supports the GOES in enhancing public financial management practices, increasing domestic revenue mobilization and generating additional revenue for the public sector. USAID will use FY 2020 funds to support GOES financial management efforts as the country deals with loans and inflating expenses due to the COVID-19 outbreak. This activity will enhance transparency of COVID-19-related budgeting, anti-corruption and accountability efforts. It will also enable the maintenance of government funding and services to the most vulnerable segments of Salvadoran society that are likely to migrate. The activity provides technical assistance to the GOES Ministry of Finance (MOF) in tax policy, public administration, public expenditure and revenue management systems, and it works to increase dialogue between the government, the private sector, and civil society. It will facilitate technical assistance, training, direct IT support, and limited equipment support, to help the MOF implement a new financial management system. This will aid the GOES in developing a more efficient procurement process and reducing procurement costs.DRM will support both the Ministries of Health and Education in the implementation of a multi-year, results-oriented programmatic budget. Providing technical assistance, training and support from international advisors will allow management to make informed decisions on allocating scarce resources. DRM will also provide the MOF with recommendations tailored to mitigate negative economic and social impacts due

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin de Desarrollo Comunal El Rodeo
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Improving family farms in El Rodeo, Polors, La Unin
Activity Description: People in the hamlets of Laja Blanca, El Chaparro and El Rodeo in Polors, La Unin live in one of the least wooded and most arid areas of El Salvador, and food security is a critical issue. ADESCOER provides technical assistance to families in these communities to diversify family arms with appropriate crops, poultry and improved beef and dairy cattle production. Its activities improve markets for local products and establish relationships with other area groups and public institutions, to access training and learning opportunities. ADESCOER allows marginalized residents to introduce sustainable practices, build a stronger organization and community, and reduce incentives to migrate. The project will benefit 60 individuals directly and 240 persons indirectly. This grant is part of a broader IAF initiative focused on supporting economic prosperity, democracy, and governance consistent with the U.S. Strategy for Engagement in Central America.

Activity Name: Espacios de Desarrollo Cultural en El Salvador
Activity Description: In collaboration with community organizations Museo de la Palabra y la Imagen (MUPI) will bring rural areas exhibits and film forums on migration women's issues environmental concerns and other topics and will train residents to manage exhibits and develop materials for them. It will evaluate the impact of migration-related programming on the likelihood of young adults migrating and will collaborate with diaspora organizations on cultural events in the U.S. The work will benefit 3600 rural Salvadorans directly 10000 indirectly and should strengthen MUPI as an institution. ....

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Intercomunal de Comunidades Unidas para el Desarrollo Econmico y Social del Bajo Lempa
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Sustainable income generating and risk mitigation opportunities in communities vulnerable to climate change in Bajo Lempa, Jiquilisco.
Activity Description: Asociacin Intercomunal de Comunidades Unidas para el Desarrollo Econmico y Social del Bajo Lempa (ACUDESBAL) will collaborate with three grassroots organizations to develop their resilience to climate change improve agricultural production for food security while enhancing income-generating opportunities for smallholder farmers women and young adults. The grant includes training technical assistance and materials for residents on risk mitigation sustainable agriculture and vocations; livestock vegetables grains and shrimp; and peer-to-peer exchanges. ACUDESBAL anticipates that the grant will improve livelihoods and incorporate women and young adults into community life - especially those forced to seek work far from home due to lack of opportunities. Some 290 residents of 29 communities will benefit from activities directly and another 800 indirectly.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin de Estudios para la Aplicacin del Derecho
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Empowering residents in San Luis La Herradura y San Pedro Masahuat to fight for legal security of land tenure
Activity Description: Many residents of coastal zones in El Salvador lack formal land titles, which impedes their ability to access adequate housing and livelihoods, increases their chances of being displaced and excludes them from local decision-making processes. Fundacin de Estudios para la Aplicacin del Derecho (FESPAD) trains residents of six communities in the department of La Paz in how to secure legal titles for their lands, engage in dialogue with local officials and raise awareness of their situation among lawmakers, public authorities and civil society organizations. At the IAF, we support community-led solutions to strengthen governance. FESPADs activities promote and protect economic rights and fundamental freedoms of individuals and communities. This grant is part of our broader initiative to support economic prosperity, democracy and governance consistent with U.S. Strategy for Engagement in Central America.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Professional Management Services Contract; Center for Development.Innovation
Activity Description: In support of its efforts to promote innovative programming within the agency, the Center for Development Innovation within the U.S. Global Development Lab awarded a Professional Management Consulting services contract to DAI in September 2014. Under this 4-year contract, DAI provided support to 24 Operating Units across the agency, including every center within the Lab and 19 USAID Missions around world. This work was done through 50 buy-ins, and focused on developing pipelines for new breakthroughs by harnessing the best in American and global innovation and entrepreneurship and engaging broad range of communities and stakeholders.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin para el Desarrollo de Chinameca
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Educational program with practical training in the management of natural resources in Chinameca, El Salvador
Activity Description: Asociacin para el Desarrollo de Chinameca (ASDECHI) will provide training on agroecological practices for small-scale farmers in the municipality of Chinameca El Salvador. Project activities will center on families with an emphasis on the participation of young people who will learn how to reduce the use of agrochemicals to improve the quality of their production and increase its yield. This project will benefit 950 Salvadorians directly and 1700 more indirectly. ..

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Office of Technical Assistance
Funding Account Name: International Affairs Technical Assistance
Activity Name: Technical Assistance for Budget and Financial Accountability - El Salvador
Activity Description: The advisor will provide assistance and advice to the General Directorate of the Treasury of the Ministry of Hacienda on implementing organizational and operational reforms to the Treasury. These reforms will focus on implementation of the Treasury Single Account concept and implementing and institutionalizing important Treasury reforms, which includes changes to regulations, procedures manuals, organizational charts, job descriptions, banking arrangements and information systems. The advisor will provide project management assistance to insure that the various components of the TSA and organizational and functional changes stay on track and are accomplished within the expected timeframes. The advisor will assist with project objectives which include: modernize liquidity management to optimize the governments cash flow and financial programming; develop updates and amendments to budget and financial management laws, regulations, technical manuals that support needed processes changes; develop and implement a new organizational structure to reflect the new roles and responsibilities of the DGT; and providing training and support to staff.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Animal, Plant and Health Inspection Service
Funding Account Name: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Activity Name: International HLB forum on Citrus
Activity Description: A technical expert from APHIS' Center for Plant Health Science and Technology participated in the International HLB Forum on Citrus in San Salvador, El Salvador, on November 29th and 30th, 2017. The event included more than 150 people from 12 countries. The International Regional Organization of Agricultural Health (OIRSA) invited the APHIS plant pathologist as a keynote speaker to provide the participants with the latest information about the current situation, management and economic impact of the Huanglongbing (HLB) and Citrus Black Spot (CBS) diseases in the United States.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Improved Management and Conservation of Critical Watersheds (IMCCW)
Activity Description: Many inhabitants of the ecological corridors and watersheds of western El Salvador employ farming and other practices that contribute to environmental degradationtrends that threaten the sustainability of critical ecosystems, degrade water supplies and quality, and bind farmers to environmentally destructive subsistence farming. At the same time, growing markets for certified specialty coffees, high-quality fruits and vegetables, and ecotourism offer opportunities to generate income and improve environmental quality. To improve the economic situation in rural areas, the Government of El Salvadors development strategy focuses on enlisting local support for improved natural resources and generating better economic opportunities through higher-value agriculture and sustainable tourism, linked to improved management of El Salvadors water, land, and biological resources.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Anti-Corruption Reforms
Activity Description: Promote governance institutions, processes, and policies that are transparent and accountable across all development sectors. Support non-governmental as well as governmental institutions (including enforcement and investigation entities, independent audit agencies, anti-corruption commissions, procurement agencies, legislatures, line ministries, independent agencies, political parties, judicial actors, as well as civil society organizations, academia, press and the private sector). Support civic education and advocacy for reform of laws and practices or directly improving accountability and transparency of governance processes covering various development sectors.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin de Desarrollo Social Comunitario del Cantn El Morro
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Mitigating social violence and the pressure to migrate from El Morro, Chalatenango through culture, arts and sports programming, viable economic alternatives, and improved community organization
Activity Description: Asociacin de Desarrollo Social Comunitario del Cantn El Morro (ADESCO El Morro) will support residents of El Morro in Comalapa Chalatenango to prioritize and implement economic initiatives expand a community savings and loan fund to support those initiatives and incorporate children and young adults into community life through arts culture and sports. The grant includes technical advice and materials for economic initiatives and training in leadership and self-esteem for young community members. The grant will benefit 110 people directly and another 550 indirectly.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Small and Medium Enterprises Development
Activity Description: The Small and Medium Enterprises (SME) Development activity builds the capacity of the Government of El Salvador and private sector organizations to enable them to provide effective trade and business development services for SMEs. Major activities include technical assistance and training to SMEs seeking access to international markets and leveraging markets created by CAFTA-DR. This activity, which supports the Partnership for Growth Presidential Initiative, will establish linkages and alliances with private sector organizations to identify business opportunities for SMEs, especially those that are women-led, and develop their ability to sell their tradable products and services. These interventions will increase the competitiveness and productivity of SMEs in international markets, thereby increasing sales, incomes and employment. Building the capacity of a network of twelve local Small Business Development Centers to provide effective counseling, training and technical assistance to SMEs is a key element to ensure sustainability upon completion of this activity.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Adopt a School Program
Activity Description: FEPADE's (Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo) "Adopt a School" project was developed with the goal of supporting the private sector in El Salvador to adopt schools and improve the quality of public education. With funding from both the private sector and the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), FEPADE works with the Ministry of Education to identify public schools in need. Private businesses then "adopt" schools open to receiving support. - See more at: http://www.educationinnovations.org/program/adopte-una-escuela#sthash.pFHNv93V.dpuf

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Fiscal Policy and Expenditure Management Project (FPEMP)
Activity Description: The FPEMP project is helping the Government of El Salvador (GOES) increase tax revenue, without raising rates, and achieve greater transparency and accountability, and more efficiently use public resources. We are modernizing the General Directorate for Internal Revenue to improve taxpayer services, reduce tax fraud and tax evasion, and enhance legitimacy. The project builds on the foundations for reform laid by a preceding project called Tax Policy and Administration Reform that DAI led from 2005 to 2010.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: SolucionES
Activity Description: The five-year program will focus on the development and strengthening of anti-crime plans at the municipal level; increased social investment from the private sector to prevent violence by targeting at-risk youth; and research to help in the formation of effective public policies to prevent crime. SolucionES is led by la Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (FEPADE) and in addition to Glasswing includes la Fundacin Nacional para el Desarrollo (FUNDE), la Fundacin Salvadorea para la Salud y el Desarrollo Humano (FUSAL), y la Fundacin Salvadorea para el Desarrollo Econmico y Social (FUSADES). The five organizations are experts in the areas of education, health, community and economic development, research and youth leadership.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Louis Berger Group and Black & Veatch Joint Venture
International Purpose Name: Decentralisation and support to subnational government
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Strengthening Local Governance for Security and Development in El Salvador
Activity Description: The USAID-funded Strengthening Local Governance for Security and Development in El Salvador project aims to build consensus around increased decentralization, enhance intergovernmental coordination, and strengthen the ability of municipalities to plan for, administer, pay for and deliver effective, responsive services in a participatory and accountable manner.  The project will operate at the national, intermediary and municipal levels. At the national level, the project will focus on improving national support and frameworks for decentralization. At the intermediary level, the project will strengthen intergovernmental coordination and foster inter-municipal partnerships. At the municipal level, the project will build the fundamental capacity of municipalities to effectively govern.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Infrastructure Project
Activity Description: The Coastal Highway Expansion Activity seeks to relieve congestion at the most-trafficked segment of El Salvador?s coastal highway (?CA-2?). The CA-2 is one of the two most important logistical corridors in the country and connects the country?s major logistical nodes, including its two sea ports (La Union and Acajutla) and SAL. The Activity will finance three segments of CA-2: the 7.22 kilometer segment from Comalapa to La Herradura, the 16.98 kilometer segment from La Herradura to Zacatecoluca, and the 2.97 kilometer segment from La Libertad intersection to the Comapala Airport Road intersection.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: El Salvador Competitive
Activity Description: This Activity builds upon lessons learned from prior development investments and complements current USAID/El Salvador activities to enable Salvadoran businesses to become more competitive in global markets  .The Activity helps the Government of El Salvador (GOES) increase productivity and competitiveness in key economic sectors. It strengthens small and medium enterprise (SME) development, public-private partnerships, municipal competitiveness, and the business enabling environment by encouraging private sector investment, innovation, and job creation, thus fostering economic growth. The Activity contributes to the Business Development line of action under the Prosperity pillar of the U.S. Engagement Strategy with Central America.

Implementing Partner Name: U.S. Government - U.S. Agency for International Development
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Operating Expenses

Activity Description: USAID redacted this field in accordance with the exceptions outlined in the Foreign Aid Transparency and Accountability Act of 2016.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Bridges for Employment
Activity Description: USAID Bridges for Employment will partner with the Ministry of Education, Ministry of Labor, vocational training centers/institutes, civil society organizations, and the private sector to improve employment opportunities for at-risk youth living in high-crime municipalities prioritized by the Government of El Salvador. The activity will reduce youth engagement in illicit activities and illegal migration. To achieve this, USAID works with young Salvadorans and employs an inclusive-systems approach that links government, service providers, training providers, and the private sector to help youth acquire the skills they need for success. The activity will develop and deliver on-the-job training programs; support youth entrepreneur initiatives; and support inclusion of young women, LGBTI youth, youth with disabilities, and at-risk youth in the workforce. This activity contributes to the Education and Workforce Development line of action under the Prosperity pillar of the U.S. Strategy for Central America. The project also contributes directly to USAID's Education Strategy Goal 2 "improved ability of tertiary and workforce development programs to produce a workforce with relevant skills to support country development " and Goal 3 "increased equitable access to education in crisis and conflict environments." It also contributes to Strategic Objective 1.2 of the Joint Regional Strategy, which addresses the security, governance, and economic drivers of illegal immigration and illicit trafficking in Central America. [CARSI]

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Crime and Violence Prevention Project (CVPP)
Activity Description: The U.S. Agency for International Development-funded El Salvador Violence and Crime Prevention Project is addressing this troubling situation by improving the ability of communities, municipalities and national institutions to address violent crime. Building on Creatives success with violence prevention programs elsewhere in Central America, this five-year project introduces community focused initiatives in 55 Salvadoran municipalities. Creative is working with the government to finalize the National System for the Prevention of Violence Law and the National Strategy for Social Violence Prevention in Support of Municipalities, a vital document that sets country-wide policy and empowers municipalities to take the lead on prevention projects. At the municipal level, a complete diagnostic guide incorporates 13 risk factors developed by Creative. The program is also creating municipal observatories, which will collect and corroborate crime and violence data, and developing municipal crime and Violence Prevention Committees that will create action plans in their communities.By the projects end, Creative anticipates a higher level of safety for Salvadorans living in the 55 target municipalities, as well as stronger community, municipal and national structures that are able to respond to and prevent violent crime.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacion para la Educacion Integral Salvadorena
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Education for Children and Youth Activity
Activity Description: The activity is aligned to the prosperity and security pillars of the CEN Strategy by improving the quality of and access to educational opportunities for lower secondary school children and out-of-school youth in targeted high crime municipalities. Activities include: training principals, teachers, and students on improved learning methodologies; technical assistance, educational materials and equipment for safe spaces for learning; technical assistance for enhanced community participation to help reintegrate school drop-outs back into a formal school setting or to earn an equivalent diploma; vocational/life skills training to out-of-school youth; and institutional strengthening to a consortium of local education NGOs. Activities will support expansion of the GOES' full-time inclusive school model and will increase the capacity of local NGOs to manage education programs and directly contribute to USAID's goal of increasing access to education in crisis and conflict environments.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Sub-category ID: Universities and Research Institutes - United States
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Higher Education
Activity Description: The Higher Education project strengthens the ability of higher education institutions to develop a workforce that is responsive to private sector needs to contribute to economic growth. The project will work with higher education institutions and the private sector to improve and update curricula and link tertiary education with labor market needs. Activities will build the institutional capacity of higher education institutions and official entities to expand the use of applied research and provide new and updated academic programs, and to develop partnerships between academia and the private sector. Faculty and staff will receive professional development through specialized technical assistance, training, and degree programs. Activities will also support career centers, internship programs, and academic programs in priority economic sectors.

To achieve this, USAID works with young Salvadorans and employs an inclusive-systems approach that links government, service providers, training providers, and the private sector to help youth acquire the skills they need for success. The activity will develop and deliver on-the-job training programs; support youth entrepreneur initiatives; and support inclusion of young women, LGBTI youth, youth with disabilities, and at-risk youth in the workforce. This activity contributes to the Education and Workforce Development line of action under the Prosperity pillar of the U.S. Strategy for Central America. The project also contributes directly to USAID's Education Strategy Goal 2 "improved ability of tertiary and workforce development programs to produce a workforce with relevant skills to support country development " and Goal 3 "increased equitable access to education in crisis and conflict environments." It also contributes to Strategic Objective 1.2 of the Joint Regional Strategy, which addresses the security, governance, and economic drivers of illegal immigration and illicit trafficking in Central America. [CARSI]

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Domestic Resource Mobilization Program
Activity Description: Through the Domestic Resource Mobilization (DRM) activity, USAID supports the GOES in enhancing public financial management practices, increasing domestic revenue mobilization and generating additional revenue for the public sector. USAID will use FY 2020 funds to support GOES financial management efforts as the country deals with loans and inflating expenses due to the COVID-19 outbreak. This activity will enhance transparency of COVID-19-related budgeting, anti-corruption and accountability efforts. It will also enable the maintenance of government funding and services to the most vulnerable segments of Salvadoran society that are likely to migrate. The activity provides technical assistance to the GOES Ministry of Finance (MOF) in tax policy, public administration, public expenditure and revenue management systems, and it works to increase dialogue between the government, the private sector, and civil society. It will facilitate technical assistance, training, direct IT support, and limited equipment support, to help the MOF implement a new financial management system. This will aid the GOES in developing a more efficient procurement process and reducing procurement costs.DRM will support both the Ministries of Health and Education in the implementation of a multi-year, results-oriented programmatic budget. Providing technical assistance, training and support from international advisors will allow management to make informed decisions on allocating scarce resources. DRM will also provide the MOF with recommendations tailored to mitigate negative economic and social impacts due

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Government Integrity
Activity Description: The Government Integrity activity will support the efforts of the Government of El Salvador (GOES) and civil society organizations (CSOs) to implement transparency, ethics and anti-corruption reforms and promote citizen participation. Activities will include: sub-grants and technical assistance to CSOs to develop innovative monitoring and citizen participation initiatives; training and technical assistance to the GOES' Institute of Access to Public Information; training and technical assistance to 14 municipalities to strengthen their access to public information units and ethics commissions; technical assistance for the implementation and oversight of GOES' commitments under the Open Government Partnership (OGP); and support for advocacy efforts for civil service reform and the implementation of merit based systems. These activities will align the CEN Strategy governance pillar by helping the GOES maintain transparent and professional governance structures.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Bridges for Employment
Activity Description: USAID Bridges for Employment will partner with the Ministry of Education, Ministry of Labor, vocational training centers/institutes, civil society organizations, and the private sector to improve employment opportunities for at-risk youth living in high-crime municipalities prioritized by the Government of El Salvador. The activity will reduce youth engagement in illicit activities and illegal migration. To achieve this, USAID works with young Salvadorans and employs an inclusive-systems approach that links government, service providers, training providers, and the private sector to help youth acquire the skills they need for success. The activity will develop and deliver on-the-job training programs; support youth entrepreneur initiatives; and support inclusion of young women, LGBTI youth, youth with disabilities, and at-risk youth in the workforce. This activity contributes to the Education and Workforce Development line of action under the Prosperity pillar of the U.S. Strategy for Central America. The project also contributes directly to USAID's Education Strategy Goal 2 "improved ability of tertiary and workforce development programs to produce a workforce with relevant skills to support country development " and Goal 3 "increased equitable access to education in crisis and conflict environments." It also contributes to Strategic Objective 1.2 of the Joint Regional Strategy, which addresses the security, governance, and economic drivers of illegal immigration and illicit trafficking in Central America. [CARSI]

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
US Sector Name: Rule of Law and Human Rights
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Justice Sector Strengthening Project
Activity Description: A five-year contract by USAID to implement the Justice Sector Strengthening Project in El Salvador. This is a follow-on contract to the task order that the Company executed in El Salvador from 2008 to 2012, and builds upon important accomplishments in the areas of community policing, assistance for the victims of domestic and sexual violence, and court administration. the Company will expand community policing activities to help reduce crime and violence. The Company also will work to improve case tracking and case management systems in the courts, develop inter-institutional protocols to improve the quality of criminal investigations, and establish victims assistance centers to provide medical, psychological and legal services for the victims of domestic and sexual violence. Finally, the Company will work with civil society organizations to enhance transparency and accountability in the criminal justice system.

Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Strengthening Human Rights Systems in El Salvador
Activity Description: USAID/El Salvador will provide interventions that protect against or respond to human rights abuses and strengthen local human rights institutions, including the Attorney General's Office. [CARSI]

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Crime and Violence Prevention Project (CVPP)
Activity Description: The U.S. Agency for International Development-funded El Salvador Violence and Crime Prevention Project is addressing this troubling situation by improving the ability of communities, municipalities and national institutions to address violent crime. Building on Creatives success with violence prevention programs elsewhere in Central America, this five-year project introduces community focused initiatives in 55 Salvadoran municipalities. Creative is working with the government to finalize the National System for the Prevention of Violence Law and the National Strategy for Social Violence Prevention in Support of Municipalities, a vital document that sets country-wide policy and empowers municipalities to take the lead on prevention projects. At the municipal level, a complete diagnostic guide incorporates 13 risk factors developed by Creative. The program is also creating municipal observatories, which will collect and corroborate crime and violence data, and developing municipal crime and Violence Prevention Committees that will create action plans in their communities.By the projects end, Creative anticipates a higher level of safety for Salvadorans living in the 55 target municipalities, as well as stronger community, municipal and national structures that are able to respond to and prevent violent crime.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Infrastructure Project
Activity Description: The Border Crossing Infrastructure Activity seeks to relieve the freight and passenger traffic congestion at the border crossing into Honduras at El Amatillo by: (A) rehabilitating and improving up to a 5.74 kilometer road from Agua Salada to El Amatillo; and (B) improving and modernizing the border crossing facilities on the Salvadoran side of the La Amistad Bridge and the site on the Pan American Highway. Specifically, MCC Funding and the Government Contribution will support: implementation of construction activities for the improvement, and rehabilitation of the road from Agua Salada to El Amatillo; land acquisition (including RAP implementation, as applicable) for the road and one control center (with two control stations); implementation of environmental and social mitigation measures as identified in the ESIAs, Strategic RAP, and specific RAPs, or as otherwise may be appropriate; the construction of the control center, including buildings, internal access and connecting roads, parking areas, stormwater drainage, potable water supply system, wastewater treatment plant, lighting, and other infrastructure components that may be necessary for the effective functioning of these control stations; and Project management, supervision, technical services required for implementation, and auditing, as appropriate.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: International Business and Technical Consultants Inc.
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Trilateral Cooperation
Activity Description: The Trilateral Cooperation activity will primarily assist USAID Missions and governments of the Northern Triangle countries (El Salvador, Guatemala, and Honduras) to build trilateral cooperation among the United States, Central American countries, and selected donor countries, primarily from Latin America, as relevant. USAID will support the transfer of technical expertise, technology and knowledge, training and other resources to implement short-term, exploratory or pilot programs that address specific needs of Central American countries to support the U.S. Strategy for Engagement in Central America. Some interventions USAID is planning to carry out under this mechanism are in the areas of trade facilitation, supporting regional systems integration and coordination in border procedures; and clean energy that will advise municipal level leadership in the region on adopting successful models of off-grid energy financing to increase lighting in high crime areas.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Adopt a School Program
Activity Description: FEPADE's (Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo) "Adopt a School" project was developed with the goal of supporting the private sector in El Salvador to adopt schools and improve the quality of public education. With funding from both the private sector and the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), FEPADE works with the Ministry of Education to identify public schools in need. Private businesses then "adopt" schools open to receiving support. - See more at: http://www.educationinnovations.org/program/adopte-una-escuela#sthash.pFHNv93V.dpuf

Activity Name: Technical Assistance for Banking & Financial Services -El Salvador
Activity Description: Intermittent Advisor is providing support to the SSF to develop a new IT Risk Manual to ensure all necessary security protocols are in place. Support is also being provided to develop new supervisory methods for previously unsupervised financial cooperatives in addition to directing the development and implementation of a new website function allowing publication of appropriate financial sector time-series and relative analytical tools. A new regional study of Money Business Services will be initiated in the country with subsequent rollout expected throughout the region

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Anti-Corruption Reforms
Activity Description: Promote governance institutions, processes, and policies that are transparent and accountable across all development sectors. Support non-governmental as well as governmental institutions (including enforcement and investigation entities, independent audit agencies, anti-corruption commissions, procurement agencies, legislatures, line ministries, independent agencies, political parties, judicial actors, as well as civil society organizations, academia, press and the private sector). Support civic education and advocacy for reform of laws and practices or directly improving accountability and transparency of governance processes covering various development sectors.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Civic Participation
Activity Description: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs).  Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Nuevo Amanecer de El Salvador
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: An agroecological alternative for the environment and food security with a gender focus in the communities of San Julian and Cuisnahuat municipalities, Sonsonante Department
Activity Description: Associacin Nuevo Amanecer de El Salvador (ANADES) will train women and young people in San Julian and Cuisnahuat, to develop their leadership skills and employment prospects. The project will focus on training women in agroecology, savings and loan management, production management and value-added products to improve the participation and income for them and their families. ANADES expects to train 80 youth in positive roles for men and nursery maintenance. It will also develop its ANADES school model into an agroecology training facility. The grant will benefit 435 people directly and another 2,460 indirectly.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Superate
Activity Description: This public-private alliance supports the prosperity pillar of the CEN Strategy by improving educational opportunities for underprivileged high school students with high academic scores. It addresses the lack of opportunities for youth and fosters broad-based engagement in crime prevention efforts. USAID will leverage private sector resources to open new and maintain existing Supérate training centers that emphasize development of information technology, English language, and life skills. Funds will be also used for providing services to current students and recent graduates, including career advice, assistance with employment searches, and facilitating continued involvement with Supérate as role models and mentors to disadvantaged youth in their communities. Activities will enable youth between the ages of 13 and 18 to develop critical skillsets needed to make a successful transition to higher education and/or promising professional opportunities after high school.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Intersectorial para el Desarrollo Econmico y Progreso Social
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Promoting job opportunities in the arts and the peace culture as a means of preventing youth violence in El Salvador.
Activity Description: The Asociacin Intersectorial para el Desarrollo Econmico y Progreso Social in El Salvador (CIDEP) works with young people in six municipalities of El Salvador who face high violence rates. CIDEPs methodology not only reaches children and adolescents to give them job and life skills, but also involves and builds supportive local alliances of public authorities and civil society to sustain efforts. It will train young adults in the municipalities of Mejicanos, Ciudad Delgado, Cuscatancingo, Tecoluca, Zacatecoluca and Jiqulisco in leadership, violence prevention, art and culture, and job skills. These young people will form groups and organize community events to promote the culture of peace amidst violent neighborhoods. The grant will benefit 630 people directly and another 4,750 indirectly.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Office of Technical Assistance
Funding Account Name: International Affairs Technical Assistance
Activity Name: Technical Assistance for Budget and Financial Accountability -El Salvador
Activity Description: The advisor will provide assistance and advice to the General Directorate of the Treasury of the Ministry of Hacienda on implementing organizational and operational reforms to the Treasury. These reforms will focus on implementation of the Treasury Single Account concept and implementing and institutionalizing important Treasury reforms, which includes changes to regulations, procedures manuals, organizational charts, job descriptions, banking arrangements and information systems. The advisor will provide project management assistance to insure that the various components of the TSA and organizational and functional changes stay on track and are accomplished within the expected timeframes. The advisor will assist with project objectives which include: modernize liquidity management to optimize the governments cash flow and financial programming; develop updates and amendments to budget and financial management laws, regulations, technical manuals that support needed processes changes; develop and implement a new organizational structure to reflect the new roles and responsibilities of the DGT; and providing training and support to staff.

Activity Name: Economic autonomy and food security via agroecology to promote youth and women of the indigenous community of Nahuizalco, Sonsonate, El Salvador
Activity Description: Fundacin para el Desarrollo Socioeconmico y Restauracin Ambiental (FUNDESYRAM) will engage Nhuatl Pipil residents from four communities in Nahuizalco, department of Sonsonate, to increase incomes and improve living conditions by organizing farmers and introducing agroecological practices, vegetable gardens and small animal production. It will also train farmers in marketing skills and develop marketplaces to sell their production. Some 720 individuals, mainly indigenous women and youths, will benefit directly and 2,000 more indirectly.

Activity Name: Strengthening organizational and productive practices of small scale business women in the departments of Sonsonante and Ahuachapn
Activity Description: Associacin Agropecuaria de Mujeres Produciendo en la Tierra R.L. (AMSATI) will work with 40 women to increase their leadership, networking and advocacy skills, and business development skills. The women will launch four social enterprises in the areas of animal husbandry and agriculture, with the goal of increasing their income. AMSATI will develop a cohort of 60 trainers to strengthen the organization's capacity and reach more members. The grant will benefit 100 women directly in the municipalities of Izalco and San Francisco Menendez and another 2,188 indirectly, across the country.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Pro-Bsqueda de Nias y Nios Desaparecidos
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Leadership opportunities for Young Salvadorans
Activity Description: Asociacin Pro-Bsqueda de Nias y Nios Desaparecidos (Pro-Bsqueda) will work with young Salvadorans in 10 departments who face high levels of violence and poverty to develop their leadership and civic engagement skills, promote conflict resolution in their communities, and raise awareness on human rights. Pro-Bsqueda's activities focus on a new generation of people living with the legacy of the civil war and concurrently coping with the impact of the present cycle of violence in the country. Pro-Bsqueda will assess the conditions that affect young family members of disappeared as well as their psycho-social needs. Program activities also include support for their economic initiatives. The Grant will directly benefit 141 young adults affected by disappearances from the civil war and by current violence and will indirectly benefit at least 705 Salvadorans.

Activity Description: The Asociacin para el Desarrollo Sostenible de El Salvador (Popol Na), in coordination with the municipal environmental committee and the Asociacin Cooperativa de Comercializacin, Aprovisionamiento y Produccin Agropecuaria (Rigoberto Orellana) ACOPARO will train 60 farmers in sustainable, organic agricultural production to improve food security and create economic alternatives to migration. Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Strengthening Rural Entrepreneurships and a Community Marketing Network in the Communities of San Francisco Javier, San Agustn, Jiquilisco and Ozatln.
Activity Description: Asociacin Coordinadora de Comunidades Unidas de Usulutn (COMUS) will establish a community marketing network and promote rural entrepreneurship in nine communities from the municipalities of San Francisco Javier, San Agustn, Jiquilisco and Ozatln. The project will improve access to locally made products, expand rural microbusinesses, strengthen organizational skills of community associations, and increase family incomes. The grant will benefit 442 people directly and 2,000 people indirectly.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Fiscal Policy and Expenditure Management Project (FPEMP)
Activity Description: The FPEMP project is helping the Government of El Salvador (GOES) increase tax revenue, without raising rates, and achieve greater transparency and accountability, and more efficiently use public resources. We are modernizing the General Directorate for Internal Revenue to improve taxpayer services, reduce tax fraud and tax evasion, and enhance legitimacy. The project builds on the foundations for reform laid by a preceding project called Tax Policy and Administration Reform that DAI led from 2005 to 2010.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service
Funding Account Name: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund
Activity Name: Expanding hawksbill nesting beach protection and bycatch reduction at critical nesting and foraging sites in the eastern Pacific Ocean.
Activity Description: The recipient will work with local communities to build teams to patrol 40 km of hawkbsill nesting beaches from April 15 - October 15 to protect nests through relocation to hatcheries using best management practices, conduct education outreach activities with local communities including an annual Hawksbill Festival "Day of the Hawksbill" activities in local schools, work with local communities to develop eco tourism activities, collect data on lobster fisheries and hawksbill bycatch, and work with local fisherman to develop strategies to reduce hawksbill bycatch .

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacion Red de Sobrevivientes y Personas con Discapacidad El Salvador
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Access to services for persons with disabilities
Activity Description: Fundacin Red de Sobrevivientes y Personas con Discapacidad (Red de Sobrevivientes) will work with municipal offices, grassroots disability groups, and local authorities to create public policies on persons with disabilities (PWD). In addition to maintaining a registry of PWD, Red de Sobrevivientes will raise awareness of their needs, advocate for funding for their priorities, and advise the respective local government on policy and practices. It will also develop the technical, administrative and entrepreneurial skills of 20 grassroots disability associations in the departments of La Paz, Cuscatln, La Libertad and San Salvador. The project should benefit an additional 350 Salvadorans directly and another 1,050 indirectly.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin de Jvenes Pro Arte en Armenia
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Youth Organization and Community strengthening to revive spaces for social harmony and prevent violence in the urban zone of Armenia Municipality
Activity Description: JOPROAR will train 100 young people in four urban neighborhoods in Armenia to develop their leadership and civic engagement skills. JOPROAR will train the 130 youth in leadership, community engagement, violence prevention and improving job skills. JOPROAR will work with new community committees to decide on public spaces to rehabilitate. A youth-led organization, JOPROAR will improve its communications and management skills. The grant will benefit 250 people directly and another 3,700 indirectly.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Office of Technical Assistance
Funding Account Name: International Affairs Technical Assistance
Activity Name: Technical Assistance for Budget and Financial Accountability -El Salvador
Activity Description: The advisor will provide assistance and advice to the General Directorate of the Treasury of the Ministry of Hacienda on implementing organizational and operational reforms to the Treasury. These reforms will focus on implementation of the Treasury Single Account concept and implementing and institutionalizing important Treasury reforms, which includes changes to regulations, procedures manuals, organizational charts, job descriptions, banking arrangements and information systems. The advisor will provide project management assistance to insure that the various components of the TSA and organizational and functional changes stay on track and are accomplished within the expected timeframes. The advisor will assist with project objectives which include: modernize liquidity management to optimize the governments cash flow and financial programming; develop updates and amendments to budget and financial management laws, regulations, technical manuals that support needed processes changes; develop and implement a new organizational structure to reflect the new roles and responsibilities of the DGT; and providing training and support to staff.

Activity Name: PASA with the US Forest Service
Activity Description: This Participating Agency Service Agreement (PASA) with the U.S. Forest Service provides USAID with expert technical staff to develop and manage regional global climate change programs and to assist USG staff in the LAC region in designing and implementing country-specific climate change activities. Benefitting countries include Brazil, Eastern Caribbean regional countries, Colombia, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, El Salvador, Guatemala, Haiti, Honduras, Jamaica, Mexico and Peru. This agreement also contributes to USG Global Climate Change goals by providing expert technical assistance to support U.S. funded climate change activities in individual Latin American and Caribbean countries.
