Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Office of Technical Assistance
Funding Account Name: International Affairs Technical Assistance
Activity Name: Technical Assistance for Banking & Financial Services -El Salvador
Activity Description: Intermittent Advisor is providing support to the SSF to develop a new IT Risk Manual to ensure all necessary security protocols are in place. Support is also being provided to develop new supervisory methods for previously unsupervised financial cooperatives in addition to directing the development and implementation of a new website function allowing publication of appropriate financial sector time-series and relative analytical tools. A new regional study of Money Business Services will be initiated in the country with subsequent rollout expected throughout the region

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Office of Technical Assistance
Funding Account Name: International Affairs Technical Assistance
Activity Name: Technical Assistance for Budget and Financial Accountability -El Salvador
Activity Description: The advisor will provide assistance and advice to the General Directorate of the Treasury of the Ministry of Hacienda on implementing organizational and operational reforms to the Treasury. These reforms will focus on implementation of the Treasury Single Account concept and implementing and institutionalizing important Treasury reforms, which includes changes to regulations, procedures manuals, organizational charts, job descriptions, banking arrangements and information systems. The advisor will provide project management assistance to insure that the various components of the TSA and organizational and functional changes stay on track and are accomplished within the expected timeframes. The advisor will assist with project objectives which include: modernize liquidity management to optimize the governments cash flow and financial programming; develop updates and amendments to budget and financial management laws, regulations, technical manuals that support needed processes changes; develop and implement a new organizational structure to reflect the new roles and responsibilities of the DGT; and providing training and support to staff.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Drug Enforcement Administration
US Sector Name: Stabilization Operations and Security Sector Reform
Funding Account Name: Drug Enforcement Administration, Salaries and Expenses
Activity Name: Special Investigation Unit (SIU) 6 Advanced Course, El Salvador
Activity Description: Special Investigation Unit (SIU) 6 Advanced Course, El Salvador; This one-week advanced training course is designed for SIU commanders responsible for supervising units. The course addresses all core topics from a SIU managers perspective which includes the following; management of SIU, DEA oversight of program, operational planning, critical incident response, risk management, officer safety, leadership, ethics and professionalism in law enforcement, confidential source management, the supervision of enforcement operations, as well as the identification of trends associated with narco-terrorism. The course is conducted via a workshop environment and also encourages SIU commanders and DEA management to exchange information in order to make important decisions needed to improve the SIU program

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Economic development and research on domestic and gang violence
Activity Description: Fundacin para el Desarrollo Juvenil (FDJ) will provide training and related assistance toward developing the organizational, leadership and technical skills of residents in two communities in the department of San Salvador and toward improving their agriculture and microenterprises. Young adults as well as women of all ages will learn to raise poultry, refine their crafts and market their products effectively. FDJ will also study the impact of gang and domestic violence on residents and analyze the factors that contribute to resilience. The work will benefit 150 Salvadorans directly and another 750 indirectly.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Sociedad Cooperativa Maras Noventa y Tres
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Organic Coffee Cultivation, Processing and Marketing for Producers in Chinameca, El Salvador
Activity Description: Sociedad Cooperativa Maras Noventa y Tres (MARIAS 93) will improve the financial and administrative skills of its cooperative; incorporate the control of coffee rust in its technical assistance for farmers; develop its tourism program by constructing infrastructure and training young adults to offer services; and include persons with disabilities in its poultry farming.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Transparency and Governance Project
Activity Description: To support various levels of the Salvadoran Government to increase responsiveness and accountability towards its citizens, through increasing transparency in government and ethical behavior by public officials. The Project has two main objectives: 1) to continue efforts to support various levels of theSalvadoran government to increase responsiveness and accountability towards its citizens, through increasing transparency in government and ethical behavior by public officials, reducing conditions for corruption in public administration, strengthening the link between citizens and government, and thereby increasing confidence in the system; and 2) to continue to foster civil society participation, particularly the private sector, in promoting transparency, accountability and control of corruption in the use of public funds.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Improving Access to Employment
Activity Description: This project bridges the gap between the country's labor supply and private sector demand. Through partnerships with public agencies, private businesses, and organizations, the project creates alliances with key employers, training institutions, pivotal public agencies, and Non-Governmental Organizations (NGO). These partnerships work to improve occupational training programs and establish a consumer/employer-based employment information system and career counseling initiatives. Training modules have included English for Work, IT services, and customer service to prepare youth and adults to fill high-demand jobs. Likely industries include aeronautics, energy, construction, software development, logistics, tourism, and Information and Communication Technologies (ICT). The overall objective of the program is to fundamentally transform the way the labor market works in El Salvador through four interlinked components: increasing the number of skilled persons employed, improving the articulation and dissemination of information on private sector job needs, helping job seekers prepare for interviews and the world of work, and strengthening training institutions at the vocational and higher educational levels.

Activity Name: Crime and Violence Prevention Project (CVPP)
Activity Description: The U.S. Agency for International Development-funded El Salvador Violence and Crime Prevention Project is addressing this troubling situation by improving the ability of communities, municipalities and national institutions to address violent crime. Building on Creatives success with violence prevention programs elsewhere in Central America, this five-year project introduces community focused initiatives in 55 Salvadoran municipalities. Creative is working with the government to finalize the National System for the Prevention of Violence Law and the National Strategy for Social Violence Prevention in Support of Municipalities, a vital document that sets country-wide policy and empowers municipalities to take the lead on prevention projects. At the municipal level, a complete diagnostic guide incorporates 13 risk factors developed by Creative. The program is also creating municipal observatories, which will collect and corroborate crime and violence data, and developing municipal crime and Violence Prevention Committees that will create action plans in their communities.By the projects end, Creative anticipates a higher level of safety for Salvadorans living in the 55 target municipalities, as well as stronger community, municipal and national structures that are able to respond to and prevent violent crime.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: SolucionES
Activity Description: The five-year program will focus on the development and strengthening of anti-crime plans at the municipal level; increased social investment from the private sector to prevent violence by targeting at-risk youth; and research to help in the formation of effective public policies to prevent crime. SolucionES is led by la Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (FEPADE) and in addition to Glasswing includes la Fundacin Nacional para el Desarrollo (FUNDE), la Fundacin Salvadorea para la Salud y el Desarrollo Humano (FUSAL), y la Fundacin Salvadorea para el Desarrollo Econmico y Social (FUSADES). The five organizations are experts in the areas of education, health, community and economic development, research and youth leadership.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacion para la Educacion Integral Salvadorena
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Education for Children and Youth Activity
Activity Description: The activity is aligned to the prosperity and security pillars of the CEN Strategy by improving the quality of and access to educational opportunities for lower secondary school children and out-of-school youth in targeted high crime municipalities. Activities include: training principals, teachers, and students on improved learning methodologies; technical assistance, educational materials and equipment for safe spaces for learning; technical assistance for enhanced community participation to help reintegrate school drop-outs back into a formal school setting or to earn an equivalent diploma; vocational/life skills training to out-of-school youth; and institutional strengthening to a consortium of local education NGOs. Activities will support expansion of the GOES' full-time inclusive school model and will increase the capacity of local NGOs to manage education programs and directly contribute to USAID's goal of increasing access to education in crisis and conflict environments.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
US Sector Name: Rule of Law and Human Rights
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Justice Sector Strengthening Project
Activity Description: A five-year contract by USAID to implement the Justice Sector Strengthening Project in El Salvador. This is a follow-on contract to the task order that the Company executed in El Salvador from 2008 to 2012, and builds upon important accomplishments in the areas of community policing, assistance for the victims of domestic and sexual violence, and court administration. the Company will expand community policing activities to help reduce crime and violence. The Company also will work to improve case tracking and case management systems in the courts, develop inter-institutional protocols to improve the quality of criminal investigations, and establish victims assistance centers to provide medical, psychological and legal services for the victims of domestic and sexual violence. Finally, the Company will work with civil society organizations to enhance transparency and accountability in the criminal justice system.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Sub-category ID: Universities and Research Institutes - United States
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Higher Education
Activity Description: The Higher Education project strengthens the ability of higher education institutions to develop a workforce that is responsive to private sector needs to contribute to economic growth. The project will work with higher education institutions and the private sector to improve and update curricula and link tertiary education with labor market needs. Activities will build the institutional capacity of higher education institutions and official entities to expand the use of applied research and provide new and updated academic programs, and to develop partnerships between academia and the private sector. Faculty and staff will receive professional development through specialized technical assistance, training, and degree programs. Activities will also support career centers, internship programs, and academic programs in priority economic sectors.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Government Integrity
Activity Description: The Government Integrity activity will support the efforts of the Government of El Salvador (GOES) and civil society organizations (CSOs) to implement transparency, ethics and anti-corruption reforms and promote citizen participation. Activities will include: sub-grants and technical assistance to CSOs to develop innovative monitoring and citizen participation initiatives; training and technical assistance to the GOES' Institute of Access to Public Information; training and technical assistance to 14 municipalities to strengthen their access to public information units and ethics commissions; technical assistance for the implementation and oversight of GOES' commitments under the Open Government Partnership (OGP); and support for advocacy efforts for civil service reform and the implementation of merit based systems. These activities will align the CEN Strategy governance pillar by helping the GOES maintain transparent and professional governance structures.

Activity Description: El Salvador National Cacao Initiative" (ESNCI) activity, the objective of which is to develop on a national scale a competitive and sustainable cacao value chain, that will increase productivity and international trade.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Fiscal Policy and Expenditure Management Project (FPEMP)
Activity Description: The FPEMP project is helping the Government of El Salvador (GOES) increase tax revenue, without raising rates, and achieve greater transparency and accountability, and more efficiently use public resources. We are modernizing the General Directorate for Internal Revenue to improve taxpayer services, reduce tax fraud and tax evasion, and enhance legitimacy. The project builds on the foundations for reform laid by a preceding project called Tax Policy and Administration Reform that DAI led from 2005 to 2010.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: International Business and Technical Consultants Inc.
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Trilateral Cooperation
Activity Description: The Trilateral Cooperation activity will primarily assist USAID Missions and governments of the Northern Triangle countries (El Salvador, Guatemala, and Honduras) to build trilateral cooperation among the United States, Central American countries, and selected donor countries, primarily from Latin America, as relevant. USAID will support the transfer of technical expertise, technology and knowledge, training and other resources to implement short-term, exploratory or pilot programs that address specific needs of Central American countries to support the U.S. Strategy for Engagement in Central America. Some interventions USAID is planning to carry out under this mechanism are in the areas of trade facilitation, supporting regional systems integration and coordination in border procedures; and clean energy that will advise municipal level leadership in the region on adopting successful models of off-grid energy financing to increase lighting in high crime areas.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Office of Technical Assistance
Funding Account Name: International Affairs Technical Assistance
Activity Name: Technical Assistance for El Salvador - Budget and Financial Accountability
Activity Description: The advisor will provide assistance and advice to the General Directorate of the Treasury of the Ministry of Hacienda on implementing organizational and operational reforms to the Treasury. These reforms will focus on implementation of the Treasury Single Account concept and implementing and institutionalizing important Treasury reforms, which includes changes to regulations, procedures manuals, organizational charts, job descriptions, banking arrangements and information systems. The advisor will provide project management assistance to insure that the various components of the TSA and organizational and functional changes stay on track and are accomplished within the expected timeframes. The advisor will assist with project objectives which include: modernize liquidity management to optimize the governments cash flow and financial programming; develop updates and amendments to budget and financial management laws, regulations, technical manuals that support needed processes changes; develop and implement a new organizational structure to reflect the new roles and responsibilities of the DGT; and providing training and support to staff.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Superate
Activity Description: This public-private alliance supports the prosperity pillar of the CEN Strategy by improving educational opportunities for underprivileged high school students with high academic scores. It addresses the lack of opportunities for youth and fosters broad-based engagement in crime prevention efforts. USAID will leverage private sector resources to open new and maintain existing Supérate training centers that emphasize development of information technology, English language, and life skills. Funds will be also used for providing services to current students and recent graduates, including career advice, assistance with employment searches, and facilitating continued involvement with Supérate as role models and mentors to disadvantaged youth in their communities. Activities will enable youth between the ages of 13 and 18 to develop critical skillsets needed to make a successful transition to higher education and/or promising professional opportunities after high school.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Intercomunal de Comunidades Unidas para el Desarrollo Econmico y Social del Bajo Lempa
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Sustainable income generating and risk mitigation opportunities in communities vulnerable to climate change in Bajo Lempa, Jiquilisco.
Activity Description: Asociacin Intercomunal de Comunidades Unidas para el Desarrollo Econmico y Social del Bajo Lempa (ACUDESBAL) will collaborate with three grassroots organizations to develop their resilience to climate change, improve agricultural production for food security while enhancing income-generating opportunities for smallholder farmers, women and young adults. The grant includes training, technical assistance and materials for residents on risk mitigation, sustainable agriculture and vocations; livestock, vegetables, grains, and shrimp; and peer- to-peer exchanges. ACUDESBAL anticipates that the grant will improve livelihoods and incorporate women and young adults into community life - especially those forced to seek work far from home due to lack of opportunities. Some 290 residents of 29 communities will benefit from activities directly and another 800 indirectly.

Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Cincahuite para el Desarrollo Integral de las Comunidades del Sector Puerto Parada-Baha de Jiquilisco
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Improving the livelihoods of fishers and their families through community-led natural resource management and income generation in Puerto Parada, Usulutn
Activity Description: Asociacin Cincahuite para el Desarrollo Integral de las Comunidades del Sector Puerto Parada-Baha de Jiquilisco (CINCAHUITE) will engage fishers and their families in Puerto Parada, Usulutn to implement a natural resource management plan. The grant activities include a certificate training program for local residents on climate change; repopulating fish in Jiquilisco Bay through locally- managed artificial reefs; securing direct market access for fishing cooperatives; and peer-to-peer exchanges. Grant activities will benefit 135 people directly and 450 people indirectly.

Activity Name: Economic autonomy and food security via agroecology to promote youth and women of the indigenous community of Nahuizalco, Sonsonate, El Salvador
Activity Description: Fundacin para el Desarrollo Socioeconmico y Restauracin Ambiental (FUNDESYRAM) will engage Nhuatl Pipil residents from four communities in Nahuizalco, department of Sonsonate, to increase incomes and improve living conditions by organizing farmers and introducing agroecological practices, vegetable gardens and small animal production. It will also train farmers in marketing skills and develop marketplaces to sell their production. Some 720 individuals, mainly indigenous women and youths, will benefit directly and 2,000 more indirectly.

Activity Name: Advancing a miltifaceted approach to recover hawksbills in the eastern Pacific: Protecting major nesting beaches and reducing extensive bycatch at critical foraging grounds
Activity Description: The recipient will work with local communities to build teams to patrol 40 km of hawkbsill nesting beaches from April 15 - October 15 to protect nests through relocation to hatcheries using best management practices, conduct education outreach activities with local communities including an annual Hawksbill Festival "Day of the Hawksbill" activities in local schools, work with local communities to develop eco tourism activities, collect data on lobster fisheries and hawksbill bycatch, and work with local fisherman to develop strategies to reduce hawksbill bycatch .

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Comit de Familiares de Migrantes Fallecidos y Desaparecidos de El Salvador
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Socio-economic assessment and business support for families of deceased and missing migrants.
Activity Description: Asociacin Comit de Familiares de Migrantes Fallecidos y Desaparecidos de El Salvador (COFAMIDE) will assess the socio- economic situation of family members of deceased and missing migrants, support their business initiatives and improve its institutional capacity. Work includes a participatory assessment, seed funding and training for entrepreneurs, and outreach to draw attention to the risks of migrating and to the range of needs of migrants' family members. Some 120 members of COFAMIDE and their relatives will benefit directly and another 480 Salvadorans indirectly.

Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin para el Desarrollo de Chinameca
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Educational program with practical training in the management of natural resources in Chinameca, El Salvador
Activity Description: Asociacin para el Desarrollo de Chinameca (ASDECHI) will provide training on agroecological practices for small-scale farmers in the municipality of Chinameca, El Salvador. Project activities will center on families, with an emphasis on the participation of young people, who will learn how to reduce the use of agrochemicals to improve the quality of their production and increase its yield. This project will benefit 950 Salvadorians directly and 1,700 more indirectly.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Office of Technical Assistance
Funding Account Name: International Affairs Technical Assistance
Activity Name: Technical Assistance for Budget and Financial Accountability - El Salvador
Activity Description: The advisor will provide assistance and advice to the General Directorate of the Treasury of the Ministry of Hacienda on implementing organizational and operational reforms to the Treasury. These reforms will focus on implementation of the Treasury Single Account concept and implementing and institutionalizing important Treasury reforms, which includes changes to regulations, procedures manuals, organizational charts, job descriptions, banking arrangements and information systems. The advisor will provide project management assistance to insure that the various components of the TSA and organizational and functional changes stay on track and are accomplished within the expected timeframes. The advisor will assist with project objectives which include: modernize liquidity management to optimize the governments cash flow and financial programming; develop updates and amendments to budget and financial management laws, regulations, technical manuals that support needed processes changes; develop and implement a new organizational structure to reflect the new roles and responsibilities of the DGT; and providing training and support to staff.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: PASA with the US Forest Service
Activity Description: This Participating Agency Service Agreement (PASA) with the U.S. Forest Service provides USAID with expert technical staff to develop and manage regional global climate change programs and to assist USG staff in the LAC region in designing and implementing country-specific climate change activities. Benefitting countries include Brazil, Eastern Caribbean regional countries, Colombia, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, El Salvador, Guatemala, Haiti, Honduras, Jamaica, Mexico and Peru. This agreement also contributes to USG Global Climate Change goals by providing expert technical assistance to support U.S. funded climate change activities in individual Latin American and Caribbean countries. Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Para el Desarrollo Empresarial de Productores y Comercializadores Centroamericanos
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Economic opportunitie s for women and young adults in communities of Chalatenango and San Salvador.
Activity Description: Asociacin para el Desarrollo Empresarial de Productores y Comercializadores Centroamericanos (ADEPROCCA) will develop the organization, leadership and technical abilities of 150 residents of six municipalities in the departments of Chalatenango and San Salvador so that they can market their products related to silk-screening, shoemaking and tailoring. ADEPROCCA's assistance to 15 community- based businesses (CBBs), which incorporates training and evaluation, is expected to improve the CBBs management, product design, printing techniques, assembly, finishing, quality control and marketing. Some 65 percent of the participants are women and 60 percent are young adults.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Democracy, Conflict and Humanitarian Assistance
Funding Account Name: Department of State, Democracy Fund
Activity Name: Transparency and Governance Project
Activity Description: To support various levels of the Salvadoran Government to increase responsiveness and accountability towards its citizens, through increasing transparency in government and ethical behavior by public officials. The Project has two main objectives: 1) to continue efforts to support various levels of theSalvadoran government to increase responsiveness and accountability towards its citizens, through increasing transparency in government and ethical behavior by public officials, reducing conditions for corruption in public administration, strengthening the link between citizens and government, and thereby increasing confidence in the system; and 2) to continue to foster civil society participation, particularly the private sector, in promoting transparency, accountability and control of corruption in the use of public funds.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Anti-Corruption Reforms
Activity Description: Promote governance institutions, processes, and policies that are transparent and accountable across all development sectors. Support non-governmental as well as governmental institutions (including enforcement and investigation entities, independent audit agencies, anti-corruption commissions, procurement agencies, legislatures, line ministries, independent agencies, political parties, judicial actors, as well as civil society organizations, academia, press and the private sector). Support civic education and advocacy for reform of laws and practices or directly improving accountability and transparency of governance processes covering various development sectors.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Strengthening Basic Education
Activity Description: The EQUIP2 El Salvador Strengthening Basic Education Project is the compilation of an integrated group of activities that assist El Salvadors Ministry of Education efforts to help achieve the goals of the National Education Plan 2021. The project is funded by USAID through the EQUIP2 mechanism with implementing partners Academy for Educational Development (AED), Research Triangle International (RTI), and Mariposa Consulting. EQUIP2 El Salvador has two main goals. The first is to support educational policies aimed at increasing the quality and quantity of social investment and improving transparency of the educational sector. The second is to increase and improve basic education opportunities.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Citizen Safety for El Salvador, Crime and Violence Prevention Project (CVPP)
Activity Description: Citizen Safety for El Salvador, Crime and Violence Prevention Project (CVPP) will build local and national capacity to identify crime patterns, plan and implement crime and violence prevention projects and replicate best practices. The Activity supports the Government of El Salvador's (GOES) National Strategy on Municipal Crime Prevention and will build on the government municipal crime prevention plans. USAID will also finance the development of diagnostics of the risk factors, mapping of social services, and development of crime prevention models and tools. Activities will also be expanded with the active participation of the private sector through alliances to complement citizen-led crime prevention initiatives.

Activity Description: The TVET System Reform Activity seeks to harmonize the skills supplied by private and public education and training providers with the skills demanded by the labor market. The detailed design and implementation of the TVET System Reform Activity will be informed by the results of the ongoing studies funded as part of the development of this Compact.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Infrastructure Project
Activity Description: The Coastal Highway Expansion Activity seeks to relieve congestion at the most-trafficked segment of El Salvador?s coastal highway (?CA-2?). The CA-2 is one of the two most important logistical corridors in the country and connects the country?s major logistical nodes, including its two sea ports (La Union and Acajutla) and SAL. The Activity will finance three segments of CA-2: the 7.22 kilometer segment from Comalapa to La Herradura, the 16.98 kilometer segment from La Herradura to Zacatecoluca, and the 2.97 kilometer segment from La Libertad intersection to the Comapala Airport Road intersection.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Human Capital Project
Activity Description: Under this Activity, MCC Funding and the Government Contribution will support complementary interventions to provide Salvadoran students the benefits of competency-based education, increased classroom time, teachers trained in requisite subject-matters and pedagogical skills, and an institutional and physical environment that is conducive to learning.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Business Development Services
Activity Description: The Partnership Development Activity is designed to enable the Government to partner with the private sector in innovative ways to provide key public goods and services needed to support private investment in the internationally traded goods and services sector.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Infrastructure Project
Activity Description: The Border Crossing Infrastructure Activity seeks to relieve the freight and passenger traffic congestion at the border crossing into Honduras at El Amatillo by: (A) rehabilitating and improving up to a 5.74 kilometer road from Agua Salada to El Amatillo; and (B) improving and modernizing the border crossing facilities on the Salvadoran side of the La Amistad Bridge and the site on the Pan American Highway. Specifically, MCC Funding and the Government Contribution will support: implementation of construction activities for the improvement, and rehabilitation of the road from Agua Salada to El Amatillo; land acquisition (including RAP implementation, as applicable) for the road and one control center (with two control stations); implementation of environmental and social mitigation measures as identified in the ESIAs, Strategic RAP, and specific RAPs, or as otherwise may be appropriate; the construction of the control center, including buildings, internal access and connecting roads, parking areas, stormwater drainage, potable water supply system, wastewater treatment plant, lighting, and other infrastructure components that may be necessary for the effective functioning of these control stations; and Project management, supervision, technical services required for implementation, and auditing, as appropriate.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: SolucionES
Activity Description: The five-year program will focus on the development and strengthening of anti-crime plans at the municipal level; increased social investment from the private sector to prevent violence by targeting at-risk youth; and research to help in the formation of effective public policies to prevent crime. SolucionES is led by la Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (FEPADE) and in addition to Glasswing includes la Fundacin Nacional para el Desarrollo (FUNDE), la Fundacin Salvadorea para la Salud y el Desarrollo Humano (FUSAL), y la Fundacin Salvadorea para el Desarrollo Econmico y Social (FUSADES). The five organizations are experts in the areas of education, health, community and economic development, research and youth leadership.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
US Sector Name: Rule of Law and Human Rights
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Justice Sector Strengthening Project
Activity Description: A five-year contract by USAID to implement the Justice Sector Strengthening Project in El Salvador. This is a follow-on contract to the task order that the Company executed in El Salvador from 2008 to 2012, and builds upon important accomplishments in the areas of community policing, assistance for the victims of domestic and sexual violence, and court administration. the Company will expand community policing activities to help reduce crime and violence. The Company also will work to improve case tracking and case management systems in the courts, develop inter-institutional protocols to improve the quality of criminal investigations, and establish victims assistance centers to provide medical, psychological and legal services for the victims of domestic and sexual violence. Finally, the Company will work with civil society organizations to enhance transparency and accountability in the criminal justice system.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Business Development Services
Activity Description: The Regulatory Improvement Activity will prioritize and promote investment climate reforms resulting in more efficient and profitable business operations for firms doing business in El Salvador. Specifically, MCC Funding will support: the development of an institutional framework and system, including an institution to focus on regulatory improvement, and the prioritization and implementation of a select set of key reforms; and a public-private dialogue to provide a transparent and user-driven input to the design and implementation of improved regulation, as well as public and private ownership and accountability for the reforms.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacion para la Educacion Integral Salvadorena
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Education for Children and Youth Activity
Activity Description: The activity is aligned to the prosperity and security pillars of the CEN Strategy by improving the quality of and access to educational opportunities for lower secondary school children and out-of-school youth in targeted high crime municipalities. Activities include: training principals, teachers, and students on improved learning methodologies; technical assistance, educational materials and equipment for safe spaces for learning; technical assistance for enhanced community participation to help reintegrate school drop-outs back into a formal school setting or to earn an equivalent diploma; vocational/life skills training to out-of-school youth; and institutional strengthening to a consortium of local education NGOs. Activities will support expansion of the GOES' full-time inclusive school model and will increase the capacity of local NGOs to manage education programs and directly contribute to USAID's goal of increasing access to education in crisis and conflict environments.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Monitoring and Evaluation
Activity Description: The Accountable Entity's monitoring and evaluation costs, which include monitoring, reporting and dissemination, GIS, data collection and data quality reviews.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Bridges for Employment
Activity Description: USAID Bridges for Employment will partner with the Ministry of Education, Ministry of Labor, vocational training centers/institutes, civil society organizations, and the private sector to improve employment opportunities for at-risk youth living in high-crime municipalities prioritized by the Government of El Salvador. The activity will reduce youth engagement in illicit activities and illegal migration. To achieve this, USAID works with young Salvadorans and employs an inclusive-systems approach that links government, service providers, training providers, and the private sector to help youth acquire the skills they need for success. The activity will develop and deliver on-the-job training programs; support youth entrepreneur initiatives; and support inclusion of young women, LGBTI youth, youth with disabilities, and at-risk youth in the workforce. This activity contributes to the Education and Workforce Development line of action under the Prosperity pillar of the U.S. Strategy for Central America. The project also contributes directly to USAID's Education Strategy Goal 2 "improved ability of tertiary and workforce development programs to produce a workforce with relevant skills to support country development " and Goal 3 "increased equitable access to education in crisis and conflict environments." It also contributes to Strategic Objective 1.2 of the Joint Regional Strategy, which addresses the security, governance, and economic drivers of illegal immigration and illicit trafficking in Central America. [CARSI]

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Sub-category ID: Universities and Research Institutes - United States
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Higher Education
Activity Description: The Higher Education project strengthens the ability of higher education institutions to develop a workforce that is responsive to private sector needs to contribute to economic growth. The project will work with higher education institutions and the private sector to improve and update curricula and link tertiary education with labor market needs. Activities will build the institutional capacity of higher education institutions and official entities to expand the use of applied research and provide new and updated academic programs, and to develop partnerships between academia and the private sector. Faculty and staff will receive professional development through specialized technical assistance, training, and degree programs. Activities will also support career centers, internship programs, and academic programs in priority economic sectors.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Crime and Violence Prevention Project (CVPP)
Activity Description: The U.S. Agency for International Development-funded El Salvador Violence and Crime Prevention Project is addressing this troubling situation by improving the ability of communities, municipalities and national institutions to address violent crime. Building on Creatives success with violence prevention programs elsewhere in Central America, this five-year project introduces community focused initiatives in 55 Salvadoran municipalities. Creative is working with the government to finalize the National System for the Prevention of Violence Law and the National Strategy for Social Violence Prevention in Support of Municipalities, a vital document that sets country-wide policy and empowers municipalities to take the lead on prevention projects. At the municipal level, a complete diagnostic guide incorporates 13 risk factors developed by Creative. The program is also creating municipal observatories, which will collect and corroborate crime and violence data, and developing municipal crime and Violence Prevention Committees that will create action plans in their communities.By the projects end, Creative anticipates a higher level of safety for Salvadorans living in the 55 target municipalities, as well as stronger community, municipal and national structures that are able to respond to and prevent violent crime.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Small and Medium Enterprises Development
Activity Description: The Small and Medium Enterprises (SME) Development activity builds the capacity of the Government of El Salvador and private sector organizations to enable them to provide effective trade and business development services for SMEs. Major activities include technical assistance and training to SMEs seeking access to international markets and leveraging markets created by CAFTA-DR. This activity, which supports the Partnership for Growth Presidential Initiative, will establish linkages and alliances with private sector organizations to identify business opportunities for SMEs, especially those that are women-led, and develop their ability to sell their tradable products and services. These interventions will increase the competitiveness and productivity of SMEs in international markets, thereby increasing sales, incomes and employment. Building the capacity of a network of twelve local Small Business Development Centers to provide effective counseling, training and technical assistance to SMEs is a key element to ensure sustainability upon completion of this activity.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Crisis Assistance and Recovery
Activity Description: Provide goods, personnel, services and assistance to meet basic human needs in order to foster transition from relief according to principles of universality, impartiality and human dignity. This element should be done, when possible, as part of an integrated, coordinated and/or multi-sectoral approach.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Reconstruction of Infrastructure Damage due to Tropical Storm Ida
Activity Description: Through the Tropical Storm Ida Reconstruction Project, USAID will support the reconstruction and rehabilitation of the bridges, schools and healthcare facilities identified and prioritized by the Government of El Salvador (GOES) that are located in the five most-affected departments of San Salvador, La Paz, Cuscatln, San Vicente, and La Libertad.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean

Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Adopt a School Program
Activity Description: FEPADE's (Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo) "Adopt a School" project was developed with the goal of supporting the private sector in El Salvador to adopt schools and improve the quality of public education. With funding from both the private sector and the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), FEPADE works with the Ministry of Education to identify public schools in need. Private businesses then "adopt" schools open to receiving support. - See more at: http://www.educationinnovations.org/program/adopte-una-escuela#sthash.pFHNv93V.dpuf

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Fiscal Policy and Expenditure Management Project (FPEMP)
Activity Description: The FPEMP project is helping the Government of El Salvador (GOES) increase tax revenue, without raising rates, and achieve greater transparency and accountability, and more efficiently use public resources. We are modernizing the General Directorate for Internal Revenue to improve taxpayer services, reduce tax fraud and tax evasion, and enhance legitimacy. The project builds on the foundations for reform laid by a preceding project called Tax Policy and Administration Reform that DAI led from 2005 to 2010.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Superate
Activity Description: This public-private alliance supports the prosperity pillar of the CEN Strategy by improving educational opportunities for underprivileged high school students with high academic scores. It addresses the lack of opportunities for youth and fosters broad-based engagement in crime prevention efforts. USAID will leverage private sector resources to open new and maintain existing Supérate training centers that emphasize development of information technology, English language, and life skills. Funds will be also used for providing services to current students and recent graduates, including career advice, assistance with employment searches, and facilitating continued involvement with Supérate as role models and mentors to disadvantaged youth in their communities. Activities will enable youth between the ages of 13 and 18 to develop critical skillsets needed to make a successful transition to higher education and/or promising professional opportunities after high school.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Sub-category ID: Universities and Research Institutes - United States
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Natural Resources and Biodiversity
Activity Description: Conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. Programs in this element should be integrated with the Agriculture Area under Economic Growth and Conflict Mitigation and Reconciliation Area under the Peace and Security Objective, when applicable and appropriate.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Office of Technical Assistance
Funding Account Name: International Affairs Technical Assistance
Activity Name: Technical Assistance for El Salvador - Budget and Financial Accountability
Activity Description: The advisor will provide assistance and advice to the General Directorate of the Treasury of the Ministry of Hacienda on implementing organizational and operational reforms to the Treasury. These reforms will focus on implementation of the Treasury Single Account concept and implementing and institutionalizing important Treasury reforms, which includes changes to regulations, procedures manuals, organizational charts, job descriptions, banking arrangements and information systems. The advisor will provide project management assistance to insure that the various components of the TSA and organizational and functional changes stay on track and are accomplished within the expected timeframes. The advisor will assist with project objectives which include: modernize liquidity management to optimize the governments cash flow and financial programming; develop updates and amendments to budget and financial management laws, regulations, technical manuals that support needed processes changes; develop and implement a new organizational structure to reflect the new roles and responsibilities of the DGT; and providing training and support to staff.

Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Program Design and Learning
Activity Description: Develop and conduct needs assessments, baseline studies, targeted evaluations, special studies or other information-gathering efforts specifically for the design, monitoring and evaluation of USG-funded programs. This sub-element may also include developing and disseminating best practices and lessons learned, testing demonstration and/or pilot models, or the preparation of strategic plans and other short-term programming tasks. Note: All such activities that are carried out by partners as an integral part of their monitoring and evaluation efforts for programs funded under other sub-elements should be included within those sub-elements.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Cooperativa de Produccin Artesanal, Agropecuaria , Ahorro, Crdito y Comercializacin
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Youth-led Ecotourism in Cerro de Guazapa.
Activity Description: Tierra Libre Instituto Social y Ambiental in Paraguay (ISA) will work with 12 Nivacle and Manjui communities in the Rio Pilcomayo region of the Paraguayan Chaco. By providing technical assistance and training, the Grantee should enable residents in these communities to exercise their rights as indigenous Paraguayans, develop their organizations, secure their food supply, access water resources and address the effects of climate change. Approximately 360 Nivacle and Manjui Paraguayans should benefit directly and another 3,200 indirectly.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacion Coordinadora de Comunidades Unidas de Usulutan
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Strenghthening Rural Entrepreneur ships and a Community Marketing Network in the Communities of San Francisco Javier, San Agustn, Jiquili
Activity Description: Asociacin Coordinadora de Comunidades Unidas de Usulut (COMUS) will work in the municipalities of San Francisco Javier, San Agustn, Jiquilisco, Tecapn, Berln and Ozatln to develop a network to market local products more effectively, to bolster microbusinesses and to improve the organizational skills of rural community associations. The results should increase household income and otherwise directly benefit an additional 210 Salvadorans.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable

Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Community tourism in Meanguera, Morazn
Activity Description: Working with Asociacin Cooperativa Mezcal, Historia y Color, CDT-Meanguera will help farmers in Morazn and microentrepreneurs generate income from tourism and other sources. The program includes training in production of crafts, the diversification of agriculture and food-processing and related technical assistance; support accessing markets; and the promotion of local attractions, products and services. The work should benefit 100 residents of Meanguera directly and 500 indirectly.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin Adolescente Juvenil Amigos de Apopa
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Community-led development in Apopa
Activity Description: Asociacin Adolescente Juvenil Amigos de Apopa in El Salvador (AJA) will offer technical advice, training and materials to two community development associations (ADESCO) working to increase the income of residents of Apopa, San Salvador, who produce vegetables and grains and raise small livestock. AJA also expects to improve the effectiveness of the ADESCOs. Some 100 Salvadorans should benefit directly and another 1,400 indirectly.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Office of Technical Assistance
Funding Account Name: International Affairs Technical Assistance
Activity Name: Technical Assistance for El Salvador - Banking and Financial Services
Activity Description: Intermittent Advisor is providing support to the SSF to develop a new IT Risk Manual to ensure all necessary security protocols are in place. Support is also being provided to develop new supervisory methods for previously unsupervised financial cooperatives in addition to directing the development and implementation of a new website function allowing publication of appropriate financial sector time-series and relative analytical tools. A new regional study of Money Business Services will be initiated in the country with subsequent rollout expected throughout the region

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: SolucionES
Activity Description: The five-year program will focus on the development and strengthening of anti-crime plans at the municipal level; increased social investment from the private sector to prevent violence by targeting at-risk youth; and research to help in the formation of effective public policies to prevent crime. SolucionES is led by la Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (FEPADE) and in addition to Glasswing includes la Fundacin Nacional para el Desarrollo (FUNDE), la Fundacin Salvadorea para la Salud y el Desarrollo Humano (FUSAL), y la Fundacin Salvadorea para el Desarrollo Econmico y Social (FUSADES). The five organizations are experts in the areas of education, health, community and economic development, research and youth leadership.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Transparency and Governance Project
Activity Description: To support various levels of the Salvadoran Government to increase responsiveness and accountability towards its citizens, through increasing transparency in government and ethical behavior by public officials. The Project has two main objectives: 1) to continue efforts to support various levels of theSalvadoran government to increase responsiveness and accountability towards its citizens, through increasing transparency in government and ethical behavior by public officials, reducing conditions for corruption in public administration, strengthening the link between citizens and government, and thereby increasing confidence in the system; and 2) to continue to foster civil society participation, particularly the private sector, in promoting transparency, accountability and control of corruption in the use of public funds.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service
Funding Account Name: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Resource Management
Activity Name: Establecimiento del Sub Corredor Biolgico Bosque Seco Tropical Volcn Chingo..como parte del Corredor Biologico Montecristo, El Salvador
Activity Description: Project activities will 1) bring together key local stakeholders to complete a landscape level ecological analysis of the Chingo Volcano tropical dry forest biological sub-corridor and identify indicator species for conservation status monitoring, 2) conduct education and outreach with local landowners, schools, and decision-makers on sustainable land use practices and wildlife management, 3) train at least 120 private landowners and community association members, of which at least 50% will be women, on sustainable agriculture techniques through field schools at 5 municipal agroforestry demonstration projects and 12 sustainable wildlife management initiatives, and 4) utilize the information gathered and local public support garnered to complete and present a proposal to the Ministry of Environment for the legal establishment of the sub-corridor.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Democracy, Conflict and Humanitarian Assistance
Funding Account Name: Department of State, Democracy Fund
Activity Name: Transparency and Governance Project
Activity Description: To support various levels of the Salvadoran Government to increase responsiveness and accountability towards its citizens, through increasing transparency in government and ethical behavior by public officials. The Project has two main objectives: 1) to continue efforts to support various levels of theSalvadoran government to increase responsiveness and accountability towards its citizens, through increasing transparency in government and ethical behavior by public officials, reducing conditions for corruption in public administration, strengthening the link between citizens and government, and thereby increasing confidence in the system; and 2) to continue to foster civil society participation, particularly the private sector, in promoting transparency, accountability and control of corruption in the use of public funds.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Economic development and research on domestic and gang violence
Activity Description: Fundacin para el Desarrollo Juvenil (FDJ). FDJ will provide training and related assistance toward developing the organizational, leadership and technical skills of residents in two communities in the department of San Salvador and toward improving their agriculture and microenterprises. Young adults as well as women of all ages will learn to raise poultry, refine their crafts and market their products effectively. FDJ will also study the impact of gang and domestic violence on residents and analyze the factors that contribute to resilience. The work will benefit 150 Salvadorans directly and another 750 indirectly.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin de Desarrollo Social Comunitario del Cantn El Morro
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Mitigating social violence and the pressure to migrate from El Morro, Chalatenango through culture, arts and sports programming, viable eco
Activity Description: Asociacin de Desarrollo Social Comunitario del Cantn El Morro (ADESCO El Morro) will support residents of El Morro in Comalapa, Chalatenango to prioritize and implement economic initiatives, expand a community savings and loan fund to support those initiatives, and incorporate children and young adults into community life through arts, culture and sports. The grant includes technical advice and materials for economic initiatives, and training in leadership and self-esteem for young community members. The grant will benefit 110 people directly and another 550 indirectly.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Office of Technical Assistance
Funding Account Name: International Affairs Technical Assistance
Activity Name: Technical Assistance for El Salvador - Government Debt Issuance and Management
Activity Description: Provide TA to CEPA on best practices in the areas of operations, administration and project execution. OTA work will focus assistance on improving profitability of its operating units, insuring safety and maximizing the use of CEPAs strategic assets. Of key interest for CEPA is the international airport, for which there are detailed tasks relating to preparing the airport to implement the Master Plan, enhancing profitability, establishing activity based costing and key performance metrics, strengthening risk management and contract compliance management, building a project management team, and, as needed, creating a PPP contract compliance function within CEPA, as well as planning a program office and making sound business decisions on the best way to implement and finance the Master Plan expansion project. Other areas of TA focus include the revitalization of the FENADESAL rail operations; and the better use of underutilized CEPA facilities at La Union, and other places as needed. Other areas of TA are the development of institutional and staff capacity to direct and manage the national PPP program, as well as advise Ministry of Hacienda PPP staff on key knowledge,

Activity Description: Support the development of effective, legitimate, and democratically accountable security systems (within the statutory restrictions on providing support to law enforcement forces). Activity Name: Anti-Corruption Reforms
Activity Description: Promote governance institutions, processes, and policies that are transparent and accountable across all development sectors. Support non-governmental as well as governmental institutions (including enforcement and investigation entities, independent audit agencies, anti-corruption commissions, procurement agencies, legislatures, line ministries, independent agencies, political parties, judicial actors, as well as civil society organizations, academia, press and the private sector). Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean

Activity Name: Crisis Assistance and Recovery
Activity Description: Provide goods, personnel, services and assistance to meet basic human needs in order to foster transition from relief according to principles of universality, impartiality and human dignity. Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Crime and Violence Prevention Project (CVPP)
Activity Description: The U.S. Agency for International Development-funded El Salvador Violence and Crime Prevention Project is addressing this troubling situation by improving the ability of communities, municipalities and national institutions to address violent crime. Building on Creatives success with violence prevention programs elsewhere in Central America, this five-year project introduces community focused initiatives in 55 Salvadoran municipalities. Creative is working with the government to finalize the National System for the Prevention of Violence Law and the National Strategy for Social Violence Prevention in Support of Municipalities, a vital document that sets country-wide policy and empowers municipalities to take the lead on prevention projects. At the municipal level, a complete diagnostic guide incorporates 13 risk factors developed by Creative. The program is also creating municipal observatories, which will collect and corroborate crime and violence data, and developing municipal crime and Violence Prevention Committees that will create action plans in their communities.By the projects end, Creative anticipates a higher level of safety for Salvadorans living in the 55 target municipalities, as well as stronger community, municipal and national structures that are able to respond to and prevent violent crime.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Sub-category ID: Universities and Research Institutes - United States
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Higher Education
Activity Description: The Higher Education project strengthens the ability of higher education institutions to develop a workforce that is responsive to private sector needs to contribute to economic growth. The project will work with higher education institutions and the private sector to improve and update curricula and link tertiary education with labor market needs. Activities will build the institutional capacity of higher education institutions and official entities to expand the use of applied research and provide new and updated academic programs, and to develop partnerships between academia and the private sector. Faculty and staff will receive professional development through specialized technical assistance, training, and degree programs. Activities will also support career centers, internship programs, and academic programs in priority economic sectors.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
US Sector Name: Rule of Law and Human Rights
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Justice Sector Strengthening Project
Activity Description: A five-year contract by USAID to implement the Justice Sector Strengthening Project in El Salvador. This is a follow-on contract to the task order that the Company executed in El Salvador from 2008 to 2012, and builds upon important accomplishments in the areas of community policing, assistance for the victims of domestic and sexual violence, and court administration. the Company will expand community policing activities to help reduce crime and violence. The Company also will work to improve case tracking and case management systems in the courts, develop inter-institutional protocols to improve the quality of criminal investigations, and establish victims assistance centers to provide medical, psychological and legal services for the victims of domestic and sexual violence. Finally, the Company will work with civil society organizations to enhance transparency and accountability in the criminal justice system.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacion para la Educacion Integral Salvadorena
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Education for Children and Youth Activity
Activity Description: The activity is aligned to the prosperity and security pillars of the CEN Strategy by improving the quality of and access to educational opportunities for lower secondary school children and out-of-school youth in targeted high crime municipalities. Activities include: training principals, teachers, and students on improved learning methodologies; technical assistance, educational materials and equipment for safe spaces for learning; technical assistance for enhanced community participation to help reintegrate school drop-outs back into a formal school setting or to earn an equivalent diploma; vocational/life skills training to out-of-school youth; and institutional strengthening to a consortium of local education NGOs. Activities will support expansion of the GOES' full-time inclusive school model and will increase the capacity of local NGOs to manage education programs and directly contribute to USAID's goal of increasing access to education in crisis and conflict environments.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: SolucionES
Activity Description: The five-year program will focus on the development and strengthening of anti-crime plans at the municipal level; increased social investment from the private sector to prevent violence by targeting at-risk youth; and research to help in the formation of effective public policies to prevent crime. SolucionES is led by la Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (FEPADE) and in addition to Glasswing includes la Fundacin Nacional para el Desarrollo (FUNDE), la Fundacin Salvadorea para la Salud y el Desarrollo Humano (FUSAL), y la Fundacin Salvadorea para el Desarrollo Econmico y Social (FUSADES). The five organizations are experts in the areas of education, health, community and economic development, research and youth leadership.

Activity Name: El Salvador National Cacao Initiative (ESNCI) activity
Activity Description: El Salvador National Cacao Initiative" (ESNCI) activity, the objective of which is to develop on a national scale a competitive and sustainable cacao value chain, that will increase productivity and international trade.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Transparency and Governance Project
Activity Description: To support various levels of the Salvadoran Government to increase responsiveness and accountability towards its citizens, through increasing transparency in government and ethical behavior by public officials. The Project has two main objectives: 1) to continue efforts to support various levels of theSalvadoran government to increase responsiveness and accountability towards its citizens, through increasing transparency in government and ethical behavior by public officials, reducing conditions for corruption in public administration, strengthening the link between citizens and government, and thereby increasing confidence in the system; and 2) to continue to foster civil society participation, particularly the private sector, in promoting transparency, accountability and control of corruption in the use of public funds.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Business Development Services
Activity Description: The Partnership Development Activity is designed to enable the Government to partner with the private sector in innovative ways to provide key public goods and services needed to support private investment in the internationally traded goods and services sector.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Sub-category ID: Universities and Research Institutes - United States
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Municipal Competitiveness Project (MCP)
Activity Description: With the goal of creating an environment for municipalities to attract investment, improve economic development, and generate jobs across the country, RTI is providing technical assistance to improve municipal policies and practices so that they better serve private sector needs; institutionalizing the Municipal Competitiveness Index (MCI)designed and piloted in 2009 by RTI with support from USAIDto measure municipal performance over time and maintain the momentum for reform; and stimulating public-private engagement, entrepreneurship development, and improved access to finance for small and medium enterprises.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Fiscal Policy and Expenditure Management Project (FPEMP)
Activity Description: The FPEMP project is helping the Government of El Salvador (GOES) increase tax revenue, without raising rates, and achieve greater transparency and accountability, and more efficiently use public resources. We are modernizing the General Directorate for Internal Revenue to improve taxpayer services, reduce tax fraud and tax evasion, and enhance legitimacy. The project builds on the foundations for reform laid by a preceding project called Tax Policy and Administration Reform that DAI led from 2005 to 2010.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Business Development Services
Activity Description: The Regulatory Improvement Activity will prioritize and promote investment climate reforms resulting in more efficient and profitable business operations for firms doing business in El Salvador. Specifically, MCC Funding will support: the development of an institutional framework and system, including an institution to focus on regulatory improvement, and the prioritization and implementation of a select set of key reforms; and a public-private dialogue to provide a transparent and user-driven input to the design and implementation of improved regulation, as well as public and private ownership and accountability for the reforms.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Infrastructure Project
Activity Description: The Coastal Highway Expansion Activity seeks to relieve congestion at the most-trafficked segment of El Salvador?s coastal highway (?CA-2?). The CA-2 is one of the two most important logistical corridors in the country and connects the country?s major logistical nodes, including its two sea ports (La Union and Acajutla) and SAL. The Activity will finance three segments of CA-2: the 7.22 kilometer segment from Comalapa to La Herradura, the 16.98 kilometer segment from La Herradura to Zacatecoluca, and the 2.97 kilometer segment from La Libertad intersection to the Comapala Airport Road intersection.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Small and Medium Enterprises Development
Activity Description: The Small and Medium Enterprises (SME) Development activity builds the capacity of the Government of El Salvador and private sector organizations to enable them to provide effective trade and business development services for SMEs. Major activities include technical assistance and training to SMEs seeking access to international markets and leveraging markets created by CAFTA-DR. This activity, which supports the Partnership for Growth Presidential Initiative, will establish linkages and alliances with private sector organizations to identify business opportunities for SMEs, especially those that are women-led, and develop their ability to sell their tradable products and services. These interventions will increase the competitiveness and productivity of SMEs in international markets, thereby increasing sales, incomes and employment. Building the capacity of a network of twelve local Small Business Development Centers to provide effective counseling, training and technical assistance to SMEs is a key element to ensure sustainability upon completion of this activity.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Crime and Violence Prevention Project (CVPP)
Activity Description: The U.S. Agency for International Development-funded El Salvador Violence and Crime Prevention Project is addressing this troubling situation by improving the ability of communities, municipalities and national institutions to address violent crime. Building on Creatives success with violence prevention programs elsewhere in Central America, this five-year project introduces community focused initiatives in 55 Salvadoran municipalities. Creative is working with the government to finalize the National System for the Prevention of Violence Law and the National Strategy for Social Violence Prevention in Support of Municipalities, a vital document that sets country-wide policy and empowers municipalities to take the lead on prevention projects. At the municipal level, a complete diagnostic guide incorporates 13 risk factors developed by Creative. The program is also creating municipal observatories, which will collect and corroborate crime and violence data, and developing municipal crime and Violence Prevention Committees that will create action plans in their communities.By the projects end, Creative anticipates a higher level of safety for Salvadorans living in the 55 target municipalities, as well as stronger community, municipal and national structures that are able to respond to and prevent violent crime.
