Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Improving Access to Employment
Activity Description: This project bridges the gap between the country's labor supply and private sector demand. Through partnerships with public agencies, private businesses, and organizations, the project creates alliances with key employers, training institutions, pivotal public agencies, and Non-Governmental Organizations (NGO). These partnerships work to improve occupational training programs and establish a consumer/employer-based employment information system and career counseling initiatives. Training modules have included English for Work, IT services, and customer service to prepare youth and adults to fill high-demand jobs. Likely industries include aeronautics, energy, construction, software development, logistics, tourism, and Information and Communication Technologies (ICT). The overall objective of the program is to fundamentally transform the way the labor market works in El Salvador through four interlinked components: increasing the number of skilled persons employed, improving the articulation and dissemination of information on private sector job needs, helping job seekers prepare for interviews and the world of work, and strengthening training institutions at the vocational and higher educational levels.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Democracy, Conflict and Humanitarian Assistance
Funding Account Name: Department of State, Democracy Fund
Activity Name: Elections - Task Order for the 2012 Legislative and Municipal Elections Projec
Activity Description: Elections - Task Order for the 2012 Legislative and Municipal Elections Projec

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Transparency and Governance Project
Activity Description: To support various levels of the Salvadoran Government to increase responsiveness and accountability towards its citizens, through increasing transparency in government and ethical behavior by public officials. The Project has two main objectives: 1) to continue efforts to support various levels of theSalvadoran government to increase responsiveness and accountability towards its citizens, through increasing transparency in government and ethical behavior by public officials, reducing conditions for corruption in public administration, strengthening the link between citizens and government, and thereby increasing confidence in the system; and 2) to continue to foster civil society participation, particularly the private sector, in promoting transparency, accountability and control of corruption in the use of public funds.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Basic Education
Activity Description: Improve early childhood education, primary education, and secondary education, delivered in formal or non-formal settings. It includes literacy, numeracy, and other basic skills programs for youth and adults.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Sub-category ID: Universities and Research Institutes - United States
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Municipal Competitiveness Project (MCP)
Activity Description: With the goal of creating an environment for municipalities to attract investment, improve economic development, and generate jobs across the country, RTI is providing technical assistance to improve municipal policies and practices so that they better serve private sector needs; institutionalizing the Municipal Competitiveness Index (MCI)designed and piloted in 2009 by RTI with support from USAIDto measure municipal performance over time and maintain the momentum for reform; and stimulating public-private engagement, entrepreneurship development, and improved access to finance for small and medium enterprises.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Sub-category ID: Universities and Research Institutes - United States
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Governance of the Security Sector
Activity Description: Support the development of effective, legitimate, and democratically accountable security systems (within the statutory restrictions on providing support to law enforcement forces). Illustrative activities include the following: public sector reform and public management; strategic planning, policy, and budget formulation; building ministry capacity; civilian and civic capacity building; formal oversight (legislative, fiscal, human rights); and informal oversight (civil society watchdog groups).

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Strengthening Basic Education
Activity Description: The EQUIP2 El Salvador Strengthening Basic Education Project is the compilation of an integrated group of activities that assist El Salvadors Ministry of Education efforts to help achieve the goals of the National Education Plan 2021. The project is funded by USAID through the EQUIP2 mechanism with implementing partners Academy for Educational Development (AED), Research Triangle International (RTI), and Mariposa Consulting. EQUIP2 El Salvador has two main goals. The first is to support educational policies aimed at increasing the quality and quantity of social investment and improving transparency of the educational sector. The second is to increase and improve basic education opportunities.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Sub-category ID: Church and Faith Based - United States
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Cacao Initiative
Activity Description: The Cacao Initiative will establish a national productive cacao value-chain to support El Salvador in becoming a net exporter of cacao. Major activities will include developing a policy framework and national alliance for sustainable and competitive cacao production, new cacao agroforestry systems, and increasing the incomes and profits of small farmers through market-oriented and environmentally sustainable production practices. This activity, a Global Development Alliance, will leverage funds from a consortium of implementing partners and public sector organizations to enable El Salvador to become a net exporter of cacao.This activity, which supports the Partnership for Growth Presidential Initiative goal to increase the productivity of tradables, will develop national extension services for farmers and provide training and technical assistance for quality standards and market opportunities for export. Assistance for harvest and post-harvest infrastructure will enable the processing of larger volumes of cacao and generate higher incomes for farmers. The establishment of strategic partnerships with local and international private sector, government and non-governmental organizations to develop a competitive and sustainable cacao value chain on a national scale in El Salvador is a key element to ensure sustainability upon completion of this activity.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Small and Medium Enterprises Development
Activity Description: The Small and Medium Enterprises (SME) Development activity builds the capacity of the Government of El Salvador and private sector organizations to enable them to provide effective trade and business development services for SMEs. Major activities include technical assistance and training to SMEs seeking access to international markets and leveraging markets created by CAFTA-DR. This activity, which supports the Partnership for Growth Presidential Initiative, will establish linkages and alliances with private sector organizations to identify business opportunities for SMEs, especially those that are women-led, and develop their ability to sell their tradable products and services. These interventions will increase the competitiveness and productivity of SMEs in international markets, thereby increasing sales, incomes and employment. Building the capacity of a network of twelve local Small Business Development Centers to provide effective counseling, training and technical assistance to SMEs is a key element to ensure sustainability upon completion of this activity.

Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Adopt a School Program
Activity Description: FEPADE's (Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo) "Adopt a School" project was developed with the goal of supporting the private sector in El Salvador to adopt schools and improve the quality of public education. With funding from both the private sector and the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), FEPADE works with the Ministry of Education to identify public schools in need. Private businesses then "adopt" schools open to receiving support. - See more at: http://www.educationinnovations.org/program/adopte-una-escuela#sthash.pFHNv93V.dpuf

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Superate
Activity Description: This public-private alliance supports the prosperity pillar of the CEN Strategy by improving educational opportunities for underprivileged high school students with high academic scores. It addresses the lack of opportunities for youth and fosters broad-based engagement in crime prevention efforts. USAID will leverage private sector resources to open new and maintain existing Supérate training centers that emphasize development of information technology, English language, and life skills. Funds will be also used for providing services to current students and recent graduates, including career advice, assistance with employment searches, and facilitating continued involvement with Supérate as role models and mentors to disadvantaged youth in their communities. Activities will enable youth between the ages of 13 and 18 to develop critical skillsets needed to make a successful transition to higher education and/or promising professional opportunities after high school.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: PAPA with the US Forest Service - Promoting Food Security and Trade Integration through Sanitary and Phytosanitary (SPS) and Other Agriculture-Related Capacity Building
Activity Description: This mechanism aims to enhance food security and promote regional agricultural trade in Central America and the Dominican Republic. It will help: 1) build public and private sector SPS capacity; 2) improve access to markets; 3) improve food security statistical systems; and 4) enhance laboratories' capabilities to diagnose chemical and biological pathogens and residues. The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) will assist the Ministry of Agriculture to implement an effective public-private SPS inspection system. Training will be provided to producers to increase compliance with international SPS standards, and to assist them in exporting agricultural products to the U.S. Technical assistance and training will also be provided to small-scale farmers for the implementation of the Food Safety Modernization Act. The mechanism will support trilateral cooperation between the U.S., Chile and Guatemala to transfer knowledge from the Chilean experience to Guatemala.

This public-private alliance involves nine communities of the Escaln neighborhood in San Salvador in the areas integrated development. Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Superate
Activity Description: This public-private alliance supports the prosperity pillar of the CEN Strategy by improving educational opportunities for underprivileged high school students with high academic scores. It addresses the lack of opportunities for youth and fosters broad-based engagement in crime prevention efforts. USAID will leverage private sector resources to open new and maintain existing Supérate training centers that emphasize development of information technology, English language, and life skills. Funds will be also used for providing services to current students and recent graduates, including career advice, assistance with employment searches, and facilitating continued involvement with Supérate as role models and mentors to disadvantaged youth in their communities. Activities will enable youth between the ages of 13 and 18 to develop critical skillsets needed to make a successful transition to higher education and/or promising professional opportunities after high school.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Democracy, Conflict and Humanitarian Assistance
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, International Disaster Assistance
Activity Name: Capacity Building, Preparedness, and Planning
Activity Description: Improve the ability of the USG, host countries and other partners to prepare for and mitigate the effects of disasters, including both natural disasters and complex emergencies, taking into account the differences in men and womens freedom of movement and access to information. Activities under this component include any efforts to enhance the capacities of the USG (in Washington and in the field), humanitarian assistance providers, national host-country authorities, and local communities to engage in disaster reduction and response activities. Activities consist of standardized and coordinated assessments, monitoring, information sharing, data and situational analysis, joint planning; enhancement of coping mechanisms, including the capacity to address adaptation to constantly changing situations on the ground including climate variability and climate change.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Program Design and Learning
Activity Description: Develop and conduct needs assessments, baseline studies, targeted evaluations, special studies or other information-gathering efforts specifically for the design, monitoring and evaluation of USG-funded programs. This sub-element may also include developing and disseminating best practices and lessons learned, testing demonstration and/or pilot models, or the preparation of strategic plans and other short-term programming tasks. Note: All such activities that are carried out by partners as an integral part of their monitoring and evaluation efforts for programs funded under other sub-elements should be included within those sub-elements.

Activity Name: Youth-led Community Museum in Suchitoto, Cuscatln
Activity Description: CAP will improve and expand its community museum in the municipality of Suchitoto, develop the leadership skills of at-risk young adults and train them in audio-visual production so that they can document and disseminate Suchitoto's history and generate revenue through tourism activities and sales. CAP will also train young Salvadorans to conduct guided tours of Lake Suchitln that emphasize the history of the municipality of Suchitoto, will purchase and equip a boat for tours and will hire the necessary staff to help the center earn income.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives
US Sector Name: Stabilization Operations and Security Sector Reform
Funding Account Name: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives, Salaries and Expenses
Activity Name: ATF Firearms and Explosives-Related Training for Law Enforcement
Activity Description: ATF Firearms and Explosives-Related Training for Law Enforcement; This 5-day course provides participants with a comprehensive overview of firearms to include firearms safety, firearms identification, ammunition, firearms tracing, and firearms trafficking.  The course also provides participants with an introduction to explosives, which includes explosives identification, improvised explosive devices, current trends in explosives incidents, post-blast investigation, scene documentation, and team concepts.  During the course, the class is tasked with practical exercises involving the identification of firearms, tracing of firearms, identification of components in improvised explosive devices, and the post-blast reconstruction of those devices.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives
US Sector Name: Stabilization Operations and Security Sector Reform
Funding Account Name: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives, Salaries and Expenses
Activity Name: ATF Forensic Firearms Serial Number Restoration Course
Activity Description: ATF Forensic Firearms Serial Number Restoration Course; This 3-day technical course provides participants with the fundamentals of serial number restoration, primarily for firearms. ATF Forensic Laboratory personnel provide approximately half-day of classroom instruction and a day and a half of practical work applying what has been learned. The course covers all aspects of magnetic, chemical and electrolytic techniques, as well as the ATF firearms tracing process and its benefits. Students should be forensic personnel in a foreign law enforcement or military component working in relation to firearms investigations.  Instructors provide some supplies necessary to adequately institute the techniques that are taught.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Office of Technical Assistance
Funding Account Name: International Affairs Technical Assistance
Activity Name: Technical Assistance for Banking and Financial Services
Activity Description: Technical Assistance Programs provide long-term, resident advisors or short-term, intermittent advisors. Banking and Financial Services Program advisors support counterpart government institutions to promote strong financial sectors in which institutions are well-regulated, stable, accessible, serve as efficient intermediaries between savers and investors, and are resistant to criminal activity. Banking and Financial Services Program advisors support ministries of finance, central banks, banking regulation and supervision departments, deposit insurance agencies, and other banking sector entities in an effort to assist in the creation of viable, market-oriented banking systems that serve as both sound repositories of funds and efficient providers of capital to productive sectors of the economy.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Educational and Cultural Affairs
Funding Account Name: Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs
Activity Name: Restoration of the Youth Symphony Orchestra's Historic Headquarters Building in San Salvador's Flor Blanca Historic District
Activity Description: To support the restoration of the Youth Symphony Orchestras historic building in the Flor Blanca district of San Salvador. The early 20th-century neo-colonial style building requires immediate restoration to reverse the destructive effects of water infiltration. The project involves the restoration of the tile roof and other conservation interventions.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: Revitalization, Cultivation and Sales of Indigo in Cuisnahuat, Sonsonate
Activity Description: EL BLSAMO will work with farmers in Cuisnahuat, Sonsonate, to revitalize the organic cultivation of indigo. Farmers will improve their indigo crop and process it into dye to market. They will also produce organic fertilizer and pesticide for their own use and for sale and develop their management and marketing skills as a cooperative. EL BLSAMO will also improve its processing infrastructure and offer other support to farmers participating in its project to revitalize the organic cultivation of indigo in Cuisnahuat, Sonsonate.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
International Purpose Name: Public sector policy and administrative management
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Fiscal Policy and Expenditure Management Project (FPEMP)
Activity Description: The FPEMP project is helping the Government of El Salvador (GOES) increase tax revenue, without raising rates, and achieve greater transparency and accountability, and more efficiently use public resources. We are modernizing the General Directorate for Internal Revenue to improve taxpayer services, reduce tax fraud and tax evasion, and enhance legitimacy. The project builds on the foundations for reform laid by a preceding project called Tax Policy and Administration Reform that DAI led from 2005 to 2010.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: U.S. Customs and Border Protection
Implementing Partner Name: U.S. Government - Department of Homeland Security
Funding Account Name: Nonproliferation, Anti-Terrorism, Demining and Related Programs
Activity Name: International Border Interdiction Training II. [24 attendees]
Activity Description: To further the informational exchange with partner nations by reinforcing inspectional techniques and methodologies with counterpart law enforcement agencies in the host nations own operating environment.  Skills previously presented in the US during IBIT by conducting practical exercise at critical port(s) of entry identified by host national.  The goal of this program is to help build an internal train-the-trainer capacity and eventually infuse the curriculum into the formal training regimen of the host nation.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Adopt a School Program
Activity Description: FEPADE's (Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo) "Adopt a School" project was developed with the goal of supporting the private sector in El Salvador to adopt schools and improve the quality of public education. With funding from both the private sector and the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), FEPADE works with the Ministry of Education to identify public schools in need. Private businesses then "adopt" schools open to receiving support. - See more at: http://www.educationinnovations.org/program/adopte-una-escuela#sthash.pFHNv93V.dpuf

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC PRODUCTIVE DEVELOPMENT PROJECT
Activity Description: This project aims to assist with the development of profitable and sustainable productive business ventures, with a primary focus on assisting poor farmers shift to the cultivation of high-value crops, forestry, and animal products.? Specifically, MCC funding aims to: Support capital investment to selected applicants for commercial activities; Provide credit guarantees and technical assistance to financial institutions; and Provide crop insurance to small producers in the Northern Zone.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC PRODUCTIVE DEVELOPMENT PROJECT
Activity Description: To provide investment capital to competitively selected applicants for business activities located in and benefiting poor inhabitants of the Northern Zone. To attract private investment in and various types of financing for high value economic activities in the Northern Zone, the Investment Support Activity will utilize MCC Funding to support a demand-driven, competitive process to provide capital to critical investments required for successful operation of a business activity that is part of a value chain that will be located in and/or benefit poor inhabitants in the Northern Zone. Specifically, MCC Funding will support the administration and funding of an investment support program providing investment capital for the development of competitively selected business proposals.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Program Administration and Control
Activity Description: An Accountable Entity's costs for its financial audits, which are conducted by a third party.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
International Purpose Name: Multisector aid for basic social services
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Human Development Project
Activity Description: The Community Development Activity aims to dramatically increase access of the Northern Zone's poor to basic public services and infrastructure.MCC Funding will enhance access to water systems for approximately 90,000 and to improved sanitation services for approximately 50,000 of the poorest inhabitants in the Northern Zone. Specifically, MCC Funding will support the following: (1) Feasibility studies, project designs, and environmental assessments for water supply and sanitation infrastructure; (2) Construction of potable water systems and sanitation systems (e.g., household latrines) in approximately twenty-five (25) municipalities of the Northern Zone; (3) Technical assistance for community capacity building, to ensure system maintenance and sustainability (4) Community education related to appropriate health and sanitation practices.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Program Administration and Control
Activity Description: This activity was used in the past for accounting purposes but it is not currently an active activity for the program.? It has no funds either committed or disbursed against it and has a sector code of 99810 (sector not specified).

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Connectivity Project
Activity Description: To design and construct openings of approximately 50 km of secondary1 roads; to improve approximately 160 km to secondary road standards; and to rehabilitate approximately 80 km to secondary road standards. Specifically, MCC Funding will support the following: (i) Design; environmental assessment, as needed (to include, if necessary, supplemental EIAs, EMPs, and RAPs); and construction activities for the opening, improvement, or rehabilitation of approximately 290 km of the NTH; (ii) Implementation of environmental and social mitigation measures as identified in the EIA, or as otherwise may be appropriate, to include compensation for physical and economic displacement of individuals, residences and businesses affected by such rehabilitation and construction, consistent with the World Bank's Operational Policy on Involuntary Resettlement (OP 4.12), and implementation of HIV/AIDS awareness plans satisfactory to MCC; (iii) Design and construction of drainage structures, as may be required; (iv) Design and construction of all necessary new bridges and rehabilitation of existing bridge structures, as may be required; (v) Posting of signage and incorporating other safety improvements; (vi) Project management, supervision and auditing of such improvements and upgrades; and (vii) Training in environmental management.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau of International Labor Affairs
Funding Account Name: Department of Labor, Departmental Management, Salaries and Expenses
Activity Name: Eliminating Child Labor in El Salvador through Economic Empowerment and Social Inclusion
Activity Description: Combating child labor in targeted Solidarity Communities. From 12/31/2010 to 11/30/2014. - Through International Labour Organisation.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
International Purpose Name: Multisector aid for basic social services
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Human Development Project
Activity Description: The Community Development Activity aims to dramatically increase access of the Northern Zone's poor to basic public services and infrastructure. The Rural Electrification Sub-Activity will extend electricity to at least 97 percent of the estimated 47,000 households in the Northern Zone that currently are not connected to local power distribution networks. Service will be provided to these households through, as appropriate for the household, investments in the extension of distribution networks, in individual household connections to the network, and in the supply of off-grid solar photovoltaic systems. MCC Funding will cover up to 85 percent of the projected investment in the electrification efforts, with contributions from the Government and the executing entities comprising the balance of at least 15 percent. MCC Funding will support the following: (1) Feasibility, design, and environmental assessment to include sitespecific EIAs, EMPs, and RAPs, as needed, for new distribution lines; (2) Construction of approximately 1,500 km of new distribution lines and the corresponding connection of approximately 21,000 households to the expanded network; (3) Connection of approximately 25,000 households to existing networks via the construction of necessary low voltage extensions; (4) Investment in upgrading distribution networks as necessary to support the anticipated additional load on the system; (5) Installation of approximately 950 solar power systems and provision of technical assistance for the creation of community associations for the management of solar power system operations and maintenance; and (6) Contracting of a financial advisor by and at the expense of FOMILENIO to advise FOMILENIO on financial aspects and implications of the procurement process associated with the Rural Electrification Sub-Activity, as needed.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Sub-category ID: Universities and Research Institutes - United States
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Governance of the Security Sector
Activity Description: Support the development of effective, legitimate, and democratically accountable security systems (within the statutory restrictions on providing support to law enforcement forces). Illustrative activities include the following: public sector reform and public management; strategic planning, policy, and budget formulation; building ministry capacity; civilian and civic capacity building; formal oversight (legislative, fiscal, human rights); and informal oversight (civil society watchdog groups).

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Transparency and Governance Project
Activity Description: To support various levels of the Salvadoran Government to increase responsiveness and accountability towards its citizens, through increasing transparency in government and ethical behavior by public officials. The Project has two main objectives: 1) to continue efforts to support various levels of theSalvadoran government to increase responsiveness and accountability towards its citizens, through increasing transparency in government and ethical behavior by public officials, reducing conditions for corruption in public administration, strengthening the link between citizens and government, and thereby increasing confidence in the system; and 2) to continue to foster civil society participation, particularly the private sector, in promoting transparency, accountability and control of corruption in the use of public funds.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Sub-category ID: Church and Faith Based - United States
Funding Account Name: Economic Support Fund
Activity Name: Cacao Initiative
Activity Description: The Cacao Initiative will establish a national productive cacao value-chain to support El Salvador in becoming a net exporter of cacao. Major activities will include developing a policy framework and national alliance for sustainable and competitive cacao production, new cacao agroforestry systems, and increasing the incomes and profits of small farmers through market-oriented and environmentally sustainable production practices. This activity, a Global Development Alliance, will leverage funds from a consortium of implementing partners and public sector organizations to enable El Salvador to become a net exporter of cacao.This activity, which supports the Partnership for Growth Presidential Initiative goal to increase the productivity of tradables, will develop national extension services for farmers and provide training and technical assistance for quality standards and market opportunities for export. Assistance for harvest and post-harvest infrastructure will enable the processing of larger volumes of cacao and generate higher incomes for farmers. The establishment of strategic partnerships with local and international private sector, government and non-governmental organizations to develop a competitive and sustainable cacao value chain on a national scale in El Salvador is a key element to ensure sustainability upon completion of this activity.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Human Development Project
Activity Description: The Education and Training Activity seeks to increase education and skill levels of the Northern Zone's poor by expanding the quality of, and access to, vocational and technical education and training. It is comprised of three sub-activities: technical assistance; formal technical education; and non-formal skills development. The Technical Assistance Sub-Activity will bolster capacity of institutions and organizations involved in policy, planning, and administration of education and training in the Northern Zone. MCC Funding will be used to procure the services of a long-term technical assistance provider that will support Implementing Entities. The Formal Technical Education Sub-Activity aims to strengthen technical/vocational education institutions in the Northern Zone, so that more youth can gain marketable skills and thereby increase their opportunities for employment and income generation. The Non-Formal Skills Development Sub-Activity will complement the Formal Technical Education Sub-Activity by supporting non-credit, short term and pre-employment training offerings.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Improved Management and Conservation of Critical Watersheds (IMCCW)
Activity Description: Many inhabitants of the ecological corridors and watersheds of western El Salvador employ farming and other practices that contribute to environmental degradationtrends that threaten the sustainability of critical ecosystems, degrade water supplies and quality, and bind farmers to environmentally destructive subsistence farming. At the same time, growing markets for certified specialty coffees, high-quality fruits and vegetables, and ecotourism offer opportunities to generate income and improve environmental quality. To improve the economic situation in rural areas, the Government of El Salvadors development strategy focuses on enlisting local support for improved natural resources and generating better economic opportunities through higher-value agriculture and sustainable tourism, linked to improved management of El Salvadors water, land, and biological resources.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Improving Access to Employment
Activity Description: This project bridges the gap between the country's labor supply and private sector demand. Through partnerships with public agencies, private businesses, and organizations, the project creates alliances with key employers, training institutions, pivotal public agencies, and Non-Governmental Organizations (NGO). These partnerships work to improve occupational training programs and establish a consumer/employer-based employment information system and career counseling initiatives. Training modules have included English for Work, IT services, and customer service to prepare youth and adults to fill high-demand jobs. Likely industries include aeronautics, energy, construction, software development, logistics, tourism, and Information and Communication Technologies (ICT). The overall objective of the program is to fundamentally transform the way the labor market works in El Salvador through four interlinked components: increasing the number of skilled persons employed, improving the articulation and dissemination of information on private sector job needs, helping job seekers prepare for interviews and the world of work, and strengthening training institutions at the vocational and higher educational levels.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
International Sector Name: Maternal and Child Health, Family Planning
Funding Account Name: Department of State, Global Health Programs
Activity Name: Health Care Improvement - Task Order 2 - El Salvador
Activity Description: To provide support to the MOH to improve the quality of their health svcs.to further impact maternal/reproductive and neonatal/child health.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
US Sector Name: Rule of Law and Human Rights
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Justice System
Activity Description: Improve the capacity and sustainability of civil and criminal justice sector actors and institutions, enhance coordination amongst them, develop citizen demand for an effective and accountable justice system, and develop associations to advocate for all citizens. Justice sector actors and institutions include: police, border security, prosecutors, forensics experts, judges, court personnel, public defenders, corrections personnel, private bar, law schools, legal professional associations, and training institutions for each of them. Work towards an equitable justice system by ensuring equality before the law, fair trial standards, and other elements of procedural fairness. Ensure more equitable access to justice through innovations within and beyond the state system and through improvements in the quality and quantity of justice services, with a particular focus on women, youth, the poor, and other marginalized or vulnerable groups. Programs primarily focused on trafficking in persons or migrant smuggling should be included in element 5.3 under the Transnational Crime area in the Peace and Security Objective.

Activity Name: Municipal Competitiveness Project (MCP)
Activity Description: With the goal of creating an environment for municipalities to attract investment, improve economic development, and generate jobs across the country, RTI is providing technical assistance to improve municipal policies and practices so that they better serve private sector needs; institutionalizing the Municipal Competitiveness Index (MCI)designed and piloted in 2009 by RTI with support from USAIDto measure municipal performance over time and maintain the momentum for reform; and stimulating public-private engagement, entrepreneurship development, and improved access to finance for small and medium enterprises.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
International Sector Name: Maternal and Child Health, Family Planning
Funding Account Name: Department of State, Global Health Programs
Activity Name: USAID |DELIVER
Activity Description: The USAID | DELIVER Project is a five year, worldwide project to design, develop, strengthen, and upon request, operate safe, reliable and sustainable supply systems that provide a range of affordable, quality essential health commodities including drugs, diagnostics, contraceptives and supplies to clients in country programs. The project will improve the availability of essential health supplies in public and private services by strengthening country supply systems, collaborating with global and regional partners for long-term availability of supplies, and improving USAIDs provision of supplies to country programs.

Specifically, MCC Funding will support the following: (1) Feasibility studies, project designs, and environmental assessments for water supply and sanitation infrastructure; (2) Construction of potable water systems and sanitation systems (e.g., household latrines) in approximately twenty-five (25) municipalities of the Northern Zone; (3) Technical assistance for community capacity building, to ensure system maintenance and sustainability (4) Community education related to appropriate health and sanitation practices.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Strengthening Basic Education
Activity Description: The EQUIP2 El Salvador Strengthening Basic Education Project is the compilation of an integrated group of activities that assist El Salvadors Ministry of Education efforts to help achieve the goals of the National Education Plan 2021. The project is funded by USAID through the EQUIP2 mechanism with implementing partners Academy for Educational Development (AED), Research Triangle International (RTI), and Mariposa Consulting. EQUIP2 El Salvador has two main goals. The first is to support educational policies aimed at increasing the quality and quantity of social investment and improving transparency of the educational sector. The second is to increase and improve basic education opportunities.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Superate
Activity Description: This public-private alliance supports the prosperity pillar of the CEN Strategy by improving educational opportunities for underprivileged high school students with high academic scores. It addresses the lack of opportunities for youth and fosters broad-based engagement in crime prevention efforts. USAID will leverage private sector resources to open new and maintain existing Supérate training centers that emphasize development of information technology, English language, and life skills. Funds will be also used for providing services to current students and recent graduates, including career advice, assistance with employment searches, and facilitating continued involvement with Supérate as role models and mentors to disadvantaged youth in their communities. Activities will enable youth between the ages of 13 and 18 to develop critical skillsets needed to make a successful transition to higher education and/or promising professional opportunities after high school.

Support non-governmental as well as governmental institutions (including enforcement and investigation entities, independent audit agencies, anti-corruption commissions, procurement agencies, legislatures, line ministries, independent agencies, political parties, judicial actors, as well as civil society organizations, academia, press and the private sector). Support civic education and advocacy for reform of laws and practices or directly improving accountability and transparency of governance processes covering various development sectors.

Activity Description: The Community Development Activity aims to dramatically increase access of the Northern Zone's poor to basic public services and infrastructure. The Community Infrastructure Sub-Activity will improve the connection among isolated communities and villages in the Northern Zone while ensuring sustainable management of natural resources. Specifically, MCC Funding will support the following: (1) Feasibility, design, and environmental assessment to include sitespecific EIAs, EMPs, and RAPs, as needed, of community infrastructure development; (2) Rehabilitation and construction of community infrastructure such as small roads and drainage works, retaining walls, pedestrian crossings and small bridges; and (3) Technical assistance to communities and municipalities on infrastructure O&M.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Democracy, Conflict and Humanitarian Assistance
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, International Disaster Assistance
Activity Name: Capacity Building, Preparedness, and Planning
Activity Description: Improve the ability of the USG, host countries and other partners to prepare for and mitigate the effects of disasters, including both natural disasters and complex emergencies, taking into account the differences in men and womens freedom of movement and access to information. Activities under this component include any efforts to enhance the capacities of the USG (in Washington and in the field), humanitarian assistance providers, national host-country authorities, and local communities to engage in disaster reduction and response activities. Activities consist of standardized and coordinated assessments, monitoring, information sharing, data and situational analysis, joint planning; enhancement of coping mechanisms, including the capacity to address adaptation to constantly changing situations on the ground including climate variability and climate change.

Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: APRODEHNI - Environmentally Sound Agricultural Production and Marketing for Rural Families in Sonsonate, El Salvador
Activity Description: APRODEHNI will work to improve the income and diet of farmers and their families in extremely poor communities in Sonsonate. It will provide technical assistance and training in the cultivation of diverse vegetables and grains, in livestock production and in marketing; will undertake initiatives to protect the environment and natural resources; and will improve municipal Community Development Associations (ADESCO). APRODEHNI will also assist farmers with replacing crops and livestock damaged by Hurricane Ida, improving production and mitigating the effects of climate change through better management post harvest.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
International Purpose Name: Public sector policy and administrative management
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Improving Access to Employment
Activity Description: This project bridges the gap between the country's labor supply and private sector demand. Through partnerships with public agencies, private businesses, and organizations, the project creates alliances with key employers, training institutions, pivotal public agencies, and Non-Governmental Organizations (NGO). These partnerships work to improve occupational training programs and establish a consumer/employer-based employment information system and career counseling initiatives. Training modules have included English for Work, IT services, and customer service to prepare youth and adults to fill high-demand jobs. Likely industries include aeronautics, energy, construction, software development, logistics, tourism, and Information and Communication Technologies (ICT). The overall objective of the program is to fundamentally transform the way the labor market works in El Salvador through four interlinked components: increasing the number of skilled persons employed, improving the articulation and dissemination of information on private sector job needs, helping job seekers prepare for interviews and the world of work, and strengthening training institutions at the vocational and higher educational levels.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Strengthening Basic Education
Activity Description: The EQUIP2 El Salvador Strengthening Basic Education Project is the compilation of an integrated group of activities that assist El Salvadors Ministry of Education efforts to help achieve the goals of the National Education Plan 2021. The project is funded by USAID through the EQUIP2 mechanism with implementing partners Academy for Educational Development (AED), Research Triangle International (RTI), and Mariposa Consulting. EQUIP2 El Salvador has two main goals. The first is to support educational policies aimed at increasing the quality and quantity of social investment and improving transparency of the educational sector. The second is to increase and improve basic education opportunities.

Activity Description: To improve approximately 240 km to modified tertiary road standards. Activity Name: MCC PRODUCTIVE DEVELOPMENT PROJECT
Activity Description: To provide technical assistance to poor farmers to shift to high-value agricultural production and forestry strategies and to provide preinvestment studies and technical assistance for the development and implementation of.business plans for Project beneficiaries located in the Northern Zone or greatly benefiting the Northern Zone population. Specifically, MCC Funding will support the following activities for poor farmers, organizations and micro, small, and medium enterprises that benefit poor inhabitants of the Northern Zone: (i) Investment Planning. (ii) Assistance to Small Farm Enterprises. (iii) Business Development Services.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Monitoring and Evaluation
Activity Description: The Accountable Entity's monitoring and evaluation costs, which include monitoring, reporting and dissemination, GIS, data collection and data quality reviews.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC PRODUCTIVE DEVELOPMENT PROJECT
Activity Description: This project aims to assist with the development of profitable and sustainable productive business ventures, with a primary focus on assisting poor farmers shift to the cultivation of high-value crops, forestry, and animal products.? Specifically, MCC funding aims to: Support capital investment to selected applicants for commercial activities; Provide credit guarantees and technical assistance to financial institutions; and Provide crop insurance to small producers in the Northern Zone.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC PRODUCTIVE DEVELOPMENT PROJECT
Activity Description: To provide investment capital to competitively selected applicants for business activities located in and benefiting poor inhabitants of the Northern Zone. To attract private investment in and various types of financing for high value economic activities in the Northern Zone, the Investment Support Activity will utilize MCC Funding to support a demand-driven, competitive process to provide capital to critical investments required for successful operation of a business activity that is part of a value chain that will be located in and/or benefit poor inhabitants in the Northern Zone. Specifically, MCC Funding will support the administration and funding of an investment support program providing investment capital for the development of competitively selected business proposals.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Connectivity Project
Activity Description: To design and construct openings of approximately 50 km of secondary1 roads; to improve approximately 160 km to secondary road standards; and to rehabilitate approximately 80 km to secondary road standards. Specifically, MCC Funding will support the following: (i) Design; environmental assessment, as needed (to include, if necessary, supplemental EIAs, EMPs, and RAPs); and construction activities for the opening, improvement, or rehabilitation of approximately 290 km of the NTH; (ii) Implementation of environmental and social mitigation measures as identified in the EIA, or as otherwise may be appropriate, to include compensation for physical and economic displacement of individuals, residences and businesses affected by such rehabilitation and construction, consistent with the World Bank's Operational Policy on Involuntary Resettlement (OP 4.12), and implementation of HIV/AIDS awareness plans satisfactory to MCC; (iii) Design and construction of drainage structures, as may be required; (iv) Design and construction of all necessary new bridges and rehabilitation of existing bridge structures, as may be required; (v) Posting of signage and incorporating other safety improvements; (vi) Project management, supervision and auditing of such improvements and upgrades; and (vii) Training in environmental management.

Activity Description: This project aims to assist with the development of profitable and sustainable productive business ventures, with a primary focus on assisting poor farmers shift to the cultivation of high-value crops, forestry, and animal products.? Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Strengthening Basic Education
Activity Description: The EQUIP2 El Salvador Strengthening Basic Education Project is the compilation of an integrated group of activities that assist El Salvadors Ministry of Education efforts to help achieve the goals of the National Education Plan 2021. The project is funded by USAID through the EQUIP2 mechanism with implementing partners Academy for Educational Development (AED), Research Triangle International (RTI), and Mariposa Consulting. EQUIP2 El Salvador has two main goals. The first is to support educational policies aimed at increasing the quality and quantity of social investment and improving transparency of the educational sector. The second is to increase and improve basic education opportunities.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Improved Management and Conservation of Critical Watersheds (IMCCW)
Activity Description: Many inhabitants of the ecological corridors and watersheds of western El Salvador employ farming and other practices that contribute to environmental degradationtrends that threaten the sustainability of critical ecosystems, degrade water supplies and quality, and bind farmers to environmentally destructive subsistence farming. At the same time, growing markets for certified specialty coffees, high-quality fruits and vegetables, and ecotourism offer opportunities to generate income and improve environmental quality. To improve the economic situation in rural areas, the Government of El Salvadors development strategy focuses on enlisting local support for improved natural resources and generating better economic opportunities through higher-value agriculture and sustainable tourism, linked to improved management of El Salvadors water, land, and biological resources.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
US Sector Name: Rule of Law and Human Rights
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Justice System
Activity Description: Improve the capacity and sustainability of civil and criminal justice sector actors and institutions, enhance coordination amongst them, develop citizen demand for an effective and accountable justice system, and develop associations to advocate for all citizens. Justice sector actors and institutions include: police, border security, prosecutors, forensics experts, judges, court personnel, public defenders, corrections personnel, private bar, law schools, legal professional associations, and training institutions for each of them. Work towards an equitable justice system by ensuring equality before the law, fair trial standards, and other elements of procedural fairness. Ensure more equitable access to justice through innovations within and beyond the state system and through improvements in the quality and quantity of justice services, with a particular focus on women, youth, the poor, and other marginalized or vulnerable groups. Programs primarily focused on trafficking in persons or migrant smuggling should be included in element 5.3 under the Transnational Crime area in the Peace and Security Objective.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: International Narcotics and Law Enforcement Affairs
Funding Account Name: Department of State, Andean Counterdrug Programs
Activity Name: Andean Counterdrug Initiative: Anti-Gang/Drug Demand Reduction
Activity Description: U.S. Department of State, International Narcotics Control and Law Enforcement - Andean Counterdrug Initiative. The Andean Counterdrug Programs account funded U.S. assistance to Plan Colombia and follow-on activities from 2000 to 2010. These funds supported the Colombian Army's push into southern Colombia in support of the Colombian National Police, enhanced drug interdiction in Colombia and the region, increased support to the Colombian National Police, provided for economic development in Colombia and the Andean region, and boosted Colombia's local and national government capacity. Beginning in 2010, Andean Counterdrug Programs funds are appropriated in the International Narcotics Control and Law Enforcement account.

Activity Name: Anti-Corruption Reforms
Activity Description: Promote governance institutions, processes, and policies that are transparent and accountable across all development sectors. Support non-governmental as well as governmental institutions (including enforcement and investigation entities, independent audit agencies, anti-corruption commissions, procurement agencies, legislatures, line ministries, independent agencies, political parties, judicial actors, as well as civil society organizations, academia, press and the private sector). Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Transparency and Governance Project
Activity Description: To support various levels of the Salvadoran Government to increase responsiveness and accountability towards its citizens, through increasing transparency in government and ethical behavior by public officials. The Project has two main objectives: 1) to continue efforts to support various levels of theSalvadoran government to increase responsiveness and accountability towards its citizens, through increasing transparency in government and ethical behavior by public officials, reducing conditions for corruption in public administration, strengthening the link between citizens and government, and thereby increasing confidence in the system; and 2) to continue to foster civil society participation, particularly the private sector, in promoting transparency, accountability and control of corruption in the use of public funds.

Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Improved Management and Conservation of Critical Watersheds (IMCCW)
Activity Description: Many inhabitants of the ecological corridors and watersheds of western El Salvador employ farming and other practices that contribute to environmental degradationtrends that threaten the sustainability of critical ecosystems, degrade water supplies and quality, and bind farmers to environmentally destructive subsistence farming. At the same time, growing markets for certified specialty coffees, high-quality fruits and vegetables, and ecotourism offer opportunities to generate income and improve environmental quality. To improve the economic situation in rural areas, the Government of El Salvadors development strategy focuses on enlisting local support for improved natural resources and generating better economic opportunities through higher-value agriculture and sustainable tourism, linked to improved management of El Salvadors water, land, and biological resources.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Human Development Project
Activity Description: The Education and Training Activity seeks to increase education and skill levels of the Northern Zone's poor by expanding the quality of, and access to, vocational and technical education and training. It is comprised of three sub-activities: technical assistance; formal technical education; and non-formal skills development. The Technical Assistance Sub-Activity will bolster capacity of institutions and organizations involved in policy, planning, and administration of education and training in the Northern Zone. MCC Funding will be used to procure the services of a long-term technical assistance provider that will support Implementing Entities. The Formal Technical Education Sub-Activity aims to strengthen technical/vocational education institutions in the Northern Zone, so that more youth can gain marketable skills and thereby increase their opportunities for employment and income generation. The Non-Formal Skills Development Sub-Activity will complement the Formal Technical Education Sub-Activity by supporting non-credit, short term and pre-employment training offerings.

US Sector Name: Rule of Law and Human Rights
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: To support El Salvador's efforts to strengthen the Rule of Law
Activity Description: The program will develop the judiciary into a more effective, independent branch of the government; increase citizen trust; improve functioning of the courts and strengthen capacity of individuals within the judiciary.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Implementing Partner Sub-category ID: Universities and Research Institutes - United States
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Municipal Competitiveness Project (MCP)
Activity Description: With the goal of creating an environment for municipalities to attract investment, improve economic development, and generate jobs across the country, RTI is providing technical assistance to improve municipal policies and practices so that they better serve private sector needs; institutionalizing the Municipal Competitiveness Index (MCI)designed and piloted in 2009 by RTI with support from USAIDto measure municipal performance over time and maintain the momentum for reform; and stimulating public-private engagement, entrepreneurship development, and improved access to finance for small and medium enterprises.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Office of Development Partner
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacin Empresarial para el Desarrollo Educativo (El Salvador)
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Strengthening Basic Education
Activity Description: The EQUIP2 El Salvador Strengthening Basic Education Project is the compilation of an integrated group of activities that assist El Salvadors Ministry of Education efforts to help achieve the goals of the National Education Plan 2021. The project is funded by USAID through the EQUIP2 mechanism with implementing partners Academy for Educational Development (AED), Research Triangle International (RTI), and Mariposa Consulting. EQUIP2 El Salvador has two main goals. The first is to support educational policies aimed at increasing the quality and quantity of social investment and improving transparency of the educational sector. The second is to increase and improve basic education opportunities.

Activity Name: USAID |DELIVER
Activity Description: The USAID | DELIVER Project is a five year, worldwide project to design, develop, strengthen, and upon request, operate safe, reliable and sustainable supply systems that provide a range of affordable, quality essential health commodities including drugs, diagnostics, contraceptives and supplies to clients in country programs. The project will improve the availability of essential health supplies in public and private services by strengthening country supply systems, collaborating with global and regional partners for long-term availability of supplies, and improving USAIDs provision of supplies to country programs.

Activity Name: Youth-led Community Museum in Suchitoto, Cuscatln
Activity Description: CAP will improve and expand its community museum in the municipality of Suchitoto, develop the leadership skills of at-risk young adults and train them in audio-visual production so that they can document and disseminate Suchitoto's history and generate revenue through tourism activities and sales. CAP will also train young Salvadorans to conduct guided tours of Lake Suchitln that emphasize the history of the municipality of Suchitoto, will purchase and equip a boat for tours and will hire the necessary staff to help the center earn income.

Activity Description: IMU will work with women in three grassroots associations in the department of Ahuachapn to improve their income, their food supply, and their leadership and organizational skills. With IMU's support, these farmers will raise livestock, cultivate organic vegetables, learn to produce and apply organic fertilizer and pesticide, and acquire better access to markets.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Democracy, Conflict and Humanitarian Assistance
US Sector Name: Rule of Law and Human Rights
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Justice System
Activity Description: Improve the capacity and sustainability of civil and criminal justice sector actors and institutions, enhance coordination amongst them, develop citizen demand for an effective and accountable justice system, and develop associations to advocate for all citizens. Justice sector actors and institutions include: police, border security, prosecutors, forensics experts, judges, court personnel, public defenders, corrections personnel, private bar, law schools, legal professional associations, and training institutions for each of them. Work towards an equitable justice system by ensuring equality before the law, fair trial standards, and other elements of procedural fairness. Ensure more equitable access to justice through innovations within and beyond the state system and through improvements in the quality and quantity of justice services, with a particular focus on women, youth, the poor, and other marginalized or vulnerable groups. Programs primarily focused on trafficking in persons or migrant smuggling should be included in element 5.3 under the Transnational Crime area in the Peace and Security Objective.

Activity Name: Revitalization, Cultivation and Sales of Indigo in Cuisnahuat, Sonsonate
Activity Description: EL BLSAMO will work with farmers in Cuisnahuat, Sonsonate, to revitalize the organic cultivation of indigo. Farmers will improve their indigo crop and process it into dye to market. They will also produce organic fertilizer and pesticide for their own use and for sale and develop their management and marketing skills as a cooperative. EL BLSAMO will also improve its processing infrastructure and offer other support to farmers participating in its project to revitalize the organic cultivation of indigo in Cuisnahuat, Sonsonate.

Activity Name: Natural Resources and Biodiversity
Activity Description: Conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. Programs in this element should be integrated with the Agriculture Area under Economic Growth and Conflict Mitigation and Reconciliation Area under the Peace and Security Objective, when applicable and appropriate.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Asociacin de Comunidades Campesinas Angel Mara (ACCAM)
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: ACCAM - Loroco - Processing Plant and Marketing/Export Strategy
Activity Description: ACCAM will improve the income of about 85 farmers and 170 laborers in the community of Acachapa, department of Sonsonate, through training and technical assistance in the production and marketing of loroco, a wild vine native to El Salvador that produces edible flower clusters used primarily in pupusas, stuffed corn tortillas. The harvest will be processed, packaged and sold locally or exported. Consumption of loroco will be encouraged to improve the local diet. (ES-223)

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
International Purpose Name: Public sector policy and administrative management
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Transparency and Governance Project
Activity Description: To support various levels of the Salvadoran Government to increase responsiveness and accountability towards its citizens, through increasing transparency in government and ethical behavior by public officials. The Project has two main objectives: 1) to continue efforts to support various levels of theSalvadoran government to increase responsiveness and accountability towards its citizens, through increasing transparency in government and ethical behavior by public officials, reducing conditions for corruption in public administration, strengthening the link between citizens and government, and thereby increasing confidence in the system; and 2) to continue to foster civil society participation, particularly the private sector, in promoting transparency, accountability and control of corruption in the use of public funds.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Bureau for Latin America and Caribbean
Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: Anti-Corruption Reforms
Activity Description: Promote governance institutions, processes, and policies that are transparent and accountable across all development sectors. Support non-governmental as well as governmental institutions (including enforcement and investigation entities, independent audit agencies, anti-corruption commissions, procurement agencies, legislatures, line ministries, independent agencies, political parties, judicial actors, as well as civil society organizations, academia, press and the private sector). Support civic education and advocacy for reform of laws and practices or directly improving accountability and transparency of governance processes covering various development sectors.

Funding Account Name: Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Activity Name: AmericasBarometer
Activity Description: Vanderbilt University conducts AmericasBarometer democracy, governance and citizen security surveys in Latin America and Caribbean countries and related country and regional analyses. Country reports and, when requested, oversampling reports can be prepared that compare results from areas with USAID-programs to the rest of the country. The biennial survey includes 40,000 survey across 25 countries in the hemisphere. Vanderbilt is also conducting an impact evaluation of the Agencys crime prevention activities under the Central America Regional Security Initiative (CARSI) in Guatemala, El Salvador and Panama.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: Educational and Cultural Affairs
Funding Account Name: Department of State, Educational and Cultural Exchange Programs,
Activity Name: Preservation of Prehistoric Rock Art at El Espiritu Santo Cave
Activity Description: To support the documentation and conservation of rock art in El Espiritu Santo Cave. The estimated 200 paintings and petroglyphs, which specialists speculate are between 6,000 and 10,000 years old, are highly susceptible to damage from severe rains and other environmental factors. The project involves the creation of a detailed topographical map, graphic and digital recordings of the art, and a conservation assessment as a preliminary step in the development of a comprehensive management plan for the site.

Managing Sub-agency or Bureau Name: not applicable
Implementing Partner Name: Fundacion Museo de la Palabra y la Imagen
Funding Account Name: Inter-American Foundation
Activity Name: MUPI - Creating Space for Cultural Development
Activity Description: MUPI will educate approximately 10,000 youths in metropolitan San Salvador and rural areas in the social and cultural history of El Salvador through a series of films, publications, and exhibits and other cultural events. It will work with public school teachers and community leaders in developing its programs. MUPI will also consolidate museum operations and access to archival materials through professional training and improved technology. MUPI will also conduct museum tours, organize educational events applying improved technology and archive materials related to Salvadoran social and cultural history.

Activity Name: Program Support (Civil Society)
Activity Description: Establish and/or develop a broadly functioning independent media sector, which is a crucial factor in democratic governance. Building this sector is accomplished through such activities as providing infrastructure and equipment to ensure access to information, shaping the media legal and regulatory environment, boosting professional capacity of the media sector, promoting sustainability through encouraging media-related business development and sound financial/management practices, and supporting advocacy and networking among media sector organizations.

International Purpose Name: Multisector aid for basic social services
Funding Account Name: Millennium Challenge Corporation, Expenses
Activity Name: MCC Human Development Project
Activity Description: The Community Development Activity aims to dramatically increase access of the Northern Zone's poor to basic public services and infrastructure. The Community Infrastructure Sub-Activity will improve the connection among isolated communities and villages in the Northern Zone while ensuring sustainable management of natural resources. Specifically, MCC Funding will support the following: (1) Feasibility, design, and environmental assessment to include sitespecific EIAs, EMPs, and RAPs, as needed, of community infrastructure development; (2) Rehabilitation and construction of community infrastructure such as small roads and drainage works, retaining walls, pedestrian crossings and small bridges; and (3) Technical assistance to communities and municipalities on infrastructure O&M.
